title: Why a Pilot Is Under Investigation for Saying Lets Go Brandon
description: It began as a chant at a NASCAR race. It became an inside joke among many Republicans that spread to T-shirts and even to the floor of Congress. And now it has entangled Southwest Airlines in the nations political tussles.

title: Succession Season 3, Episode 3: Head Spaces and Hullabaloo
description: (Check out a recap of the latest episode in Season 3 of Succession)

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Presidents and prime ministers are gathering in Glasgow this week for the 12-day U.N. global warming conference, often referred to as COP26, to discuss global climate policies, which are likely to determine the future of the planet.

title: What Is a Carbon Footprint? And 12 Other Climate Buzzwords
description: As climate change discussions take center stage in Glasgow, heres a primer on some of the jargon youre likely to hear a lot.

title: Insecure Recap, Season 5, Episode 2: Pick Up Your Feelings
description: (Read the recap of the latest episode in Season 5 of Insecure)

title: Word of the Day: conflagration
New Black N.B.A. Coaches Wonder Why It Took So Long to Get a Shot
description: Jamahl Mosley has traveled the world for basketball.

title: Once a Leading Polluter, the U.K. Is Now Trying to Lead on Climate Change
description: LONDON  As Britain prepares to host a landmark climate summit in Glasgow this week, the milestones of its own evolution to a more climate-friendly economy are on vivid display along the railroad line from London to Scotland.

title: How Much Are Countries Pledging to Reduce Emissions?
description: The newest plans by countries to fight climate change still fall short of what scientists say is necessary. Heres what the 10 biggest emitters have promised.

title: Facing Elimination, the Houston Astros Find Their Bats
description: ATLANTA  Adam Duvall swung and the baseball sailed high and deep and, surely, toward the history books. The 43,122 Atlanta fans filling Truist Park, early arrivals and in the mood to party with a clinching World Series win within reach, exploded into a raucous din. They believed the grand slam, only the 21st in World Series history, signaled their divine right to celebrate.

title: No Corrections: Nov. 1, 2021
description: Errors are corrected during the press run whenever possible, so some errors noted here may not have appeared in all editions.

title: Whats on TV This Week: The Oratorio and Dexter: New Blood
description: Between network, cable and streaming, the modern television landscape is a vast one. Here are some of the shows, specials and movies coming to TV this week, Nov. 1-7. Details and times are subject to change.

title: Would Russia or China Help Us if We Were Invaded by Space Aliens?
description: In a recent essay on great-power competition and climate change, Rob Litwak, an arms control expert at the Wilson Center, recalled a question that President Ronald Reagan posed to Mikhail Gorbachev, the Soviet leader, after they took a walk during their 1985 Lake Geneva summit.

title: New Zealand Held a Bird Contest. A Bat Won.
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand  The candidates didnt know they were running. The winner received no prize. And, at least by appearance, the champion appeared to be ineligible to compete.

title: Some Australians are allowed to return home as border rules ease.
description: After being separated from his parents for two years, Jimmy Sugandi, 42, touched down on Monday in Melbourne, Australia, after traveling from Indonesia with his wife and two young children.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: MONDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: To Protest Irans Anti-Gay Abuses, an Artist Painted a Dictators Car
description: The Paykan was the first car manufactured in Iran. Produced from 1967 to 2015, it started life as a licensed copy of an outmoded British vehicle, the Hillman Hunter, but it nevertheless became a symbol of national pride, priced for middle-class Iranians.

title: Banks Tried to Kill Crypto and Failed. Now Theyre Embracing It (Slowly).
description: In 2014, as regulators in New York were exploring ways to control Bitcoin, executives at Wall Streets biggest banks fretted that regulating cryptocurrencies would also legitimize them  and that could threaten the finance industry. So they tried to sow doubt.

title: What Does It Mean to Be a New York Democrat These Days?
description: [Follow our live coverage of N.Y.C. elections.]

title: BIPOC or POC? Equity or Equality? The Debate Over Language on the Left.
description: In California, a Black college freshman from the South is telling a story about his Latino friends from home when he is interrupted by a white classmate. We say Latinx here, he recalls her saying, using a term he had not heard before, because we respect trans people.

title: Quotation of the Day: On the Left, a New Scramble Over the Right Words to Say
description: When youve been on the margin, being able to claim a language and a narrative and a set of words to express yourself is incredibly important.

title: Run the Numbers: Exploring the Math Behind Any N.F.L. Teams Playoff Chances
description: Featured article: 2021 N.F.L. Playoff Picture: Every Teams Playoff Chances

title: Climate conference kicks off in Glasgow with floods and low expectations.
description: GLASGOW  The first day of climate talks got off to a rocky start.

title: Michael Bloomberg announces an effort to shut down coal in 25 countries.
description: Michael R. Bloomberg, the billionaire and former mayor of New York City, intends to announce on Monday an effort to shut down coal in 25 countries.

title: James Staley, Barclayss C.E.O., steps down after a Jeffrey Epstein inquiry.
description: More than two years after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in a Manhattan jail cell, the consequences of associating with the convicted sex offender continue to reverberate through the highest echelons of the business world.

title: What to watch for on Monday at COP26.
description: The next two days of the United Nations-led climate talks in Glasgow will be an opportunity to hear from nearly 100 heads of state and governments on what steps they plan to take to tackle climate change.

title: One Final Day of Campaigning
description: Its Monday. Well take a last look at the campaigns and the candidates. Did I mention that tomorrow is Election Day?

title: Bidens Glasgow pitch: This time, the U.S. is serious about climate change.
description: In Glasgow, President Biden will try to convince a gathering of world leaders that the United States, which has pumped more greenhouse gases into the atmosphere than any other nation, is finally serious about addressing climate change and that others should follow its lead.

title: Kenneth Branagh Is Finally Processing His Childhood Trauma
description: I hesitate to use the word  a cardinal sin for my parents was to be suggesting that anything youd been through was worthy of categorizing in such a way.

title: What Is a Meaningful Family Relationship That You Have?
description: In Kuya, an illustrated piece by the artist AJ Dungo, he tells the story of his relationship with his older brother, who struggles with mental illness. He is proud of his brothers courage, and he sees far beyond any negative labels that society might put on his brother.

title: Sex Bots, Religion and the Wild World of A.I.
description: As Tesla develops its humanoid robot and Facebook  sorry, now Meta  rebrands to signal its focus on the metaverse and an even more virtual world, some might continue to wonder whether an Armageddon that will have artificial intelligence overpowering humans is a possibility. But the novelist Jeanette Winterson is more optimistic. Her more utopian view of an A.I.-enabled future depends on more compassionate technologies and the diversification of the leaders driving innovation, who she says are currently rich guys with a lot of power, and we cant depend on their benevolence.

title: I Just Turned 60, but I Still Feel 22
description: NASHVILLE  I was already in college before I finally understood that my entire life had overlapped with second-wave feminism, a force that transformed American culture without so much as registering on a certain young woman in Alabama. All my life I had been stepping through open doors, it turned out, blithely unaware of the vision and sacrifice and passionate persistence of the women who had opened those doors for me.

title: What Were Watching on Election Day and Movie Night
description: Bret Stephens: Hi, Gail. No Republican has won a statewide election in Virginia since 2009. And Joe Biden took the state by more than 10 percentage points last year. But now the polls are showing a dead heat between the Democratic candidate, Terry McAuliffe, and his Republican opponent, Glenn Youngkin, in Tuesdays race.

title: Laugh at the S.N.L. School Board Skit, Take Your Local Politics Seriously
description: Angry activists have commandeered so many routine school board meetings in the past few months that Saturday Night Live  which typically reserves its political satire for politicians on the national stage  recently devoted a segment to satirizing one of these raucous meetings. Less humorously, Attorney General Merrick Garland has launched a push to address the nationwide uptick in violent threats against school board members, teachers and public school workers.

title: Shopping for Alarm Clocks
description: With clocks being set back Sunday, at the end of daylight saving time, it will be hard to deny that winter is on the way, and many of us may feel temporarily out of sorts.

title: If the New Supreme Court Stymies Gun Safety Laws, What Comes Next?
description: The gun safety movement finds itself on the precipice of disaster.

title: Can Supersonic Air Travel Fly Again?
description: Despite the promise of two-hour flights from New York to Los Angeles, the supersonic airline industry never really got off the ground. That is largely because of physics: specifically, the sonic boom, the thunderclap noise made when an aircraft breaks the sound barrier (and continues as the aircraft flies beyond the barrier), which essentially doomed supersonic aviation as a viable business.

title: Supreme Court Hints That It May Allow Challenge to Texas Abortion Law
description: WASHINGTON  After almost three hours of lively arguments on Monday at the Supreme Court, a majority of the justices seemed inclined to allow abortion providers  but perhaps not the Biden administration  to pursue a federal court challenge to a Texas law that has sharply curtailed abortions in the state.

title: The Accidental Wine Educator
description: The history of wine in the United States owes a lot to something of a happy accident.

title: Supreme Court Tries to Tame Unruly Oral Arguments
description: WASHINGTON  Justices Sonia Sotomayor and Clarence Thomas may not agree about much, but they have both said the Supreme Courts oral arguments have been plagued by too many interruptions. A few years ago and again this fall, the court took steps to address their concerns.

title: The TV Hit That Wasnt
description: It was one of the most dramatic episodes of the season. Monica Lewinsky, the heroine of Impeachment: American Crime Story, strikes an immunity deal with federal prosecutors, and President Bill Clinton admits to having had an affair to a grand jury and the nation as a whole. The episode also brought Hillary Clinton, portrayed by Edie Falco, to center stage for the first time.

title: After the Flood, Its Not Just About the Coming Back
description: MILLBURN, N.J.  To survive the pandemics waves, Kevin Cao, the owner of Thai House Restaurant, halted dine-in service, cut five staff members and kept his drunken noodles, pad thai and curry moving with curbside pickup and delivery.

title: Desperate for Housing Options, Communities Turn to Ballot Initiatives
description: LEADVILLE, Colo.  A small-business owner in a town fueled by vacationers is an unconventional proponent for a tax increase on tourists. But Marcee Lundeen sees few other choices.

title: N.Y. Cabbies Stage Hunger Strike for More Aid: Were Not Backing Down
description: When Mayor Bill de Blasio announced in March a plan to spend tens of millions of dollars to help New Yorks taxi drivers, many praised the move. For years, officials had stood by as cabbies were channeled into exploitative loans that crushed them under mountains of debt. Finally, it seemed, the city was fixing an injustice.

title: The Stunning Grandeur of Soviet-Era Metros
description: It was a cold day in December 2014, and I was waiting for the train at Shchukinskaya, a station on the Tagansko-Krasnopresnenskaya Line of the Moscow Metro.

title: A Timeline of the Kyle Rittenhouse Shootings and His Trial
description: Follow our live Kyle Rittenhouse trial verdict coverage.

title: Greta Thunberg joins a protest in Glasgow.
description: As Greta Thunberg joined scores of protesters on the streets outside the United Nations climate conference in Glasgow on Monday, an online petition that she helped start quickly drew more than a million signatures.

title: Roe Is as Good as Gone. Its Time for a New Strategy.
description: For the first time in a generation, the Supreme Court appears likely to overturn Roe v. Wade. The end of Roe need not herald the end of an era of reproductive freedom. It may instead launch a new strategy that protects the fundamental human right to decide whether to have children and raise them in safety and dignity.

title: How Much Do You Know About the Solomon Islands?
description: Can you find Solomon Islands on a map? What else do you know about this South Pacific island nation with about 350,000 people.

title: Whos attending (Biden and Modi), and who isnt (Putin and Xi).
description: When President Biden was asked in Rome on Sunday about criticism of the worlds wealthiest economies to do more to address climate change, he noted to absence of two key players: China and Russia.

title: Why Do So Many Traffic Stops Go Wrong?
description: This episode contains strong language and scenes of violence.

title: A World Series of Relievers, Like It or Not
description: ATLANTA  Greg Maddux leads all living people in major league victories, with 355. He tossed the ceremonial first pitch before Game 5 of the World Series on Sunday at Truist Park. Tucker Davidson is tied with roughly 7.8 billion other people for last place in major league victories, with zero. He threw the first pitch that counted.

title: John Kerry is already looking toward next year to push countries to do more.
description: John Kerry, who helped clinch the Paris climate agreement in 2015 as secretary of state and who came out of retirement to become President Bidens climate envoy, arrives on Monday with a carefully crafted message for the United Nations summit: It is critically important but not the last chance for action.

title: How to Prevent Climate Disasters
description: The world has made more progress combating climate change than you may realize.

title: Chinas push to burn more coal puts climate goals at risk.
description: China, the worlds biggest user of fossil fuels, has taken big steps in recent days to address the global energy shortage this fall and to fight inflation, but the moves come at considerable cost to efforts to halt climate change.

title: N.Y.C.s vaccination rate for city workers climbs to 91 percent, and 9,000 are put on unpaid leave.
description: New York City started to enforce its Covid vaccine mandate for municipal workers on Monday, and about 9,000 workers who refused to get vaccinated were placed on unpaid leave.

title: Why Jeffrey Epstein Cost Barclayss C.E.O. His Job
description: Barclays announced this morning that Jes Staley had stepped down as C.E.O. after he and its board learned of the results of a two-year investigation by British regulators into his ties to Jeffrey Epstein. This makes Staley the latest business leader to face repercussions from their association with the convicted sex offender.

title: Stream These 11 Titles Before They Leave Netflix in November
description: Two much-loved television series leave Netflix in the United States this November, along with some heartbreaking dramas, Dad movies, an Oscar winner for best picture and vehicles for the comic talents of Seth Rogen and Jack Black. Find out about those and more of this months catch-them-while-you-can titles, below. (Dates reflect the final day a title is available.)

title: Thailand reopens to tourists from 63 countries without requiring quarantine.
description: Thailand reopened on Monday to fully vaccinated tourists arriving by air from 63 countries as it strives to revive its economy despite struggling to reduce Covid-19 case numbers.

title: Are Global Warming Summits Still Cool?
description: Few states support climate action as enthusiastically as California. But the Golden State isnt sending a governor to the United Nations climate change summit this year. Gov. Gavin Newsom is not going, and neither are his predecessors in the office. Thats both unusual and a little telling.

title: 7 Takeaways From Huma Abedins Memoir
description: Toward the end of her new memoir, Both/And: A Life in Many Worlds, Huma Abedin recalls what she said to her estranged husband, the former Democratic Representative Anthony Weiner, when the F.B.I. seized his laptop less than two weeks before the 2016 presidential election.

title: Huma Abedin Has Been to Hell and Back. Now Shes Gingerly Telling the Tale.
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: What You Get for $4.5 Million in California
description: A 1912 Beaux-Arts home in San Francisco, a four-bedroom house in Mill Valley and a penthouse loft in an Art Deco building in Los Angeles.

title: $4.5 Million Homes in California
description: This house is in West Clay Park, a neighborhood that was developed in the 1910s and is known for its stately homes and quiet, tree-lined streets. It has been owned by the same family for 60 years and has been well maintained inside and out. The original molding and wainscoting in many rooms has been preserved, and the grand facade still has its original stucco garlands and a niche with an original statue.

title: Choose Me! Rose-worthy Romance Novels
description: We will never reach a general sense of how realistic  or unrealistic  the romance genre is because with romance, every generalization is a trap. Some people will confidently tell you that romance novels are old-fashioned tools of the patriarchy; other people will just as confidently explain that romance is innately progressive and feminist.

title: The Philly Special Comes to New York
description: The Jets and the Giants have both used the trick play within the last two weeks. See how they did it.

title: The U.N. leader warns that the world faces a climate catastrophe.
description: The United Nations secretary general, Antnio Guterres, on Monday issued a blistering critique of the worlds failure to rein in global warming, calling on countries to return every year to review their climate targets  not every five years, as the Paris climate agreement spells out.

title: Handball Federation Ends Bikini Bottom Requirement for Women
description: The International Handball Federation has updated its rules so that women will no longer be required to play in bikini bottoms, responding to months of pressure from female players and coaches who described the uniform requirements as sexist.

title: Heres what the Texas law prohibits.
description: The Texas law, known as Senate Bill 8, bars abortions once cardiac activity can be detected in an embryo. Such activity consists of electrical pulses that can be picked up on ultrasound but are not yet true heartbeats, since heart valves form later in the process of embryonic development.

title: David Attenborough urges summit participants to help rewrite our story.
description: David Attenborough, one of Britains most trusted public figures and among the worlds most recognizable voices for Earths natural beauty, implored leaders to use the COP26 summit as a climate turning point, creating a more equitable world in the process.

title: Europe Fears That Rising Cost of Climate Action Is Stirring Anger
description: PARIS  Raucous demonstrations against high energy bills in Spain. Demands for social protection in Greece as coal mines close. Fresh protests in French rural areas and small towns over spiking petrol prices.

title: Why is it so hard to challenge the Texas law?
description: It is hard to challenge the Texas law because it was written in a novel way: It effectively deputizes private citizens to enforce it, and bans the state government from doing so.

title: A 6-Hour Opera in a Pandemic? The Met Goes for It.
description: As cultural institutions come back to life this fall after the long pandemic shutdown, many are trying to lure audiences back with shorter shows, often free of intermissions.

title: The official global virus death toll has passed five million. The full count is undoubtedly higher.
description: The coronavirus is responsible for more than five million confirmed deaths around the world as of Monday, according to data from the Center for Systems Science and Engineering at Johns Hopkins University. Such a loss would wipe out almost the entire population of Melbourne, Australia, or most of the nation of Singapore.

title: Marc Hearron, attorney for abortion providers, has deep Texas ties.
description: Abortion clinics and providers challenging the Texas anti-abortion law will be represented before the Supreme Court on Monday by Marc Hearron, senior counsel for the Center for Reproductive Rights.

title: After Violent Standoff, Pakistan Strikes Deal With Banned Islamist Group
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistan averted a political showdown on Monday as officials reopened a key national highway that supporters of a militant Islamist group had occupied for days, following a secret pact between the government and the group.

title: Judd Stone II, the Texas solicitor general, makes his Supreme Court debut.
description: Judd Stone II, a former clerk to the conservative Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia, was named solicitor general of Texas earlier this year. On Monday, he will take on his most high-profile challenge to date: arguing before the Supreme Court on behalf of the state in two challenges to its new anti-abortion law.

title: Muriel Lezak, Leading Authority on Brain Injuries, Dies at 94
description: Muriel Lezak, a neuropsychologist who wrote a landmark textbook in the early days of her discipline that became an essential guide to the description and evaluation of brain injuries and disorders, died on Oct. 6 in Portland, Ore. She was 94.

title: A Special Steak Dinner
description: Good morning. I had a lovely meal the other night at Balthazar, in the SoHo district of Manhattan, folded into a booth with an excellent view of scenesters and tourists, arts-adjacent money people, date-night couples and Gucci-clad birthday groups. Central to my enjoyment of the evening was a salad I think you might try to make at home, using Julia Moskins ace recipe for mustard-shallot vinaigrette.

title: Audra McDonald to Star in Ohio State Murders on Broadway
description: The actress Audra McDonald has agreed to star in a Broadway production of Ohio State Murders, bringing the work of the eminent experimental playwright Adrienne Kennedy to the nations most prominent stage for the first time.

title: How the Pandemic Has Added to Labor Unrest
description: When 420 workers at the Heaven Hill spirits bottling plant near Louisville went on strike in September, they were frustrated that the companys proposed contract could reduce their overtime pay. Many had earned extra income working seven days a week during the pandemic.

title: Readers Farewell to Nicholas Kristof, One of a Kind
description: To the Editor:

title: Will Justice Brett Kavanaugh change his position?
description: Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh, who voted with the majority in September to allow the Texas law to come into effect, may be the member of the court most open to switching sides on the issue. Though his voting record in abortion cases has consistently supported abortion restrictions, he has made occasional comments staking out more moderate positions than those of his colleagues.

title: Egypt Poised to Expand Security Powers of President and Military
description: CAIRO  Egypt is poised to expand the national security powers of the president and military with legislation that will strengthen the hand of the countrys authoritarian government, just as it had appeared to relax its grip last week with the lifting of a longstanding state of emergency.

title: Biden Promised to Fix Home Care for Seniors. Much More Help May Be Needed.
description: Spinal surgery four years ago left Alene Shaheed in a wheelchair and dependent on short daily visits from home health aides to help her get around.

title: Biden calls for tougher action on emissions and promises job gains worldwide.
description: President Biden told world leaders on Monday that we only have a brief window before us to raise our ambitions to fight climate change, warning that climate disasters were already imposing trillions of dollars of economic costs but offering hope that a shift to lower-emission energy sources could create millions of jobs around the world.

title: Amid Climate Talks, an Actors Call to Action Unfolds Onstage
description: The actor Fehinti Balogun knows that theater can mobilize people toward climate action, because thats what it did for him.

title: India Walton Beat Byron Brown in Buffalo. Hes Back With a Rubber Stamp.
description: [Follow our live New York election results.]

title: Quenching San Diegos Thirst With Seawater
description: A tour through the $1 billion facility that generates 50 million gallons of fresh drinking water a day.

title: Live at La Grenouille: Caviar, Crystal and the Owners Flashy Crooning
description: Around 9:15 on a recent Wednesday evening, the mood in the full but otherwise serene dining room of La Grenouille suddenly shifted.

title: Are Too Many Older Adults Told They Have Kidney Disease?
description: If the public has learned anything about medicine during the Covid-19 pandemic, it is that science is constantly evolving. New findings can change how experts define a given illness, as well as how they diagnose, prevent and treat it.

title: What is Ex Parte Young, much-discussed in the Texas abortion case?
description: As the Supreme Court struggled on Monday with whether it could or should block Texas courts from hearing lawsuits by private citizens against abortion providers under the states novel anti-abortion law, a 1908 case called Ex Parte Young kept coming up.

title: The Biden administration will publish vaccine mandate rules in the coming days.
description: The Biden administration will release the highly anticipated details of a federal vaccine mandate for private employers in coming days, a representative for the Department of Labor said Monday. When the details become public, a flurry of corporate vaccine mandates is expected to follow.

title: The Novavax vaccine, backed by Operation Warp Speed, has won its first authorization  in Indonesia.
description: Novavax, a Maryland-based company that received $1.75 billion from the United States government to develop a protein-based Covid-19 vaccine, announced Monday it had won emergency authorization for its vaccine in Indonesia.

title: Dr. Aaron T. Beck, Developer of Cognitive Therapy, Dies at 100
description: Dr. Aaron T. Beck, whose brand of pragmatic, thought-monitoring psychotherapy became the centerpiece of a scientific transformation in the treatment of depression, anxiety and many related mental disorders, died on Monday at his home in Philadelphia. He was 100.

title: Drake Earns a Fifth Week at No. 1 Ahead of Musics Major Fall Releases
description: Before Ed Sheeran, Taylor Swift and Adele make themselves known on the Billboard album chart, there is still Drake.

title: Subway Scenes: Halloween Returns With a Vengeance
description: For long stretches of the last year and a half, scenes of New York Citys subway system  a once-bustling underground thoroughfare suddenly plunged into eerie emptiness by the spread of the coronavirus  felt haunting.

title: A Close Look at My Day of the Dead Altar
description: Mexicos Day of the Dead is one of the countrys most important celebrations, with ofrendas, or altars, to honor loved ones who have died a central tradition. Heres a look at mine.

title: Amazon to Launch First Two Internet Satellites in 2022
description: Amazon is getting ready to go to space.

title: An Uncommon Rise for Bread
description: The pandemic gave rise to a passion for sourdough among countless home bakers. But how many of them tackled the possibly more finicky salt-rising technique for bread, an American tradition that dates back to 18th century Appalachia? Its not too late to learn. A Zoom event organized by the Culinary Historians of New York and led by Jenny Bardwell, a Culinary Institute of America graduate and a scholar of salt-rising, will explore the topic. Ms. Bardwell, who wrote Salt-Rising Bread: Recipes and Heartfelt Stories of a Nearly Lost Appalachian Tradition with Susan Ray Brown, will be baking bread in her kitchen in Pennsylvania during the talk. She also plans to discuss salt-rising in other countries, including Greece.

title: A Preserves Maker Turns to Tea
description: Bonne Maman, a popular maker of preserves and jellies, has added herbal teas to its inventory. It also uses wellness as a selling point with each variety supposedly devised to bring delight, vitality, serenity and so forth, something that has become de rigueur for many products. These teas dont need it; theyre lovely enough on their own and they all induce pleasure. There are five blends, each a mix of ingredients like lemon verbena, lavender, elderflower, star anise, peppermint, licorice, lemongrass, yarrow, cranberry and the like, and, depending on the ingredients, each has a dominant flavor like lemon, anise or mint coming through.

title: The Best Places to Watch the New York City Marathon
description: The New York City Marathon, one of the worlds largest marathons, is back. This years race will be smaller, with 30,000 runners instead of the usual 55,000. But it is expected to be a major, and emotional, milestone in New Yorks recovery from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Review: Porgy and Bess Returns to a New Opera Landscape
description: George Gershwins Porgy and Bess is both easy and impossible to love.

title: Tiny Bubbles on the Walls
description: Last year because of the pandemic there was but a single virtual grand tasting for La Fte du Champagne, the annual extravaganza of tastings and dinners organized by Daniel Johnnes. This year from Saturday through Nov. 14 it has a fuller docket: a mix of Zoom tastings, gala dinners and a major new event  an immersive experience, with participants surrounded by wall projections like the all-encompassing van Gogh exhibits but with Champagne bottles, not sunflowers. Given in 30-minute segments, Nov. 12 through 14 from 2 p.m. to 10 p.m., it will involve traversing several levels of display, a glass of Champagne in hand, $35, at the Lightbox (248 West 37th Street). For the rest of the schedule, the virtual Zoom sessions include two free sessions on Friday, with the rest $25 each with an option to purchase wines for tasting.

title: Peking Duck With Added Fire
description: At its locations in Hong Kong Dubai, Hutong has been serving flaming Peking duck. Now the newly reopened dining room of the lavish restaurant chains New York branch also offers the glistening duck licked with blue fire tableside. More than mere floor show, the duck is seasoned with a chile-forward marinade. The flaming is said to impart extra crispness to the skin. Regardless, it is delicious, a whole well-burnished duck expertly carved, presented with accouterments, including sauces other than hoisin, and enough to serve four, $116. A second course is made with the meat left after slicing, minced with vegetables in a lettuce wrap, for a dish thats more Cantonese than Beijing. As of now only five flaming ducks are available a night Monday through Thursday evenings to book in advance. The fireworks will be coming to the restaurant chains Miami location soon.

title: The 2021 Holiday Gift Guide
description: What should you get for all the beloved but quirky, picky, fancy, practical or eccentric people in your life? Let our experts help.

title: Stick or Block, This Butter Saver Holds It All
description: The creators of the Butter Hub have tried to think of everything when it comes to butter storage and have probably succeeded for households that do not mind plastic on the table. It comes with a stainless steel spreader that clings to a magnet on top of the cover; the cover has legs so it sits above the table surface to keep it clean; and inside the base a couple of little ski jumps at either end help remove pats from the knife. The Butter Hub is made in six colors as well as clear, and can fit American quarter-pound sticks or wider, European and Asian (and Plugra) eight-ounce blocks. Its also dishwasher-safe. Theres an earlier, discounted model that cannot go into the dishwasher.

title: The Story of a Craft Beer Pioneer
description: Dogfish Head, the brewery founded in 1995 in Rehoboth Beach, Del., by Sam Calagione and his wife, Mariah Calagione, has gone on to become a leading craft brewer releasing dozens of beers each year. Located in Milton, Del., it is now a subsidiary of The Boston Beer Company and has added a distillery, several restaurants and an inn. How a kid kicked out of prep school accomplished it all is the backbone of The Dogfish Head Book, a new overstuffed book that chronicles the trajectory. Mr. Calagione went from home-brewed cherry pale ale to a company that produces more than a quarter-million barrels of beer a year. Many of the beers, including the archaeologically researched Midas Touch Ancient Ale, are described in detail, along with comments from fans and employees.

title: From the Amazon to Glasgow: An Indigenous activist says, We have no more time.
description: It was the kind of spotlight associated with a certain other young climate activist: A hall full of world leaders and a speaking slot preceding the secretary general of the United Nations.

title: Narendra Modi says India will sharply increase renewable energy.
description: India announced on Monday that it would significantly expand renewable energy sources in its total energy mix and called on the rich world to pony up $1 trillion to help developing countries make the energy transition.

title: James Ivory, Famous for Buttoned-Up Films, Is Frank About Sex and Much Else in His Memoir
description: The movie director James Ivory is most closely associated with decorous period pieces, paeans to inhibition like Howards End and The Remains of the Day, so I wasnt expecting his memoirs to be quite such a Remembrance of Penises Past.

title: Cant. Stop. Self-Swabbing.
description: When Matt Reardon noticed a certain bachelor party favor disappearing, one that definitely added to the fun of the weekend, he took note.

title: How the Green Wave Movement Did the Unthinkable in Latin America
description: While access to safe abortion is threatened from the United States to China, the Marea Verde, or Green Wave, womens movement has helped deliver groundbreaking reforms and progress on reproductive health and rights in Latin America.

title: Regulators Ask Congress to Create New Rules for Cryptocurrencies
description: WASHINGTON  Federal regulators say they urgently need more power from Congress to properly regulate stablecoins, a fast-growing type of cryptocurrency that they warn could result in bank runs, consumer abuse and payment snafus unless lawmakers act quickly, according to a report issued Monday by the Treasury Department.

title: Ronnie Tutt, Drummer Who Backed Both Elvises, Dies at 83
description: NASHVILLE  Ronnie Tutt, the prolific and versatile drummer who accompanied both Elvises, Presley and Costello, as well as other major figures in rock and pop like Jerry Garcia and Neil Diamond, died on Oct. 16 at his home in Franklin, Tenn. He was 83.

title: Manchin Raises Doubts on Safety Net Bill, Complicating Path to Quick Vote
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Joe Manchin III of West Virginia raised new doubts on Monday about an emerging compromise on a $1.85 trillion climate change and social safety net bill, warning that he had serious reservations about the plan and criticizing liberals in his party for what he called an all or nothing stance on it.

title: A judge blocks Chicago from enforcing its vaccine mandate for police officers.
description: CHICAGO  A judge in Chicago blocked the city on Monday from enforcing a Dec. 31 vaccine mandate for police officers until the issue can be addressed in arbitration. The ruling was a blow to Mayor Lori Lightfoot and a victory for a police union that has been engaged in an increasingly vitriolic battle with City Hall over the rule.

title: As Youngkin Tries to Finesse Trump, McAuliffe Conjures His Comeback
description: FAIRFAX, Va.  In the final hours of campaigning on Monday to become Virginias next governor, it was Glenn Youngkin offering an optimistic vision for the future while Terry McAuliffe delivered harsh warnings about ghosts of the past.

title: Changing of the Guard at Williamstown Theater Festival
description: The artistic director of the prestigious Williamstown Theater Festival has stepped down after complaints by some employees about working conditions there.

title: A White House official says the Pfizer pediatric vaccination program is set to be at full strength next week.
description: Though several million pediatric doses of Pfizer-BioNTechs coronavirus vaccine should be available in the next few days, the vaccination program for children aged 5 to 11 in the United States will only start running at full strength in the second week of November, a top White House official said on Monday.

title: World Leaders Are Met with Protests at COP26 Summit
description: Protesters gathered around Glasgow, where the United Nations climate conference was held, calling for urgent actions from world leaders in the fight against the climate crisis.

title: Neal Brennan Thinks Auteurs Can Still Make Chipotle Commercials
description: A few years ago, Neal Brennan went to see the illusionist Derek DelGaudios hit show In & Of Itself and selected a card that said comedian to describe himself, out of the hundreds on offer. The show ends with DelGaudio guessing what every audience member has chosen. When Brennans turn came, DelGaudio said, Youre a very good comedian. I was like, OK, thats cute, Brennan said.

title: Even as Biden Pushes Clean Energy, He Seeks More Oil Production
description: GLASGOW  President Biden told a global climate summit on Monday that we only have a brief window before us to reduce the emissions from burning oil, gas and coal that pose an existential threat to humanity. But only days earlier, he was urging the worlds largest oil producers to pump more of the fossil fuels that are warming the planet.

title: A Grand Slam Wasted, Atlanta Is Left Holding Its Breath
description: ATLANTA  Of course, it was too easy. Here, it almost always is.

title: A Quietly Big Idea on How We Think About Homeless People
description: Are the unhoused a people? If the answer is yes, then dont they deserve equal protection under the law? These questions were broached last week by the American Civil Liberties Union of Southern California in a long report titled Outside the Law: The Legal War Against Unhoused People. Rather than think of homelessness as a condition, the authors argue, lawmakers should protect those who live on the street in the same way that the Constitution and California law protect groups based on race, gender or religion. The report calls for state legislation prohibiting discrimination based on housing status.

title: Stopping Climate Change Doesnt Need to Be Altruistic
description: One of the approximately 700 things that make climate change a knotty problem is that fighting it requires people living today to do things for the benefit of future generations. And, you know, what have future generations ever done for us?

title: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to Amazon, HBO, Hulu and More in November
description: (Note: Streaming services occasionally change schedules without giving notice. For more recommendations on what to stream, sign up for our Watching newsletter here.)

title: Democrats Bill Would Cover Poor Uninsured Adults, Up to a Point
description: ALBANY, Ga.  After giving up on their goal of creating a new Medicaid program to cover two million poor adults, Democrats are aiming to provide them with free private coverage as part of the partys social policy bill. But there is a catch: The benefits would last only four years.

title: Fry Bread Is Beloved, but Also Divisive
description: Art Coulson, a Cherokee writer who lives in Minneapolis, took a deep breath before he tried to define Native American fry bread.

title: Robert Durst Charged With 2nd-Degree Murder in His Wifes Disappearance
description: Kathie McCormack Durst, the young wife of a real estate scion, returned to the couples weekend cottage in South Salem, N.Y., on the evening of Jan. 31, 1982, and after yet another argument with her husband, she vanished.

title: PG&E says it faces a federal inquiry and $1.15 billion in losses over the Dixie fire.
description: Federal investigators are seeking records from Pacific Gas & Electric in connection with a devastating wildfire this year, raising the specter of more charges against the giant California utility.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Amid rising seas, more extreme weather and rapidly changing ecosystems, the global climate summit in Glasgow opened on Monday with a series of desperate pleas for action.

title: Gary Bettman Defends N.H.L.s Response to Sexual Abuse Accusation
description: N.H.L. Commissioner Gary Bettman on Monday defended the leagues response to a sexual assault accusation against a former coach.

title: Traveling the World for Recipes, but Always Looking for Home
description: LONDON  If youve ever swiped a supple piece of pita bread through a plate of garlicky hummus and your family roots arent in the Middle East, you may have Claudia Roden to thank.

title: Nigeria Building Collapse Kills at Least 5 With Many More Trapped
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A 21-story building under construction crumbled on Monday in Lagos, Nigerias financial capital and Africas largest city, leaving what workers said were as many as 100 construction workers trapped and at least five dead in the latest structural failure in a rapidly expanding metropolis.

title: How Often Do Covid Vaccines Cause Heart Problems in Kids?
description: Federal regulators are reviewing data on the link between Modernas coronavirus vaccine and a rare heart problem in adolescents, the company announced on Sunday. That side effect  myocarditis, an inflammation of the heart muscle  has also worried advisers to federal agencies in deliberations regarding use of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine in younger children and teenagers.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: The coronavirus pandemic has now claimed five million lives globally, although experts say that number is almost certainly an undercount. As we pass this bleak milestone, we asked our colleague Lynsey Chutel, based in Johannesburg, to reflect on the legacy of another pandemic.

title: Linwood Holton, 98,Virginia Governor Who Pushed for Racial Equality, Dies
description: A. Linwood Holton Jr., who as Virginias first Republican governor in nearly a century knocked loose the stranglehold of white supremacy on the state, cleaned up its waterways and promoted a vision for a biracial Republican coalition across the South, died on Oct. 28 at his home in Kilmarnock, Va. He was 98.

title: Climate Summit, Virus Deaths, Abortion: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Jurors Who Convicted Derek Chauvin Are Identified for First Time
description: MINNEAPOLIS  More than six months after a jury found the former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin guilty of murdering George Floyd, the identities of the 12 jurors whose verdict sent Mr. Chauvin to prison were released on Monday for the first time.

title: Queen Elizabeth, calling for statesmanship, not politics, said the time for action is now.
description: Queen Elizabeth II, absent from the climate summit because of health concerns but not silent, urged world leaders on Monday to rise above their current political differences and show true statesmanship for the sake of the planet.

title: Rodney Reed Should Not Be Retried in Texas Murder Case, Judge Says
description: A judge in Texas has recommended that Rodney Reed, a death row prisoner whose case has drawn the attention of celebrities and elected officials, should not receive a new trial in the 1996 murder of a 19-year-old woman.

title: A Nourishing Filipino-Inspired Soup for Fall
description: The chef Angela Dimayuga grew up in San Jose, Calif., the fifth of six children in a Filipino American family, and still remembers the slowly simmering soups and stews that seemed to be constantly bubbling away in the kitchen of her childhood home. Because both of her parents worked  her mother as an administrator for IBM and Intel, her father as a manager at McDonalds  her mother would often cook a weeks worth of food at once. One of her standbys was nilaga, a simple yet flavorful soup of slow-braised beef shanks, bone marrow and earthy vegetables. Nilaga was something we had on regular rotation because its nourishing and could feed a lot of us, says Dimayuga, 36, who, until recently, was the creative director of food and culture for the Standard hotels. Its an easy dish to make, since its all passive cooking: You throw the meat in with some water. Come dinnertime, the family would gather around the huge pots, ladling steaming broth, marrow bones and fragrant rice into their bowls before crowding together to eat.

title: Rivian edges closer to an I.P.O., seeking a valuation above $50 billion.
description: Rivian, an electric truck maker backed by Amazon and Ford Motor, is aiming to be valued above $50 billion in its initial public offering next week.

title: 9,000 Unvaccinated N.Y.C. Workers Put on Unpaid Leave as Mandate Begins
description: Hundreds of firefighters called in sick in what appeared to be an organized protest. Sanitation workers were playing catch up, after garbage collection lagged last week.

title: At Least 5 People Are Dead in Nigeria Building Collapse
description: The 21-story apartment building was under construction when it crumbled in Lagos, Nigeria, killing at least five people. Many more people are feared to be trapped under the rubble.

title: No, Vaccine Mandates Arent an Attack on Freedom
description: The Delta surge in Covid-19 seems to be receding. Thats good news, and not just because fewer people are dying. Fear of infection was one reason the economic recovery hit an air pocket in the third quarter. Resuming normal life will be a huge relief.

title: The Recipe for Coming Back From a 3-1 Deficit? It Varies.
description: HOUSTON  In the somber moments after the Pittsburgh Pirates lost Game 4 of the 1979 World Series to the Baltimore Orioles to fall behind three games to one, Willie Stargell spoke to his teammates.

title: We Should All Know Less About Each Other
description: In 2017, after the shock of Brexit and then Donald Trumps election, Christopher Bail, a professor of sociology and public policy at Duke University, set out to study what would happen if you forced people out of their social media echo chambers.

title: Talking About Attica, the Newest Documentary on the Prison Uprising
description: On Sept. 9, 1971, hundreds of inmates took over the Attica Correctional Facility near Buffalo to demand better conditions. Attica, a new documentary directed by Stanley Nelson and co-directed by Traci A. Curry, recounts the occupation and the massacre that followed on Sept. 13 when armed law enforcement officers stormed the prison and 39 inmates and hostages were killed under sustained police gunfire and tear-gassing.

title: Leaders Warn of Climate Doomsday as Old Rifts Divide Summits First Day
description: GLASGOW  World leaders opened a pivotal climate summit in Scotland on Monday with apocalyptic warnings about the scarce time left to avert catastrophic global warming, yet offered few new commitments to more aggressively cut greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Kristy Swanson, actress and vaccine skeptic, is hospitalized with Covid.
description: Kristy Swanson, an actress who is a vocal vaccine skeptic and critic of Dr. Anthony Fauci, has been hospitalized with virus-related pneumonia in New Jersey, she said.

title: What Harry Styles Fans Wore for Harryween
description: Stylers, as Harry Styless fans like to call themselves, have been dressing in homage to their flamboyant idol for his Love on Tour concerts. For the final leg at Madison Square Garden over the weekend, which coincided with Halloween, they pulled out the stops. Mr. Styles, who has been hailed, aptly or not, as a David Bowie for a new generation, urged fans to arrive in fancy dress. Fair to say, they understood the assignment, wearing some semblance of the stars signature boa feathers and froth. The costume extravaganza, billed as Harryween, was a hybrid celebration of the pop princes florid gender-free style and of a traditional Allhallows Eve  a veritable fashion parade that rivaled cosplay conventions and the most fanciful runway shows.

title: Mets Fire Their Interim G.M. Two Months After His Arrest
description: Zack Scott is the latest Mets executive to leave the team under a dark cloud. Scott was let go by the Mets on Monday, two months after he was placed on administrative leave, according to a baseball executive who had been briefed on the matter but could not speak publicly about it.

title: Jurors for Kyle Rittenhouse Trial Are Swiftly Selected
description: Follow our live Kyle Rittenhouse trial verdict coverage.

title: Maybe I Do Have a Story to Tell: Kal Penn on His Memoir
description: Starring in the buddy stoner comedy Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle is good material for a memoir. One might think that serving as a staffer in Barack Obamas White House is good material for another memoir, by a different person. But the actor Kal Penn writes about both experiences in You Cant Be Serious, which Gallery Books will publish on Tuesday.

title: Review: Embodying Justice in Twilight: Los Angeles, 1992
description: For Anna Deavere Smith, the transcript is the tool. A fine tool, certainly: Her brand of verbatim theater, perfected in a series of documentary plays since the early 1980s, duplicates the expressive peculiarities of real speech, making every defensive stammer and evasive curlicue count.

title: Everyones Having Fun
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Lets give a hearty welcome to Vaibhav Srikaran, who is making his New York Times Crossword debut today, as well as a hearty welcome back to Matthew Stock, who is making his ninth appearance this year. This is an impressive debut indeed from Mr. Srikaran, and some impressively prolific constructing by Mr. Stock, who makes some of the most enjoyable puzzles out there.

title: Attack Left Flight Attendant With Concussion and Facial Injury, Authorities Say
description: An American Airlines flight attendant who was struck on her nose by a passenger last week sustained a concussion and had to be taken by stretcher from the plane after it was diverted to Denver, where the passenger was taken into custody, according to a criminal complaint filed in U.S. District Court in Colorado.

title: Global Leaders Pledge to End Deforestation by 2030
description: Leaders of more than 100 countries, including Brazil, China, Russia and the United States, vowed at climate talks in Glasgow to end deforestation by 2030, in a landmark agreement that encompasses some 85 percent of the worlds forests.

title: When a Cyclist Led the New York City Marathon
description: As a sporting enterprise, there is nothing quite like the spectacle of a big-city marathon  pioneered by New York in 1976 after a five-year run entirely within Central Park. But what would soon emerge as a huge international event proved hard to keep up with for the journalists who covered it.

title: Derrick Henry May Return, but Not His Shot at These Records
description: Though its possible a facsimile of Derrick Henry exists in Palau or Kyrgyzstan or in some astral plane, there has never been an N.F.L. running back as tall as Henry, as thick as Henry and as swift as Henry. That fact has been generally really good for the Tennessee Titans and really bad for everyone else.

title: What to watch in Tuesdays elections: Virginia, mayors races and policing.
description: [Follow results of the N.Y.C. mayoral race and other New York elections.]

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: The opening day of a climate summit in Glasgow was heavy on dire warnings and light on substantive proposals as prime ministers and presidents met to discuss a warming world. Longstanding tensions emerged over who should bear responsibility for cutting emissions, while less-developed countries demanded more aid and swifter action from wealthier ones.

title: Biden Administration Moves to Limit Methane, a Potent Greenhouse Gas
description: GLASGOW  The Biden administration said Tuesday that it would heavily regulate methane, a potent greenhouse gas that spews from oil and natural gas operations and can warm the atmosphere 80 times as fast as carbon dioxide in the short term.

title: Corrections: Nov. 2, 2021
description: An article on Sunday about parents who are reluctant to consent to vaccinating their children against the coronavirus referred imprecisely to myocarditis. It is an inflammation of the heart, not a weakening of the heart muscle. (The condition can sometimes lead to a weakening of the heart muscle.)

title: Quotation of the Day: Still Falling Short Amid Warnings of Dire Threat
description: Enough of burning and drilling and mining our way deeper. We are digging our own graves.

title: Word of the Day: falter
Stephen Colbert: Biden Got the Popes Blessing
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Thrifting
description: The Times reports that there is a  resurgence of interest in vintage clothes right now  partly because thrifting is a fun way to play around without spending so much money (not to mention being conscious of sustainability). But the article also suggests that playing with fashion after months of quarantine soothes our collective ache to be noticed by other people again after feeling invisible for so long.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: TUESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: How Car Shortages Are Putting the Worlds Economy at Risk
description: Turmoilin the auto industry, a powerful engine of the global economy, is threatening growth and sending tremors through companies and communities that depend on carmakers for money and jobs.

title: Long Walk From Freedom: Indebted Gazan Trudges to Jail 17th Time. Or 18th.
description: GAZA CITY  When Wasfi al-Garosha returned to jail, shortly after sunrise one September morning in Gaza City, his daughter did not cry and his brother was still asleep.

title: As Earth Warms, Old Mayhem and Secrets Emerge From the Ice
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Day 2 of the climate summit brings the first concrete commitments.
description: Day 1 of the international summit once described as the last best hope to slow climate change brought few actual commitments to slow climate change.

title: Reduce fossil fuels in the long term but pump more now, Biden says, angering activists.
description: At the global climate summit, President Biden has called for weaning the world from fossil fuels that cause global warming, which he called an existential threat to humanity. But in recent days he has also urged the worlds largest oil producers to pump more of those fuels.

title: Explore 7 Climate Change Solutions
description: Earlier this summer, a report issued by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, a body of scientists convened by the United Nations, found that some devastating impacts of global warming were unavoidable. But there is still a short window to stop things from getting even worse.

title: A cryptocurrency inspired by Squid Game crashes. The industry has questions.
description: Millions of dollars vanished in a matter of minutes after investors piled into a new cryptocurrency inspired by Squid Game, the popular Netflix survival series, only to watch its value plunge to nearly zero in a few short hours.

title: Still Unvaccinated, and Now on Unpaid Leave
description: Its Tuesday. Its Election Day in New York. We told you everything you need to know here, here and here, so you know all about it. Now its your turn.

title: JOBS FOR ALL!
description: How work works, in 13 minutes.

title: How Greek Islands Are Labs for Clean Energy
description: Many Greek islands are being used for innovative experiments to drive the clean power shift.

title: Was the Constitution Pro-Slavery? Jefferson Davis Thought So. Abraham Lincoln Didnt.
description: THE BROKEN CONSTITUTIONLincoln, Slavery, and the Refounding of AmericaBy Noah Feldman

title: How Black Performance and Presence Shaped America
description: ENTERTAINING RACEPerforming Blackness in AmericaBy Michael Eric Dyson

title: When the Nation That Shaped You Is Falling Apart
description: THE INTERIMBy Wolfgang HilbigTranslated by Isabel Fargo Cole

title: The Century-Old Russian Novel Said to Have Inspired 1984
description: My book critic origin story is that I was nearly kicked out of A.P. English for not liking George Orwells 1984. I found the prose stilted (I vaguely recall an invective I launched against his similes) and the overall project didactic. Of all things to be didactic about, I said  totalitarianism. How original  not liking totalitarianism; I mean it just sounds bad. My teacher was aghast (she loved his similes). I had to be transferred to another class.

title: How to Keep a Journal
description: Reflective journaling can be a cost-effective way to give yourself therapy, says Melanie H. Morris, 61, an assistant professor of nursing at Vanderbilt University in Nashville. You dont need to be an accomplished writer with perfect penmanship and spelling; the words are for you. Try to establish a routine in which you write for 15 minutes several times a week, even if you get just one or two sentences down in a session. Put writing in your calendar as you would other things you schedule. Morris is always urging her students to journal, a practice she calls CPR for the soul.

title: Locked Down With Friends, Lovers and Rivals, in Gary Shteyngarts New Novel
description: OUR COUNTRY FRIENDSBy Gary Shteyngart

title: Does Life Imitate Art or Is It the Other Way Around?
description: STILL LIFEBy Sarah Winman

title: How Fentanyl and Meth Took Over America
description: THE LEAST OF USTrue Tales of America and Hope in the Time of Fentanyl and MethBy Sam Quinones

title: Quiz: How Well Do You Understand the Swings in the 2020 Election?
description: One year later, test yourself on the elections key demographic trends.

title: The Secret 53-Year-Old British Case That Could Have Legalized Trans Identity
description: THE HIDDEN CASE OF EWAN FORBES And the Unwritten History of the Trans ExperienceBy Zo Playdon

title: From a Small Nigerian Tribe to a Big American Publishing House
description: NEW YORK, MY VILLAGE By Uwem Akpan

title: How Scribbling in the Margins Transformed My Reading
description: At some point in the past year, I bought a used copy of Camera Lucida. In this slim text, the French literary theorist and semiotician Roland Barthes lays out his theory of photography as a collaboration between viewer and viewed, centered on what Barthes calls the punctum: the (often marginal) detail that leaps out of an image and pricks the viewer with a strange and often inexplicable emotion.

title: Should There Be a Minimum Voting Age?
description: Today is Election Day in the United States, but if you are under 18, you arent allowed to vote. Do you think you should be?

title: Caught Between Worlds? So Are the Characters in These Books.
description: Misdirection can be as useful a trick in storytelling as it is in magic. It may be tempting to follow the trail of a character who plunges into the thick of the action, but sometimes its better to stick with the one whos been left behind. Thats certainly the case in Bernhard Schlinks OLGA (HarperVia, 288 pp., $27.99), which traces the experiences of a quietly determined German schoolteacher, a survivor of two world wars and a lifetime of waiting for a lover who may never return.

title: The Reporter, the Stealth Artist and the Shadowman
description: I would like to say I just happened upon Nullbureau while he was painting a nightmarish, emaciated figure on a wall in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan last month. But Im not typically out at 3:00 in the morning. In fact, our meeting was orchestrated by a publicist who, though not hired by him, admired his pluck. And that would unleash some uncomfortable questions about authenticity, ethics and opportunism.

title: The Manhattan Madam Who Hobnobbed With the Citys Elite
description: MADAMThe Biography of Polly Adler, Icon of the Jazz AgeBy Debby Applegate

title: An Artist in Lockdown, Forged by Catastrophe
description: BURNTCOATBy Sarah Hall

title: Should I Tell a Facebook Friend I Had an Affair With Her Partner?
description: I am a retired but active woman in my 60s. I started dating a gentleman, also retired, some months ago after meeting him at a party. He said that he had just ended a long-distance relationship with someone but that she had told him to go ahead and start seeing other women.

title: Dexter Always Gets His Man. Even When Its Michael C. Hall.
description: Sometimes the actor Michael C. Hall likes to think about his own obituary. He knows that Dexter, the Showtime drama he starred in for eight seasons, will make its way into its first paragraph.

title: Reality According to Tom McCarthy
description: The English writer Tom McCarthy has been waging a one-man war against literary realism, or as he sometimes calls it, the middlebrow commercial novel, for coming on 20 years now. Remainder (2005), his debut effort, which was completed in 2001 but took years to find a publisher, marked the opening of hostilities. The books narrator, who receives 8.5 million British pounds in damages after losing his memory in an accident, is a thumb in the eye of psychological coherence. He has no inwardness, only an obsession: the costly and elaborate re-enactment of half-remembered scenes from his past. These re-enactments, which resemble Situationist pranks, dont chart a path back to wholeness and authenticity, as the damaged narrator seems to hope (and as the reader weaned on the realist tradition of Austen, Balzac and Henry James might expect). They lead in the opposite direction, to mania, carnage and senseless repetition.

title: She Was an Organist for the Ages
description: Few musicians have faced a debut more intense than did the organist Jeanne Demessieux. For years before her first concert  one of six she gave at the Salle Pleyel in Paris early in 1946  her teacher Marcel Dupr had stoked rumors of her outlandish talent.

title: Inside the Unraveling of American Zionism
description: It began, as so much these days does, with a group chat. Early this year, around 20 rabbinical and cantorial students started a WhatsApp thread they eventually named Rad Future Clergy. Among them, they attended rabbinical schools in five different U.S. cities. Several of them first became friends while studying and working in a sixth city, Jerusalem, the capital of the land that both the Torah and Israels declaration of independence deem the place for the ingathering of the exiles.

title: This Is the Story of How Lincoln Broke the U.S. Constitution
description: Who created the Constitution we have today? As a law professor, Ive always thought the best answer was the framers: James Madison, Alexander Hamilton and the other delegates who attended the Philadelphia convention in the summer of 1787.

title: If the Supreme Court Claims Power Over Gun Carry Laws, It Will Be Making a Grave Mistake
description: The Supreme Court will soon decide whether Americans have a constitutional right to carry loaded concealed weapons in public and in public places, wherever and whenever they believe they might need their guns for self-defense. Practically, that could mean everywhere and at all times.

title: Constitutional Change Will Be Here Sooner Than We Think
description: Everyone learns, by the end of high school, that the United States had a constitution before the Constitution  the Articles of Confederation.

title: The Life-Altering Differences Between White and Black Debt
description: Public policy in the United States often overlooks wealth. We tend to design, debate and measure our economic policies with regard to income alone, which blinds us to the ways prosperity and precarity tangibly function in peoples lives. And that blind spot can ultimately prevent us from addressing social inequality at its roots.

title: How to Host Thanksgiving With Unvaccinated Friends and Family
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: As U.S. Reopening Approaches, Travelers Take Their Marks
description: When the Biden administration announced that vaccinated foreign travelers would be allowed to enter the United States starting Nov. 8, it was as though a starting gun had been fired.

title: While Working, You Simply Stop Thinking
description: Last year, during a pandemic that endangered and disrupted the global work force, Swedens public broadcaster Sveriges Television AB asked us to make a film about work. We were given unfettered access to its visual archives, studying the way work has been portrayed and discussed in the modern age.

title: Can Specific Foods or Diets Boost Your Testosterone Levels?
description: Can I increase my testosterone levels through the foods I eat? And if so, which foods or diets work best?

title: Shutting Down Historical Debate, China Makes It a Crime to Mock Heroes
description: [Follow live updates on the meeting between President Biden and Chinas leader, Xi Jinping.]

title: Corporate Climate Pledges Often Ignore a Key Component: Supply Chains
description: For nearly 30 years, the pharmaceutical giant Bristol Myers Squibb has proclaimed its been setting and meeting ambitious targets around energy and greenhouse gas emissions. These days, those goals include being carbon neutral by 2040.

title: The Brooklyn House That Came With This Crazy Elevator
description: For one Brooklyn couple, an online search for elevator buildings turned up something they had no idea they wanted: a single-family home.

title: They Were Looking for a Place With an Elevator. They Found a Lot More.
description: Like many buyers, Lilly Burns and Tony Hernandez set some parameters to narrow their online search when they began looking for an apartment in Brooklyn in early 2018. In particular, Our search was in elevator buildings only, said Ms. Burns, 34, a daughter of the filmmaker Ken Burns, who, along with Mr. Hernandez, 46, is a partner in Jax Media, a television and film production company that has worked on shows like Russian Doll, Emily in Paris and Search Party.

title: The Perilous Politics of Rising Inflation
description: Inflation in the United States is rising at its fastest rate so far this century. At 4 percent, according to one index, it is about double the Federal Reserves target.

title: Needless Suffering
description: There are downsides to most Covid-19 precautions. Keeping children home from school can cause them to fall behind. Working from home can impede creativity. Staying away from friends and relatives can damage mental health. Wearing masks can muffle speech, hide smiles and fog eyeglasses.

title: Biden pledged $3 billion to help the world adapt to climate change. Thats not as much as it seems.
description: The United States vowed at the Glasgow summit to start providing $3 billion each year, by 2024, to help developing countries adapt to climate change. The Biden administration called it the largest U.S. commitment ever made to reduce climate impacts on those most vulnerable worldwide, assuming that Mr. Biden can persuade Congress to come up with the money.

title: Funding for start-ups founded by women is surging.
description: Last year, venture capital funding for companies founded by women in the U.S. dropped substantially. But new research from PitchBook suggests that change is afoot.

title: For Knicks, Success (and Failure) Arrives 3 Points at a Time
description: Near the end of the first quarter on Monday, Julius Randle, the Knicks burly All-Star forward, pulled up and banked in a shot from 25 feet. It was the kind of shot that might have sent him to the bench in a previous era of basketball, or even on a previous Tom Thibodeau-coached team. On Monday, it was Randles fourth 3-pointer in 12 minutes.

title: China urges families to stock up on food for winter months.
description: China has called on families and local governments to stock up on daily necessities as the country enforces stringent restrictions intended to curb a number of Covid outbreaks.

title: Jeff Bezos, who recently flew into space, vows to do more to protect the Earth.
description: Jeff Bezos, one of the richest humans on the planet, and who started his financial empire by selling books online, pledged $2 billion to restoring natural habitats and transforming food systems at the climate summit in Glasgow on Tuesday.

title: Dozens Killed in ISIS Attack on Military Hospital in Afghanistans Capital
description: At least 25 people were killed and more than a dozen were wounded during an attack by the Islamic State on a military hospital in the Afghan capital of Kabul on Tuesday, according to local officials, with gunfire and explosions echoing throughout the city into the afternoon.

title: BPs profit rises as oil and gas prices soar.
description: BP said Tuesday that higher oil and natural gas prices had led to sharply higher earnings in the third quarter. The company said that its underlying replacement cost profit for July through September was $3.3 billion, compared with $86 million in the period a year earlier.

title: Weekly News Quiz for Students: Climate Summit, Facebook's New Name, Book Controversy
description: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.

title: Ecuador says it will extend protections around the Galpagos Islands.
description: In a bid to protect the Galpagos Islands, a volcanic Pacific archipelago where Charles Darwin saw a blueprint for the origin of every species, Ecuadors president said on Tuesday that his nation would expand the marine reserve around the natural treasures.

title: Nearly 170,000 people voted early, fewer than in the June primary.
description: The turnout was fairly meager during New York Citys early voting period, with just shy of 170,000 people showing up to cast their ballots ahead of Election Day in a city where about 5.6 million people are registered to vote.

title: Where and how to vote in New York City.
description: The polls in New York City are open today from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m., and voters will be choosing candidates for mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, City Council and in Manhattan and Brooklyn, district attorney. They will also be voting on five potential amendments to the State Constitution.

title: Eric Adams and Curtis Sliwa prepare for final showdown in New York City mayors race.
description: As a long and contentious race for mayor of the nations largest city comes to a close, New Yorkers are deciding on Tuesday between two candidates who offer sharply divergent visions for how to move the city out of the pandemic and into a new era, following eight years of the de Blasio administration.

title: Regulators Sound the Alarm on Stablecoins
description: Financial regulators have urged lawmakers to act fast on legislation to address the rising risk of stablecoins. This type of cryptocurrency  ostensibly backed one-to-one by a stable asset like the dollar, making it more practical as a means for trades and transactions  is booming, with some $130 billion now in circulation. Stablecoin issuers, such as Tether and Circle, are not banks and they are not simply tech companies that sell online services: They operate as both and have few rules to guide them.

title: The Jaws Shoot Was a Drama. Now Its a Play.
description: LONDON  When Ian Shaw was 5, he did something to make any movie fan jealous: He visited the set of Jaws. On location on Marthas Vineyard, an assistant pulled back a huge sheet and young Shaw found himself staring into the gaping mouth of the man-eating shark that would soon become a cinematic icon.

title: New Yorks 5 ballot measures include proposals to make voting easier.
description: Update: New York voters rejected ballot proposals on voting and redistricting.

title: More same-sex couples may be eligible for Social Security survivor benefits.
description: Surviving members of same-sex couples who werent able to marry because it wasnt yet legal may now be eligible for survivor benefits from Social Security.

title: The average global temperature in 2020 was 58.8 degrees Fahrenheit (14.9 degrees Celsius). How cold was it during the height of the last ice age?
description: A cold case about Earths past.

title: The Board of Elections has a spotty track record. Officials say today is going more smoothly.
description: New York Citys Board of Elections suffered a major embarrassment in June when it botched the rollout of the new ranked-choice voting system.

title: The Unequal Toll of Covid-19 in California
description: ENCINITAS, Calif.  The celebratory chords of a mariachi band filled the community center. On seemingly every surface fresh marigold blossoms glowed a bright orange.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $4 MILLION

title: How Esperanza Spalding and Wayne Shorter Realized His Dream: an Opera
description: In fall 2018, Esperanza Spalding had just released 12 Little Spells, a bold foray into using music as a healing practice, and a significant creative leap in her career. She was a newly minted professor at Harvard University, and thriving in the role.

title: Eric Adams was emotional after casting his ballot, carrying a photo of his mother.
description: Eric Adams began a day that would see him become only the second Black mayor of New York City by casting his own vote just after dawn, with a framed photograph of his late mother cradled under his arm.

title: The defense will argue that the shootings were acts of self-defense.
description: As Kyle Rittenhouse faces trial for fatally shooting two men and wounding a third in the aftermath of street protests last year in Kenosha, Wis., his fate could hinge on whether jurors accept his lawyers central argument  that he had to fire to protect himself.

title: Whats Emerging From the Melting Ice?
description: As global temperatures rise, permafrost and glaciers are rapidly thawing and eroding, releasing ancient animal remains and human artifacts.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla has not signed a deal with Hertz yet.
description: Teslas chief executive, Elon Musk, said Monday that the electric vehicle manufacturer had not yet signed a contract with Hertz to sell the car rental agency 100,000 of its vehicles, a deal that was announced last week as Teslas stock value pushed past $1 trillion for the first time.

title: Watch Live: Kyle Rittenhouses Murder Trial Begins
description: The murder trial begins for Kyle Rittenhouse, who has been charged with six criminal counts. Mr. Rittenhouse shot three men, killing two, during protests against police violence in Kenosha, Wis. Warning: Evidence May Include Graphic Images and Language.

title: This is where Adams and Sliwa stand on the issues.
description: Eric Adams, the Democratic nominee for mayor, and his Republican opponent, Curtis Sliwa, have expressed very different visions for the city as it struggles to recover from the pandemic  battered by the virus, a rise in gun violence and a stifled economic recovery.

title: As Demand for Green Energy Grows, Solar Farms Face Local Resistance
description: Hecate Energy, a renewable energy developer, had hoped to install a 500-acre solar farm in Copake, N.Y., a quiet town nestled between the Catskill and Berkshire Mountains. The setting was ideal because of its proximity to an electrical substation, critical to the power transmission.

title: (Very) Adult Animation About Mixed-Up Kids
description: There are many growth areas in television these days, but few are as busy or offer as much variety as adult animation. Already the format for more than a few of the recent pasts most richly entertaining shows  Bojack Horseman, Bobs Burgers, Rick and Morty, Archer, Tuca & Bertie  it has only gained momentum. New series arrive every week (and thats not counting the quarterly infusion of anime), perhaps driven by a combination of evolving tastes and pandemic-induced production shifts.

title: Republicans show signs of life in some City Council districts.
description: By nearly every metric, the Republican Party has been wiped out in the nations largest city.

title: The lead prosecutor has clashed with the judge in pretrial hearings.
description: The prosecution of Kyle Rittenhouse will be led by Thomas Binger, a Kenosha County assistant district attorney who has at times clashed with the judge during hearings leading up to the trial.

title: Opioid Makers Win Major Victory in California Trial
description: Four manufacturers of prescription opioids won the pharmaceutical industrys first major legal victory in the opioid crisis, turning aside claims by local California governments that they contributed substantially to the epidemic.

title: The judge presiding over the case has been in this business for 50 years.
