description: Bruce Schroeder, the longest-serving circuit court judge in Wisconsin, is presiding over the homicide trial of Kyle Rittenhouse.

title: The Mixologists Who Create Liquid Adventures for Couples
description: Josh Rosenthal is an owner of the Grand Bevy Corporation, a mixology and creative beverage company in Los Angeles that he started 10 years ago. Run by Mr. Rosenthal and his wife Priscilla Sommer, who works as a managing partner and C.F.O., the company now employs 130 mixologists across the country at around 150 weddings a year, among other events.

title: And then there were two: How a crowded primary field led to Adams and Sliwa.
description: First there were 22 candidates running for New York City mayor. Then on Primary Day, there were 15. Then, following New York Citys tumultuous experiment with ranked-choice voting, there were two: Eric Adams, the Brooklyn borough president, and Curtis Sliwa, the red-bereted founder of the Guardian Angels.

title: Whats at stake? Is it too late to register to vote? Making sense of Election Day.
description: Just because its an odd-numbered year  a hiatus from Electoral College math and midterm machinations  doesnt mean that Tuesdays elections are lacking national implications and drama.

title: The Rose Queen of Texas
description: TYLER, Texas  Early on a recent Saturday, the townspeople of Tyler staked out spots along the Texas Rose Festival parade route. Marching bands boomed, convertibles honked, and T-shirt guns fired into the cheering crowd. Fourteen floats bore coteries of young women in whimsical, garden-themed gowns that wouldnt have been out of place on the set of RuPauls Drag Race. The Apache Belles, a local dance troupe dating back to the 1940s, shouted, Tyler, Tyler, we are the best!

title: Former FIFA Officials Face Fraud Charges Over Secret Payment
description: More than six years after being ousted in a sprawling soccer corruption scandal, the former FIFA president Sepp Blatter and his onetime ally Michel Platini were indicted on fraud charges on Tuesday by the authorities in Switzerland, who accused the men of arranging a secret $2 million payment.

title: Shahana Hanif makes history as the first Muslim woman elected to the New York City Council.
description: In New York City, a global beacon that draws a diverse population from all over the world, the City Council has never had a person of South Asian descent  or a Muslim woman  among its membership.

title: Egyptian Street Food on a Sidewalk in Astoria
description: Hawawshi, tameeya and other dishes are cooked to order at Foda Egyptian Sandwiches, in Queens.

title: This Queens Food Cart Has a Way With Liver
description: One school of thought on liver holds that it should never be cooked so long that the interior loses all its rosy pink color and fades to dull brown. This view is not likely to be shared by anyone who has eaten kebda Eskandarany, the beef-liver sandwich that has spread from its native Alexandria to souks, street vendors and takeout joints throughout Egypt.

title: How Blue and Red States Deal With Covid
description: To the Editor:

title: The billions set aside in Glasgow to save forests represent a fraction of spending to support fossil fuels.
description: Forests once blanketed the United States and Europe. Humans cut them down, turning the land into farms, towns and cities. In many other places around the world  like South America, the Congo Basin, Southeast Asia  people did a lot less of that.

title: Jumaane Williams is re-elected public advocate. Next up: a run for governor?
description: Jumaane D. Williams was re-elected New York City public advocate on Tuesday, The Associated Press reported, a victory that gives him a stable base to pursue another office that hes interested in: governor.

title: The defendant had shown his support for Blue Lives Matter on social media.
description: He signed up to be a cadet in a program for teenagers who aspire to be police officers. He filled his Facebook page with support for Blue Lives Matter. He sat up front at a rally for President Donald J. Trump, and posted images of it on TikTok. And he chose to mark his 16th birthday by raising funds for a support group for the police called Humanizing the Badge.

title: Louise Erdrichs The Sentence Considers the (Literally) Haunting Power of Books
description: Who among us hasnt, in some sense, stolen a corpse and accidentally trafficked crack cocaine across state lines? That is a question you will ponder while reading Louise Erdrichs The Sentence, a bewitching novel that begins with a crime that would seem to defy relatability but becomes a practical metaphor for whatever moral felonies lurk unresolved in your guilty heart.

title: Is It Possible to Explain How Consciousness Works?
description: FEELING & KNOWINGMaking Minds ConsciousBy Antonio Damasio

title: Justice Dept. Sues Penguin Random House Over Simon & Schuster Deal
description: The Biden administration on Tuesday sued to stop Penguin Random House, the largest publisher in the United States, from acquiring its rival Simon & Schuster, as part of a new drive in Washington against corporate consolidation.

title: Prepare Kids for Daylight Saving Time
description: The right plan can help ease the change.

title: Transcript: Tressie McMillan Cottom Interviews Louise Seamster for The Ezra Klein Show
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode, guest-hosted by Tressie McMillan Cottom and featuring Louise Seamster. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

description: See full results and maps from the Ohio special elections.

description: See full results and maps from the New York elections.

description: See full results from the Boston mayoral and city council elections.

description: See full results from the Atlanta election.

description: See full results from the Minnesota elections.

description: See full results from the Detroit election.

description: See full results and maps from the New York elections.

title: Florida Special Primary Election Results: 20th Congressional District
description: See full results and maps from the Florida primaries.

title: Kyle Rittenhouses defense is led by a high-profile local lawyer.
description: The lead lawyer representing Kyle Rittenhouse is Mark Richards, 59, a veteran defense lawyer and former prosecutor who has spent his career in Kenosha and Racine, Wis., primarily representing people accused of drug crimes and murder.

title: The U.S. says $100 billion a year in climate aid for developing nations is within reach.
description: John Kerry, President Bidens special envoy on climate change, said he expected new financial commitments to fulfill a long-delayed promise to provide $100 billion a year in aid for developing countries to fight and adapt to global warming.

title: The Big Question This Thanksgiving: Are You Vaccinated?
description: For the first time in two years, Tim Wyatt is hosting a Thanksgiving feast at his home in Birmingham, Ala. Along with the traditional turkey, Mr. Wyatt will spend days preparing his slow-roasted pork shoulder with Alabama white sauce. His wife, Nancy Wyatt, will cook all of her enticing side dishes, like sour cream mini-muffins and sweet potato casserole with sage butter.

title: The next Manhattan D.A. will inherit the Trump investigation.
description: The winner of Tuesdays election for Manhattan district attorney will become only the third person to hold the position in more than 40 years, taking over a prosecutors office that is one of the most prominent in the country.

title: Widespread Coronavirus Infection Found in Iowa Deer, New Study Says
description: A new study of hundreds of white-tailed deer infected with the coronavirus in Iowa has found that the animals probably are contracting the virus from humans, and then rapidly spreading it among one another, according to researchers.

title: On Elon Musk and the Dangerous Power of Insecure Billionaires
description: Elon Musk doesnt think visionaries like him should pay taxes the way little people do. After all, why hand over his money to dull bureaucrats? Theyll just squander it on pedestrian schemes like  bailing out Tesla at a crucial point in its development. Musk has his sights set on more important things, like getting humanity to Mars to preserve the light of consciousness.

title: Curtis Sliwa tried to bring his cat to vote. It got weirder from there.
description: Curtis Sliwa brought a special guest with him to vote on Tuesday: Gizmo, one of the 17 cats he lives with in a studio apartment.

title: Virginia Voters Cast Ballots in Tight Governors Race
description: Voters in Richmond, Va., are deciding between the former Democratic Gov. Terry McAuliffe and the Republican business executive Glenn Youngkin.

title: Four, the Latest From Jesse Schenker, Opens on Long Island
description: After the chef Jesse Schenker made his name at Recette and The Gander in Manhattan, he decamped for the Long Island village of Oyster Bay, where he opened 2 Spring with Claudia Taglich, his business partner, in early 2018. Now, he has another restaurant ready to make its debut next door. Called Four, its in a historic Victorian cottage. (The two restaurants connect by a glass-covered pavilion that functions as an expanded dining room for 2 Spring.) Four has just 10 upholstered seats at a marble counter surrounding a demonstration kitchen done in simple Scandinavian style with blond wood set within the cottages white brick and siding. A painting of Anthony Bourdain is a centerpiece on one wall, and a huge Bonnet range equipped with a Japanese charcoal grill helms the kitchen. There, Mr. Schenker will be onstage so to speak, preparing and serving a 10- to 12-course tasting menu, $245, for one of the more elevated dining experiences available on Long Island. Mr. Schenker said he missed the ad hoc menus he used to prepare on Mondays at Recette. I am thrilled for the opportunity to cook in a similar intimate style for my guests, he said. Among the dishes hes planning are an oyster tartlet, langoustine with Champagne essence, rigatoni with giant clam and chiles, foie gras with a duck fat croissant, Mishima Wagyu with wasabi and onion, and chocolate pot de crme. Mr. Schenkers attention to detail will extend beyond the food and the list for 500 wines (from an underground cellar) to the tableware, with no pieces repeated throughout the dinner. Soon, he will open Provisions, a retail food shop, in a building around the corner. (Opens Thursday)

title: Lawyer for Rust Assistant Director Says Checking Gun Was Not His Job
description: A lawyer for the assistant director on the film Rust  who law-enforcement officials said had handed a gun to the actor Alec Baldwin before it discharged a live round that killed the cinematographer  said in an interview on Fox News Monday that it was not his responsibility to check the weapon.

title: Investigation Into Britney Spears Conservatorship Will Look Into Her Finances
description: After insisting for years that Britney Spearss conservatorship was absolutely necessary, her father, James P. Spears, unexpectedly asked the court in early September to terminate the legal arrangement.

title: To Cover World War II, These Women Journalists Fought Sexism at Home
description: THE CORRESPONDENTSSix Women Writers on the Front Lines of World War IIBy Judith Mackrell

title: As the Fed Prepares to Slow Support, Attention Shifts to Rate Increases
description: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, is on the cusp of accomplishing something that would have seemed like a victory a year ago: Central bankers are expected to announce a plan to wean the economy off their asset-buying program on Wednesday without roiling markets, a delicate maneuver that was in no way assured.

title: Israels energy minister could not access Monday talks in her wheelchair.
description: British officials, including Prime Minister Boris Johnson, and COP26 organizers have apologized to Israels energy minister after she was unable to attend Mondays events because she could not access the venue in her wheelchair.

title: Poll workers in New Jersey struggle to connect to the internet, causing delays.
description: Follow live results of the N.J. governors race.

title: Trading for Von Miller, the Rams Are All In
description: Our NFL playoffs calculator has an up-to-date look at the latest playoff picture.

title: Tupac Shakur Touring Exhibition Opens in January
description: A major touring exhibition centered on Tupac Shakur and spearheaded by his estate will arrive in Los Angeles in January.

title: Facebook, Citing Societal Concerns, Plans to Shut Down Facial Recognition System
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Alvin Bragg, poised to become Manhattans first Black district attorney, votes in Harlem.
description: Alvin Bragg, the Democratic nominee for Manhattan district attorney, voted in Harlem on Tuesday morning, the neighborhood where he has lived most of his life and that has served as the constant backdrop of his campaign over the last two years.

title: Donations to Bostons mayoral candidates are coming from very different places.
description: BOSTON  The women running for mayor of Boston, the city councilors Michelle Wu and Annissa Essaibi George, have each raised serious money, totaling $2.15 million and $1.94 million, respectively. But if you look at who is giving them that money, the differences are stark.

title: The Strange Saga of Huawei
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. Here is a collection of past columns.

title: To Go Big, Sloppy Jane Went Underground
description: LEWISBURG, W. Va.  On a Friday afternoon in October 2019, Haley Dahl, the leader of the bicoastal punk rock orchestra Sloppy Jane, sat at a small upright piano in the belly of Lost World Caverns here, recording tracks for the bands second full-length album, Madison, out Friday.

title: Once a Climate Leader, Brazil Falls Short in Glasgow
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazil, a global climate leader turned environmental offender under President Jair Bolsonaro, approached the United Nations climate conference in Glasgow ready to prove it was changing course, with commitments to create a green jobs program, cut carbon emissions and curb deforestation.

title: Brad Lander, a progressive councilman, is elected city comptroller.
description: Brad Lander, a three-term New York City councilman, won Tuesdays race for city comptroller against Daby Carreras, a Republican aligned with the Trump wing of the party, according to The Associated Press.

title: Ethiopia Declares State of Emergency as Rebels Advance Toward Capital
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Ethiopia declared a state of emergency on Tuesday and called on its citizens to pick up arms and prepare to defend the capital as rebel forces from the northern region of Tigray pressed south toward the city following the capture of two key towns.

title: The Mark Zuckerberg Aesthetic
description: What do you get for the man who has everything? How about a vivid fantasy world of his own design?

title: In the city where George Floyd was killed, voters decide the Police Departments fate.
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Voters in Minneapolis on Tuesday weighed whether to keep or replace a long-troubled Police Department that became nationally infamous last year after the murder of George Floyd by an officer, which triggered worldwide outrage and protests.

title: De Blasio votes for his successor as he eyes a campaign for governor.
description: With his time left in office dwindling, Mayor Bill de Blasio cast his ballot in the election for his successor at a busy Park Slope Library on Tuesday, a vote that essentially reinforced the end of his eight-year term even as he appeared to be weighing his political future.

title: Pfizers Covid vaccine could break sales records again next year.
description: With its coronavirus vaccine on track this year to generate the biggest single-year sales ever for a medical product, Pfizer on Tuesday disclosed revenue projections indicating that the shot will likely beat that record or come close in 2022.

title: Hockey Backtracks on Plan to Eject Chinese Team From Olympics
description: Ice hockeys governing body on Tuesday backtracked on plans to bar Chinas mens team from competing next year at the Beijing Olympics, a swift reversal that came only weeks after the hockey organizations president had raised concerns that Chinas team simply was not good enough to merit a place in the field.

title: U.S.-Russia Engagement Deepens as C.I.A. Head Travels to Moscow
description: MOSCOW  William J. Burns, the C.I.A. director, met with a top adviser to President Vladimir V. Putin in Moscow on Tuesday, leading a delegation of American officials on a two-day visit to the Russian capital that served as the latest evidence of heightened engagement between two global adversaries.

title: Its about time: Voters reflected on electing N.Y.C.s second Black mayor.
description: As New Yorkers cast their ballots on Tuesday, a broad range of issues, from public safety to education, were top of mind. But some said what was most significant about the current moment was its potential to usher in history.

title: Prominent Conservatives Back Letting States Limit Guns in Public
description: WASHINGTON  When the Supreme Court hears a major Second Amendment case on Wednesday, many expect that the courts recently expanded conservative majority will be poised to strike down the New York law under review, one that imposes strict limits on carrying guns outside the home.

title: Kyle Rittenhouse protected himself from people who attacked him in the street like an animal, his lawyer says.
description: Kyle Rittenhouse, an Illinois resident, arrived in Kenosha, Wis., in August 2020 as a teenager with innocent motives, his lawyer told jurors in an opening statement.

title: Another Apple Worker Says the Company Retaliated Against Her
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Democrats Work to Salvage Methane Fee Amid Opposition From Manchin
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats struggled on Tuesday to salvage a major initiative to address climate change in their sweeping social and environmental policy bill amid opposition from Senator Joe Manchin III of West Virginia, a key Democratic holdout.

title: Democrats Add Drug Cost Curbs to Social Policy Plan, Pushing for Vote
description: WASHINGTON  House Democrats reached a deal on Tuesday to add a measure to curb prescription drug costs to President Bidens $1.85 trillion social safety net plan, agreeing to allow the government for the first time to negotiate prices for medications covered by Medicare as they pushed for a quick vote on the bill.

title: Some Hear Grammar Donts. I Hear the Future of English.
description: It may seem from some of my recent newsletters  championing they as a singular pronoun and me as a subject pronoun  that theres something about being a linguist that makes one strangely permissive about what language is supposed to be like.

title: An Unsolved Mystery: Why Do More Men Die of Covid-19?
description: Azita Ghahramani worried she wouldnt survive Covid-19 because of her health conditions, including high blood pressure. So she and her husband, Scott Downing, and their son became hypervigilant. They moved to a remote part of Maine and avoided most social interactions. Even so, all three got Covid-19 in March 2021, possibly from exposure during a family funeral. But it wasnt Ms. Ghahramani who nearly died of the disease; it was her husband.

title: With China, a Cold War Analogy Is Lazy and Dangerous
description: A new idea is gaining currency among some politicians and policymakers in Washington: The United States is in a cold war with China. Its a bad idea  bad on history, bad on politics, bad for our future.

title: Polls in Virginia show G.O.P. strength. Will the forecast be more accurate this time around?
description: The outcome of the race for governor in Virginia will be one of the best tests yet of the strength of the two parties heading into next years midterm elections. It will be a key test for pollsters, as well.

title: U.S. officials urge travelers arriving by land to have travel and vaccine documents ready.
description: American officials on Tuesday warned that the reopening of international land borders next week could lead to longer wait times at ports of entry and asked that travelers have their travel and vaccine documents readily available for border officials.

title: Tiny Love Stories: With You, I Can Be a New Person
description: My grandmother kept a candy bowl on a table by her front door. Growing up, I would sneak butterscotches and strawberry sweets. During the pandemic, my grandmother moved into assisted living. On my first visit after lockdown, I saw how much of her 90-year life she had discarded to fit into her new residence. Yet, shed saved the familiar bowl. Driving home, I discovered that shed slipped its candy into my purse. Years before, when I had confessed my childhood thievery, she laughed. Why do you think I kept it on that low table? Its always been for you.  Samantha Facciolo

title: Palestinian Families Reject Deal in Area That Helped Set Off Gaza Conflict
description: JERUSALEM  A group of Palestinian families in East Jerusalem whose looming eviction led to an 11-day war in Gaza rejected a compromise on Tuesday that would have allowed them to stay in their homes for several decades if they agreed to pay nominal rent to a Jewish settler group that courts have ruled are the buildings real owners.

title: At the Radio City Christmas Show, Some Workers Worry About Covid Rules
description: Some of the people who put on the Radio City Music Hall Christmas show are expressing concerns about the Covid-19 protocols in place for workers as the show prepares to open on Friday night.

title: The Road to Climate Recovery Goes Through the Wild Woods
description: The 2015 Paris climate agreement called on nations of the world to preserve forests and other ecosystems that store carbon. But forests continue to disappear  cut and burned and fragmented into ever smaller patches. This failure challenges all of our other climate efforts because unless forests remain standing, the world will never contain global warming.

title: Andrew Yang casts his first-ever vote for N.Y.C. mayor.
description: Once a front-runner to become the next mayor of New York himself, Andrew Yangs voting record came under intense scrutiny during his campaign: Over more than 20 years living in the city, he had never voted in a mayoral election.

title: Virginia Election Results
description: See full results and maps from the Virginia elections.

title: New York Election Results
description: See full results and maps from the New York elections.

title: New Jersey Election Results
description: See full results and maps from the New Jersey elections.

title: Pfizer and Moderna shots are less effective in people with weak immune systems, a study finds.
description: Coronavirus vaccines were significantly less effective in protecting people with weakened immune systems than they were for other people, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported on Tuesday, buttressing the agencys call for immunocompromised adults to receive third or fourth doses of vaccines.

title: Are you welcoming back family and friends now that U.S. travel restrictions are ending?
description: November is shaping up to be an emotional month.

title: Are You Missing Out on the Metaverse?
description: If you have an internet connection, youre probably familiar with the feeling. Something new starts happening online. People seem really excited about it. Suddenly youre curious. (Sure, Ill join TikTok.) Or maybe you feel dread. (Am I too late to buy crypto?) Everyone at some point fears missing out on something.

title: Raiders Receiver to Be Charged in Fatal Car Crash
description: Raiders receiver Henry Ruggs III faces two felony drunken-driving charges in connection with a car collision early Tuesday morning in Las Vegas that left one person dead.

title: Heres who is who in the Kyle Rittenhouse trial.
description: Here is a rundown of the key figures in the courtroom for the trial of Kyle Rittenhouse in Kenosha, Wis. Mr. Rittenhouse faces six charges  five felony counts and one misdemeanor  in connection with the shooting deaths of two men and the wounding of a third during protests and unrest in Kenosha in August 2020. The most serious charge he faces, intentional homicide, carries a life sentence.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: On Day 2 of the climate summit in Scotland, President Biden said the two nations leaders were wrong not to join more than 100 world leaders looking for solutions to the climate crisis. We have live updates here.

title: I Was Told I Have Career Advantages as a Black Woman. Heres How I Replied.
description: For senior company executives, appointments to public boards are one way to ease into retirement with purpose and prestige. But in a recent conversation I had with a 60-something white man, he lamented that the board opportunities he had expected and looked forward to are unlikely to materialize for him.

title: Biden Tries to Reassert American Leadership, and His Own
description: GLASGOW  President Bidens major goal for his second foreign trip since taking office was to reassert Americas ability to lead the world on climate change before it is too late. But he also wanted to reassert Joe Biden.

title: In a Connecticut mayors race, Bobby Valentine brings in the closer: himself.
description: In Connecticuts fastest growing city, one of the two mayoral contenders received an endorsement from Barack Obama, burnishing a list of credentials that includes a degree from Harvard, four terms in the Legislature and a stint as a special projects director for the Department of Homeland Security.

title: Manuel Neri, Figurative Sculptor With a Modern Twist, Dies at 91
description: Manuel Neri, a noted San Francisco artist whose life-size figurative sculptures, often painted and usually of women, evoked classical statuary while updating it for the 20th century, died on Oct. 18 at his home in Sacramento. He was 91.

title: Building in Nigeria Had Abnormalities Before Collapse
description: LAGOS, Nigeria Construction on a high-rise building that collapsed Monday in Lagos, killing at least 20 people, had been ordered halted earlier this year after inspectors found abnormalities, the authorities said Tuesday.

title: Election Day, COP26, Thanksgiving: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Zillow, facing big losses, quits flipping houses and will lay off a quarter of its staff.
description: Zillow, the real estate website known for estimating house values, said on Tuesday that it would exit the business of rapidly buying and selling houses amid heavy losses and that it planned to let go about nearly 25 percent of its employees.

title: Meta Makes Changes to Marketing Strategy Amid Scandals
description: Since the spring, the social media company formerly known as Facebook has been evaluating where it advertises and how much it spends doing so, taking pitches from agencies that want to help manage its enormous marketing budget.

title: Texas Radio Host Who Bilked Listeners Out of Millions Is Sentenced to Life
description: William Neil Gallagher, a Texas radio host known as the Money Doctor who promoted his business on Christian radio, was sentenced to three life terms for a Ponzi scheme that defrauded more than 190 listeners of at least $23 million.

title: 3 Big Questions Looming Over the Glasgow Climate Talks
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: The friend who bought the weapon used by Kyle Rittenhouse was the first witness to testify.
description: The prosecution in Kyle Rittenhouses homicide trial called as its first witness on Tuesday the friend who bought the military-style semiautomatic rifle that Mr. Rittenhouse used to shoot three people, two of them fatally, during the unrest in Kenosha last year.

title: What Its Like to Cover Global Climate Talks
description: A look inside COP26, the global climate summit happening in Scotland.

title: Isolation Review: Dispatches From a Different Pandemic
description: Given that horror films tend to reflect our anxieties back at us, manifesting them into solid, solvable problems like zombie hordes or possessed houses, it makes sense that movie lovers have turned to the genre for comfort during the coronavirus pandemic. Filmmakers have likewise mined this moment for terrifying inspiration. Last summer Shudder released Host, a collaborative horror film made entirely over Zoom. Now Isolation, a collection of nine short horror films set all over the globe, offers stories of survival created under the limitations of quarantine. Though there are a few standout creations, the anthology is mostly muddled, privileging a heightened version of 2020 over a reality that was plenty scary on its own.

title: Military Grants Few Vaccine Exemptions as Deadlines Loom
description: WASHINGTON  Two months after the Pentagon began requiring all troops to get the coronavirus vaccine or face dismissal, the vast majority have now had shots, in part because none received a religious exemption, military officials said.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: In a move that could significantly shore up the countrys ability to fight the pandemic, the federal government cleared the last big hurdle before the Pfizer vaccine can be offered to children in the U.S.

title: Election results in the Virginia governors race could take hours or even days.
description: Expect it to be a late night in Virginia. And possibly a long week.

title: Democrats Push for Agreement on Tax Deduction That Benefits the Rich
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats were readying an agreement on Tuesday that would repeal a cap on the amount of state and local taxes that homeowners can deduct as part of a broader $1.85 trillion spending bill, a move that could amount to a significant tax cut for wealthy Americans in liberal states.

title: Reporters staked out a Brooklyn block to see if Adams lives there. The results were inconclusive.
description: One of the peculiarities of this years race for New York City mayor has been the difficulty reporters have had in pinning down where the Democratic candidate Eric Adams lives.

title: With Methane and Forest Deals, Climate Summit Offers Hope After Gloomy Start
description: GLASGOW  The world leaders gathered at a crucial climate summit secured new agreements on Tuesday to end deforestation and reduce emissions of the potent greenhouse gas methane, building momentum as the conference prepared to shift to a more grueling two weeks of negotiations on how to avert the planets catastrophic warming.

title: Pat Martino, Jazz Guitarist Who Overcame Amnesia, Dies at 77
description: Pat Martino, whose trailblazing career as a jazz guitarist seemed to end prematurely in 1980 when brain surgery left him with no memory, but who then painstakingly relearned the instrument, and his own past, and went on to three more decades of innovative musicianship, died on Monday at his home in South Philadelphia. He was 77.

title: Supreme Court Hears Free Speech Case on Politicians Censure
description: WASHINGTON  The basic question at a Supreme Court argument on Tuesday was whether elected bodies can violate the First Amendment when they censure their members for something they said. Put another way: Are censures, which are formal reprimands and a kind of punishment, a form of free speech or a threat to it?

title: The Best Decisions Happen When the Manager Should be Sleeping
description: HOUSTON  World Series pressure never rests, and neither do the participating managers. A good nights sleep? Good luck. That can wait.

title: Voting-rights groups sue to keep polls open in New Jersey for 90 extra minutes.
description: Voters in New Jersey may get an extra 90 minutes to cast ballots Tuesday night.

title: C.D.C. Recommends Covid Vaccine for Younger Children
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Tuesday formally endorsed the Pfizer-BioNTech coronavirus vaccine for children aged 5 through 11, a move that will buttress defenses against a possible surge as winter arrives and ease the worries of tens of millions of pandemic-weary parents.

title: Takeaways from the first day of the Kyle Rittenhouse trial.
description: After a single day of jury selection, the trial of Kyle Rittenhouse got underway on Tuesday with the prosecution and defense offering starkly differing interpretations of the events that led to Mr. Rittenhouse shooting three men  two of them fatally  in the aftermath of demonstrations in Kenosha, Wis., in August 2020. At the center of the case is whether Mr. Rittenhouse acted in self-defense.

title: Initial Playoff Rankings Show Georgia at Top and Numerous Potential Contenders
description: When the College Football Playoff committee gathered in recent days to determine the initial rankings of the top teams in the country, the first task was straightforward: confirm undefeated Georgia, which has mauled all comers, as No. 1.

title: The virus is surging on the Navajo Nation, despite high vaccination rates.
description: The Navajo Nation managed to tame Covid-19 earlier this year, mounting a campaign that drove its vaccination rate far above the United States average, after the virus ravaged the Navajo people.

title: For Holocaust Scholar, Another Confrontation With Neo-Nazi Hate
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: How to Get a Covid Shot for Your Kid
description: Covid shots for children ages 5 to 11 years have finally been authorized, but it may take a few days or even a week or more before kid-size doses of the vaccine are widely available in your area.

title: Republicans hold on to their last City Council seat in Queens.
description: City Council District 32, which has been held by Eric A. Ulrich since 2009, is a political rarity: It is the only Republican-held Council seat in Queens.

title: Editors Note: Nov. 3, 2021
description: An article on Monday about the Virginia governors race referred incompletely to Glenn Miller. A frequent donor to both parties, he has been active in Virginia in local efforts opposing the elimination of race-blind admissions tests in schools and has spoken out against critical race theory.

title: Shontel Brown, a Democrat, wins an Ohio House seat in a special election.
description: Shontel Brown, a Democrat, won a House seat in a special election in Cleveland on Tuesday, defeating her Republican opponent, Laverne Gore.

title: Clashing Portrayals of Kyle Rittenhouse in Testimony on Kenosha Shootings
description: Follow our live Kyle Rittenhouse trial verdict coverage.

title: 2020 Virginia Election Results
description: See full results and maps from the Virginia elections.

title: Review: Tammany Hall Votes the Party Line
description: On Tuesday, New Yorks citizens weighed in on a mayoral race between a vegan former police captain and a beret-wearing cat enthusiast.

title: Voting is over and a winner is expected tonight in the New York City mayors race.
description: Polls closed in New York City at 9 p.m., as Eric Adams and Curtis Sliwa waited to learn which of them voters had chosen to lead the nations largest city out of the throes of the pandemic and into a new political era.

title: Eric Adams Is Elected Mayor of New York City
description: Eric Leroy Adams, a former New York City police captain whose attention-grabbing persona and keen focus on racial justice fueled a decades-long career in public life, was elected on Tuesday as the 110th mayor of New York and the second Black mayor in the citys history.

title: Alvin Bragg Wins, Becoming First Black D.A. in Manhattan
description: Alvin Bragg was elected Manhattan district attorney on Tuesday and will become the first Black person to lead the influential office, which handles tens of thousands of cases a year and is conducting a high-profile investigation into former President Donald J. Trump and his family business.

title: San Francisco Police Officer Charged With Shooting Man Who Died 3 Years Later
description: A San Francisco police officer was charged with voluntary manslaughter for shooting an unarmed man who died three years after being wounded at his home in 2017, the San Francisco district attorneys office announced on Tuesday.

title: Mike Duggan wins a third term as Detroits mayor.
description: Mayor Mike Duggan of Detroit was elected to a third term on Tuesday, The Associated Press projected, as voters signaled confidence in the direction of a city that has suffered from decades of disinvestment and population loss.

title: Joie de Vivre
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Congratulations and welcome to Dan Harris, who is making his New York Times Crossword debut today!

title: Quotation of the Day: Amid Privacy Fears, Facebook Is Dropping Facial Recognition
description: Facebook getting out of the face recognition business is a pivotal moment in the growing national discomfort with this technology. Corporate use of face surveillance is very dangerous to peoples privacy.

title: John Deere workers reject a revised contract proposal, extending their strike.
description: [Update: Deere & Company said on Wednesday that it would not resume talks with the union and that the rejected proposal was its best and final offer.]

title: Michelle Wu is elected mayor of Boston.
description: BOSTON  Michelle Wu, who entered public service out of frustration with the obstacles that her immigrant family faced, will be the next mayor of Boston, pledging to make the city a proving ground for progressive policy.

title: Buffalos race for mayor appears to swing toward the write-in incumbent, Byron Brown.
description: BUFFALO, N.Y. Mayor Byron W. Brown of Buffalo, an incumbent four-term Democrat, declared victory on Tuesday night in his write-in campaign to defeat his own partys official nominee, India Walton. But Ms. Walton, a democratic socialist, refused to concede.

title: Atlanta Overcomes Decades of Frustration to Win World Series
description: HOUSTON  So, this is the Braves team that found a way to match the great Atlanta teams of the 1990s. This team, with no trio of Hall of Fame aces, no legendary manager and no backlog of World Series experience to build on, somehow found a way.

title: In N.F.L. Awards Race, M.V.P. Wont Be the Only Close Call
description: Our NFL playoffs calculator has an up-to-date look at the latest playoff picture.

title: My Name Is Cleo: Girl, 4, Is Found 18 Days After Vanishing From Campsite
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  A 4-year-old girl who vanished in the dead of night while camping with her family in a remote area of Western Australia was found alive and well 18 days later in a locked house, the authorities said on Wednesday.

title: Republicans score key wins in district attorney races on Long Island.
description: Republicans won two highly competitive district attorney races on Long Island that were seen as key tests of Democratic strength in the suburbs and support for left-leaning criminal justice measures.

title: Glenn Youngkin, a Republican financier, defeats Terry McAuliffe in the Virginia governors race.
description: McLEAN, Va.  Republicans claimed the governorship of Virginia for the first time in more than a decade on Wednesday, electing the businessman Glenn Youngkin and presenting their party with a formula for how to exploit President Bidens vulnerabilities and evade the shadow of Donald J. Trump in Democratic-leaning states.

title: Glenn Youngkins Journey From the Heights of Finance to the Top Tier of G.O.P. Politics
description: One year ago, Glenn Youngkin was well known in the world of high finance, but almost a complete cipher in politics.

title: Why Democrats Are in Trouble
description: Days before it became clear that the Republican Glenn Youngkin would win Virginias gubernatorial race, pollsters, pundits and political strategists were trying to explain why a race that was the Democrat Terry McAuliffes to lose was on its way to being lost.

title: A Chinese Tennis Star Accuses a Former Top Leader of Sexual Assault
description: Peng Shuai, the professional tennis star, publicly accused a former vice premier of China of sexual assault, igniting an online firestorm of attention to a #MeToo allegation that for the first time touched the pinnacles of Communist Party power.

title: Torn From Parents in the Belgian Congo, Women Seek Reparations
description: BRUSSELS  The girls were as young as 2, some still breastfeeding, and no older than 4 when they were taken from their mothers.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: National leaders at the COP26 climate summit agreed on two significant advances on climate change: promises to curb methane emissions and a deal to end deforestation by 2030.

title: Jimmy Fallon: Biden Can Cut Emissions Just as He Did His Ratings
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word of the Day: anomaly
Max Fried Lost Game 2. Then He Pitched Atlanta to a Title.
description: HOUSTON  Max Fried had last left Minute Maid Parks mound in frustration.

title: In photos: Candidates celebrate victories on election night.
Eric Adamss victory speech, in full.
description: Here is a lightly edited transcript of Eric Adamss speech on Tuesday at the Marriott hotel near the Brooklyn Bridge in Brooklyn after he was declared the victor in the mayors race:

title: E-Scooters, E-Bikes
description: A boom in electric-powered mobile devices is bringing what is likely to be a lasting change to New Yorks vast and crowded street grid  and to cities around the world.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: WEDNESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: South Africa secured $8.5 billion to transition away from coal. Itll be a test case.
description: For years at global climate talks, developing countries have said that they need more financial help from wealthy nations to speed up their shift away from fossil fuels.

title: Lesson of the Day: A Civil Rights Pioneer Seeks to Have Her Record Cleared
description: Featured Article: A Civil Rights Pioneer Seeks to Have Her Record Cleared by Eduardo Medina

title: The Critic Elizabeth Hardwick Was Very Tough on Biographies. Now Heres One of Her.
description: To be a literary biographer is to court the extravagant ridicule of the very people you write about. For all of the salutary services a writers biography can offer  the tracing of the life, the contextualizing of the work, the resuscitation of a reputation and the deliverance from neglect  the biographer has been derided as a post-mortem exploiter (Henry James) and a professional burglar (Janet Malcolm).

title: The Decade That Changed America Forever
description: THE SHATTERING America in the 1960sBy Kevin Boyle

title: The Strange Effects of Putting an Ordinary Woman Into Glamorous Images
description: The woman in one video emerges from a Rolls-Royce wearing nothing but underwear and sunglasses, her arm draped across her bare chest. In another image, a woman in a green bikini and thigh-high patent-leather boots clutches a wall as if suddenly realizing shes had one too many. A video features a couple of Kardashian-Jenners palpating a wall illuminated by blinking neon tube lights. A woman straddles her open hatchback while wrapped in string.

title: Cardio Before Weight Lifting May Help Boost Muscle
description: Riding or running before you lift weights could amplify the effects of the lifting, according to a helpful new study of the molecular impacts of combining endurance and resistance exercise in a single workout. The study, which involved eight physically active men, found that 20 minutes of intense cycling right before an upper-body weight routine alters the inner workings of muscles, priming them to change and grow more than with lifting alone.

title: Would You Ever Want to Run a Marathon?
description: A marathon is 26.2 miles. Many people who enter these races feel that simply crossing the finish line is an accomplishment, though others try to get there as fast as they can without risking injury.

title: Young Children Are Lining Up for Next Wave of Covid Vaccines
description: In Houston, Texas Childrens Hospital on Wednesday morning tackled the first of some 35,000 pediatric Covid-19 vaccine appointments, a rush that officials said had been booked in just five days. Nationally, Walgreens and CVS pharmacies opened appointment lines for millions of miniature doses. And amid a deluge of demand from parents desperate to get their children at least partially inoculated by Thanksgiving, Dr. Eric Ball realized he would have to skip some of his friends daughters bat mitzvah.

title: Republicans Schooled the Left in Virginia
description: After Terry McAuliffe stumbled to defeat in a state that Joe Biden won by 10 points exactly one year ago tonight, a mild suggestion seems in order: Democrats probably need a new way to talk about progressive ideology and education.

title: We Need to Talk About the Dark Side of Daylight Saving Time
description: On Nov. 7, most of us will fall back an hour and restart the decades-old discussion of why we shift time twice a year.

title: Michelle Wu Proved That Boston Isnt the Same Old Boston Anymore
description: BOSTON  Time to retire the tired old tropes about Brahmin swells, Irish ward heelers and the petty parochialism that for too long has defined this city on the national stage. A Taiwanese American woman from Chicago is about to become the mayor of Boston, a town that, until Tuesday, had elected only white men to that office.

title: The Third Rail of American Politics Is Still Electrifying
description: Although public polling on immigration shows a strong shift to the left, survey responses in that vein mask a far more complicated reality. Over and over again, immigration has proved to be politically problematic for Democrats. As far back as 2007, when he was chairman of the House Democratic Caucus, Rahm Emanuel warned that immigration had become the new third rail of American politics.

title: Can We Separate the Art From the Artist?
description: A long, long time ago  I can still remember how that music used to make me smile.

title: This Is the Shadiest Part of the Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has come under increasing scrutiny for its so-called shadow docket: rulings issued on an expedited basis without the full briefing, argumentation and written opinions that cases on its main docket receive. These rulings are often divided along partisan lines, as seen in a recent, and controversial, example: the conservative majoritys rejection of a request in September to pause a Texas abortion law until it could be more fully reviewed.

title: Its Apple Season. This Galette Cuts the Chill With a Kick.
description: A few weeks ago, when I called Krissy Scommegna, the 32-year-old owner of the Boonville Barn Collective in Boonville, Calif., she was taking a break after clocking three hours in the greenhouse pulling off the stems and shaking out the seeds from 750 pounds of chiles. I wasnt quick enough to do the math, but because she, a few friends who came to lend a hand and the three people who work with her had harvested 15,000 pounds of peppers in their first pass across the fields, I figured they had a lot to do before the second harvest, and the third. All those peppers have to be picked, set in the greenhouses for a time, stemmed and seeded, dehydrated, ground, scooped and sealed into jars. We grow esoteric chiles, Krissy said with a full and easy laugh, but were a down-to-earth farm.

title: He Escaped Prison in 2015. Did He Kill a Young Mother Decades Before?
description: TONAWANDA, N.Y.  In February 1993, Deborah Meindl walked into her house in this working-class Buffalo suburb on a blustery Wednesday afternoon, and never left.

title: The Mystery of Havana Syndrome
description: A long time ago, soon after I arrived in the Soviet Union as a young wire service reporter and became acutely aware that I was being followed, my eye began to twitch.

title: A New Kind of Native American Dance Troupe
description: One day in October, the dancer Kenneth Shirley got a message from Injury Reserve, a hip-hop group he had befriended in Phoenix, where he grew up and still lives. The band was performing in Manhattan and had noticed from Shirleys Instagram posts that he was on the East Coast, too. Would he like to come to the show as a guest?

title: Attention, New Englanders: Fluffernutter Is Now a Word
description: New England is where Marshmallow Fluff was created more than 100 years ago, and is still made and largely consumed  often by children in a peanut butter and Marshmallow Fluff sandwich.

title: Justices Questions Suggest New York Gun Control Law Is Unlikely to Survive
description: WASHINGTON  A New York law that imposes strict limits on carrying guns outside the home seemed unlikely to survive its encounter with the Supreme Court, based on questioning from the justices on Wednesday.

title: Paul Newman Will Tell His Own Story, 14 Years After His Death
description: Decades ago, the actor and philanthropist Paul Newman, frustrated by all the unauthorized biographies and coverage of his life, recorded his own oral history, leaving behind transcripts that for years were forgotten in the basement laundry room of his house in Connecticut.

title: This Movie Season, Its a Black-and-White Boom
description: Do not adjust that dial. Over the coming months, whether youre watching new films on a streaming service or at the multiplex, more than a few of those movies are likely to be in black and white.

title: A Sinking Student Housing Empire
description: Between the busted elevators, the malfunctioning fire alarms and the utilities being shut off for weeks at a time, the students at a half-dozen off-campus housing complexes across the country say theyre not getting what they paid for.

title: Did Covid Change How We Dream?
description: Deirdre Barretts body was in bed, but her mind was in a library. The library was inside a very old house, with glowing oil lamps and shelves of beautiful leatherbound books. At first it felt snug and secure and timeless, exactly the sort of place an academic like Barrett, who teaches in the psychiatry department at Harvard Medical School and edits the scientific journal Dreaming, might find inviting. But as the dream went on, she remembered later, I became less able to focus on the library and more overwhelmed by the unseen horror outside. Beyond the windows of the softly lit library, a terrible plague was ravaging the world.

title: For the Astros, a Stinging Loss and an Uncertain Future
description: HOUSTON  Dusty Baker talked eloquently over the weekend about how this particular group of Houston Astros was gritty and battle-tested. After a win in Atlanta pulled the team to within three games to two in this World Series, he and star shortstop Carlos Correa both spoke of this teams knack for dramatic comebacks.

title: Alice Childress Finally Gets to Make Trouble on Broadway
description: Wiletta Mayer walks into the theater already knowing how things will go. Smartly dressed, attractive and middle-aged (dont ask for a number, because a woman thatll tell her age will tell anything), she is a veteran actress whos played maids and mammies and knows how to cater to white directors and producers. You can call it Uncle Tomming. Or you can call it plain common sense. Either way, its a living.

title: In a Workers Economy, Who Really Holds the Cards?
description: Zella Roberts was one of the highest performing waitresses at the Sonic drive-in in Asheville, N.C., her manager told her, but there were days during the pandemic when she questioned whether she could continue her job. The customers were unruly and often unmasked; the base pay was $5 an hour. Then one afternoon, last November, a man coughed in her face as she served him a hot dog. Ms. Roberts went home and cried.

title: Rough Night for Democrats Exposes the Partys Weakness
description: The menacing thunder couldnt get much louder for Democrats.

title: Your Garden Isnt Winding Down: Its Still Lichen Season
description: What are lichens? They are neither plant nor animal.

title: Climate Change Threatens Wine, and a Way of Life, in Jura
description: On the banks of the Cuisance River in eastern France, scattered between the ancient stone houses of the Arbois commune, small groups of wine enthusiasts sat under the fall sun, sipping on chardonnay and trousseau grown in the foothills of the Jura mountains, one of the smallest but most beloved wine regions in France.

title: 5 Minutes That Will Make You Love Bach
description: In the past weve chosen the five minutes or so we would play to make our friends fall in love with classical music, piano, opera, cello, Mozart, 21st-century composers, violin, Baroque music, sopranos, Beethoven, flute, string quartets, tenors, Brahms, choral music, percussion, symphonies, Stravinsky, trumpet and Maria Callas.

title: From BTS to Squid Game: How South Korea Became a Cultural Juggernaut
description: PAJU, South Korea  In a new Korean drama being filmed inside a cavernous studio building outside of Seoul, a detective chases down a man cursed to live for 600 years. Pistol shots crack. A hush follows. Then, a woman pierces the silence, screaming: I told you not to shoot him in the heart!

title: Eric Adams, Mayor-Elect
description: Good morning. Eric Adams, who found a place in New York Citys political consciousness as a reform-minded police officer more than 20 years ago, was elected mayor. And scroll down to meet some deep-sea look-alikes that could scare you  unless you like sharks.

title: Colorado hospitals are nearly full as the state battles a growing caseload.
description: Colorado is experiencing its worst coronavirus wave in a year and its overwhelmed hospitals are now allowed to turn away new patients.

title: Weekly Accessible Learning Activities: Analyze a Photo, Write a Story, Reflect on Community
description: Each Wednesday, we shine a spotlight on five student activities that support a broad range of learners. In this weeks roundup of accessible activities, we invite students to learn about Indigenous environmental activism, recommend new music, tell us a story, closely analyze a photograph and watch a short film about a beachfront haven for Black families.

title: Here are five takeaways from the election results.
description: Glenn Youngkin, a Republican business executive, marched to victory in Tuesdays election, delivering his party the governorship of Virginia and highlighting a strong night for Republicans less than a year after voters pushed them fully out of power in the nations capital.

title: Catch up on Election Day results from around the U.S.
description: A year after voters elected President Biden and pushed Republicans fully out of power in Washington, the G.O.P. rebounded with a strong election night on Tuesday, highlighted by Glenn Youngkins victory in the Virginia governors race.

title: Governments must create millions of new green jobs, Ban Ki-moon says.
description: Global leaders must create jobs in the renewable energy sector so that the costs of transitioning from fossil fuels do not exacerbate economic inequalities, Ban Ki-moon, the former United Nations secretary general, said on Wednesday on the sidelines of the COP26 climate summit in Glasgow.

title: With Mammoth Blasts, Jorge Soler Wins World Series M.V.P.
description: HOUSTON  Growing up in Cuba, Atlanta Braves outfielder Jorge Soler was already so tall by around 9 or 10, his father said, that people didnt believe his age.

title: Making His Marathon Debut, With a Lot of Help From New Friends
description: HANOVER, N.H.  Ben True spent years training alone. A solitary figure on the roads and trails near his home here in Hanover, he logged long miles in pursuit of distance-running glory. It was not that he wanted to be doing everything by himself, without the help of a team. But New Hampshire  far from the running meccas of Boulder, Colo., or Flagstaff, Ariz.  is home for him.

title: A Last Chance to Avert Climate Disaster?
description: In a giant conference hall in Glasgow, leaders from around the world have gathered for the Conference of Parties to the United Nations Climate Change Convention, or COP26. This is the 26th such session.

title: Spain is facing the loss of a major source of natural gas.
description: Algeria has stopped supplying gas through one of its main pipelines that crosses Morocco, a move that could threaten Spain with reduced supplies or higher prices for natural gas as winter approaches and energy costs are soaring.

title: The Heart and Soul of a Franchise Shines Through
description: HOUSTON  The friendliest man in baseball is a champion. Freddie Freeman, the Atlanta Braves slugger known for smiles, small talk and soft-serve ice cream, hit the last home run of the season and caught the throw from shortstop for the final out of the World Series. Nice guys finish first.

title: Global finance industry says it has $130 trillion to invest in efforts to tackle climate change.
description: A coalition of the worlds biggest investors, banks and insurers that collectively control $130 trillion in assets said on Wednesday that they were committing to use that capital to hit net zero emissions targets in their investments by 2050, in a push that would make limiting climate change a central focus of most major financial decisions for decades to come.

title: A new $10.5 billion fund aims to spur green energy projects in poor countries.
description: A group of philanthropic foundations and international development banks on Wednesday announced a $10.5 billion fund to help emerging economies with growing energy needs make the switch from fossil fuels to renewable sources.

title: Virginia Goes Red
description: Democrats had a rough election night. They lost the governors race in Virginia, a state Joe Biden won by 10 percentage points only a year ago. In New Jersey, which Biden won by 16 points, the governors election is too close to call.

title: The Harder They Fall Review: A New Look for the Old West
description: A note at the beginning of The Harder They Fall asserts that while the story is fictional, These. People. Existed. This isnt about historical accuracy, or even realism; its about genre. The movie, directed by Jeymes Samuel (from a screenplay he wrote with Boaz Yakin), is a high-style pop Western, with geysers of blood, winks of nasty, knowing humor and an eclectic, joyfully anachronistic soundtrack featuring cuts from Jay-Z, Fela Kuti and Nina Simone alongside Samuels original score.

title: How Does The New York Times Cover International News? We Asked Our Reporters.
Duterte vows to punish Philippine officials for slow vaccine delivery.
description: President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines has warned local officials that they will be punished if they fail to meet vaccination targets as the country slowly reopens.

title: Janet Yellen, the Treasury secretary, says the U.S. will help raise $500 million for green bonds.
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Wednesday that the United States would support a financing mechanism that aims to direct $500 million a year to move developing countries away from coal-based energy and toward wind, solar and other low- and zero-carbon energy sources.

title: New York Times Adds 455,000 Subscriptions in Third Quarter
description: The New York Times Company said on Wednesday that it added 455,000 new digital subscriptions in the third quarter, a gain that keeps the publisher on pace to reach its stated goal of 10 million subscriptions by 2025.

title: A Republican narrowly flipped a State House seat in San Antonio.
description: SAN ANTONIO  Growing up in a working-class neighborhood in San Antonio, Adolfo Chagoy had long supported local and national Democrats who touted job growth and infrastructure projects.

title: Big Warning Signs for the Biden Economic Agenda
description: Republicans scored big in yesterdays elections. Most notably, the former private equity mogul Glenn Youngkin won the race for Virginias governorship. It is a major warning sign for President Biden and Democrats that their legislative plans are under threat.

title: Ethiopias Leader Vows to Bury This Enemy, Even as Rebels Advance
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  As rebel fighters drew closer to the capital on Wednesday, Ethiopias embattled leader appealed to his soldiers to defend the city with our blood, in a stark and inflammatory speech that heightened the mounting air of crisis in Africas second-most populous country.

title: Vaccination status and Thanksgiving could be a really combustible mix, experts say.
description: Last year, pre-Thanksgiving concerns centered on social distancing and taking risks with the coronavirus. This year, the focus is inoculation; more than 192 million Americans had been fully vaccinated as of Sunday morning, but that is only about 58 percent of the total population.

title: Killed in a 1961 Crash, Unknown Boy Is Finally Identified
description: They called him Unknown Boy.

title: Hastings Law to Change Name Linked to Native Massacres
description: As a law student in 1950s San Francisco, Willie Brown paid little heed to the name of the school he was attending: the Hastings College of the Law, named after the states first chief justice, whose dark past was not widely known.

title: How Atlanta Retooled Its Team on the Fly
description: The Braves needed to turn their season around this summer. To say it worked is an understatement.

title: Your Guide to the 2021 New York City Marathon
description: After a long, marathon-less year, the New York City Marathon returns in triumphant fashion on Sunday, Nov. 7.

title: Popcast Mailbag! Halsey, Nicki, TikTok and, of Course, Taylor
description: You ask, we answer. Or prevaricate. It depends!

title: This Fish Loses 20 Teeth Each Day, Then Grows Them All Back
description: If there is one place you dont want to stick your finger, its the mouth of a Pacific lingcod. These fearsome fish, which can grow up to five feet in length and weigh 80 pounds, have around 500 needlelike teeth sticking out of jaws that are strong enough to crush crustaceans.

title: Buffalos mayoral race appears to have swung toward the write-in incumbent, but the count will take time.
description: BUFFALO, N.Y. Mayor Byron W. Brown of Buffalo, an incumbent four-term Democrat, declared victory on Tuesday night in his write-in campaign to defeat his own partys official nominee, India Walton. But Ms. Walton, a democratic socialist, refused to concede.

title: Michelle Wu is the first woman and first person of color to be elected mayor of Boston.
description: BOSTON  Michelle Wu, who entered public service out of frustration with the obstacles that her immigrant family faced, will be the next mayor of Boston, pledging to make the city a proving ground for progressive policy.

title: Terry McAuliffe concedes to Glenn Youngkin, a Republican financier, in the Virginia governors race.
description: Former Gov. Terry McAuliffe, the Democratic candidate for governor in Virginia, conceded on Wednesday morning to his Republican opponent, the businessman Glenn Youngkin, as the Republican Party claimed the states governorship for the first time in more than a decade.

title: Australias climate pledges fall short, again, critics say.
description: Australia, a major producer of fossil fuels that has long been criticized for dragging its feet on climate change, has done little this week to change that perception.

title: New Funding Offshoot Expands Grants to Arts Groups in the Southeast
description: Last year, when the Ford Foundation announced an initiative to give more than $100 million to arts groups run by people of color, none of the 20 initial recipients were in the Southeast.

title: Open Air and Panoramic Views in Acapulco
description: This contemporary five-bedroom home overlooking Acapulco Bay, on the southwest coast of Mexico, is on the market for $2.9 million.

title: House Hunting in Mexico: A Modern Hillside Masterpiece in Acapulco
description: This contemporary five-bedroom home overlooks Acapulco Bay from within the hillside gated community of Las Brisas in Acapulco, on Mexicos Pacific Coast. The house was designed by the renowned Mexican architect Miguel ngel Aragons and completed last year, said Laura de la Torre de Skipsey, an agent with Mexico Sothebys International Realty, which has the listing.

title: Meet the new meme stocks? Shares of Avis and Bed Bath & Beyond soar.
description: Shares of the rental car company Avis Budget Group more than doubled on Tuesday, in a sudden and unexpected surge that recalled earlier trading manias in GameStop, AMC Entertainment and other so-called meme stocks. Bed Bath & Beyond, the retailer that attracted some interest during previous meme-stock episodes, also rose sharply in late trading.

title: As deadlines loom, the U.S. military grants few vaccine exemptions.
description: Two months after the Pentagon began requiring all troops to get the coronavirus vaccine or face dismissal, the vast majority have now had shots, in part because none received a religious exemption, military officials said.

title: Everything About You Must Say Power
A protest outside the main summit venue calls out greenwashing by big companies.
description: As delegates inside the COP26 conference hall in Glasgow heard promises of new private-sector funding for climate change, protesters marched in the city on Wednesday in opposition to greenwashing  when companies claim to be protecting the environment while continuing to harm it.

title: Central banks around the world are dialing back their pandemic-era support.
description: Tangled supply chains, rising costs for raw goods and soaring consumer demand have combined to push prices rapidly higher in many wealthy countries, prodding central banks around the world to start dialing back some of the extraordinary economic support measures they put in place during the pandemic.

title: What to Read: 4 New Coffee Table Books
description: From a compendium of contemporary Black artists to American family portraits to photographs of nature at its most serene, the images herein reveal decades worth of research and reflection.

title: Newly Published, From Elie Wiesel to The Loneliest Americans
description: FILLED WITH FIRE AND LIGHT: Portraits and Legends From the Bible, Talmud, and Hasidic World, by Elie Wiesel. (Schocken, $27.) A posthumous collection, edited by Alan Rosen and adapted from a series of Wiesels lectures between 1967 and 2014, examines lesser-known biblical figures and encourages a path toward purpose and transcendence.

title: Aunjanue Ellis Leans Into a Supporting Role and Turns It Into a Talker
description: The actress Aunjanue Ellis is nearly 30 years into an onscreen career, but until about a decade ago, she thought it was all a fluke.

title: An Almanac of Covid Dreams
description: At the height of the pandemic in 2020, thousands of people shared their Covid dreams on Twitter, many of them under the hashtag #coronadreams. Here is a small selection.

title: Julianne Boyd to Retire After 27 Years at Barrington Stage
description: Julianne Boyd, who has served as artistic director of Barrington Stage Company since cofounding the Western Massachusetts nonprofit in 1995, will retire next fall.

title: Republicans Block a Second Voting Rights Bill in the Senate
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans on Wednesday blocked legislation to restore parts of the landmark Voting Rights Act weakened by Supreme Court rulings, making it the second major voting bill to be derailed by a G.O.P. filibuster in the past two weeks.

title: ISIS Poses a Growing Threat to New Taliban Government in Afghanistan
description: JALALABAD, Afghanistan  Aref Mohammads war against the Islamic State ended earlier this fall when his unit of Taliban fighters was ambushed by the terrorist group in eastern Afghanistan. A bullet shattered his femur, leaving him disabled and barely able to walk, never mind fight.

title: How to Block Your Phone from Interrupting You
description: Sometimes, you just need to get stuff done  that budget spreadsheet, your novel or even a nap  but your smartphone insists on distracting you with notifications, texts or the pull of social media. Sure, the Do Not Disturb setting can temporarily stifle interruptions when you need quiet time or a mental break, but recent versions of Android and Apples new iOS 15 include a more flexible Focus mode with other tools for concentration. Heres a quick guide.

title: What You Remember About Jesus Christ Superstar
description: Fifty year ago, Jesus Christ Superstar landed on Broadway at the Mark Hellinger Theater, and the careers of Andrew Lloyd Webber, Tim Rice and Ben Vereen would never be the same. Responding to a recent article celebrating the anniversary, nearly 400 readers shared their own memories of hearing, seeing or acting in the show, then and since. Here is an edited selection.

title: After a Gloomy Summit Start, Hints of Progress
description: The world leaders gathered at the climate summit in Glasgow secured new agreements on Tuesday to end deforestation and reduce emissions of methane, a potent greenhouse gas. Now, the conference shifts to a more grueling phase.

title: When the Soccer Is Just a Story Line
description: LONDON  The cameras were rolling even before the actors Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney could be sure there would be anything to film.

title: With Cuomo Gone, Hochul Revises Plan for Penn Station
description: Gov. Kathy Hochul put her imprint on an ambitious plan to restore Pennsylvania Station on Wednesday, saying she would place a priority on improvements at the busy rail hub while scaling back a development deal that her predecessor launched to help fund the project.

title: Thank You, Claudia Roden!
description: Good morning. A real cornucopia of victuals arrived in the blue-bagged newspapers we delivered to Times home-delivery subscribers this morning!

title: Organizers blame the pandemic as frustrations grow over long waits and other glitches at the climate conference.
description: Logistical complaints are mounting at the United Nations climate conference in Glasgow, where participants waiting in security lines for more than an hour were abruptly told on Wednesday afternoon that there was no room for them inside the venue.

title: Trump, who had little engagement with Youngkins campaign, claims credit for his victory.
description: CHANTILLY, Va.  Former President Donald J. Trump never appeared in public with Glenn Youngkin, Virginias new Republican governor-elect. Other than delivering a six-minute speech during a conference call with supporters on Monday and issuing a few written statements, Mr. Trump was not that involved in Mr. Youngkins campaign.

title: Yes, the Pandemic Has Been Awful. But There Are Signs of Hope for Mothers at Work.
description: This article has been updated to reflect news events.

title: We Can Now See the Playbook for Overturning Roe v. Wade
description: After Mondays Supreme Court oral arguments, the writing seems to be on the wall for Senate Bill 8, the Texas law that bans abortion starting about six weeks after a persons last menstrual period and that hands enforcement to private citizens. It now looks as though two conservative justices may flip on the Texas law and put it in jeopardy  while clearing the way for the ultimate goal of overturning Roe v. Wade next year.

title: Inflation Bonds Are Getting a Big Rate Bump
description: As the country recovers from the pandemic, rising prices have become a worry for many Americans. But inflation has also driven up rates on some government savings bonds, creating an opportunity for people seeking a safe haven for their cash.

title: Sunao Tsuboi, 96, Dies; Hiroshima Victim Who Lived to Tell His Story
description: Sunao Tsuboi, who as a 20-year-old engineering student found himself less than a mile from the center of the atomic blast at Hiroshima and somehow survived, and who went on to devote himself to the cause of nuclear disarmament, including in a much-publicized meeting with President Barack Obama in 2016, died on Oct. 24 at a hospital in Hiroshima. He was 96.

title: Aaron Rodgers Out After Positive Coronavirus Test
description: Green Bay Packers star quarterback Aaron Rodgers will miss at least Sundays game at Kansas City after testing positive for the coronavirus.

title: In Virginia, frustration with schooling during the pandemic played a part in Youngkins win.
description: Glenn Youngkin, a Republican, campaigned heavily on education  and in opposition to what he called critical race theory  in his successful campaign for Virginia governor against the Democrat Terry McAuliffe. But Mr. Youngkin also made an issue of the states handling of schooling during the pandemic, which may have played a part in his win.

title: Black voters in Virginia refuse to be blamed for a major Democratic defeat.
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va.  Democrats across Virginia expressed profound disappointment on Wednesday after Republicans romped to an unlikely victory in the governors race, an ominous sign for the Democratic Party ahead of next years midterm elections.

title: 3 Art Gallery Shows to See Right Now
description: When the Nashville-born artist Shannon Cartier Lucy, who had earlier success with a conceptual practice, re-emerged last year after a decade-long absence from the art world, it was with a crisp, realistic style. This show is her second at Lubov, a small gallery in a worn walk-up in Chinatown whose office space remnants make it seem as though the previous tenants absconded in the middle of the night. The setting adds to the through-the-looking-glass quality of Lucys paintings.

title: Gucci Makes a Hollywood Entrance
description: LOS ANGELES  On election night in much of America, in the shadow of Graumans Chinese Theater and amid the panting anticipation for Ridley Scotts House of Gucci film, the actual Gucci designer Alessandro Michele brought the Gucci Love Parade, his first in-person show since February 2020, to Hollywood Boulevard.

title: Shadows of the Klan, the Ghost of Hendrix, and Fans Who Think Im White
description: Since I integrated my hometown as a baby, Ive been wrestling with issues of race.

title: After Celebrating the U.S. Abroad, Biden Returns to Challenges at Home
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden on Wednesday returned from his second trip abroad since taking office aiming to celebrate the return of U.S. leadership on the global stage and hoping for Democratic victories in key elections in Virginia and New Jersey. It did not work out like that.

title: I Could Never Abandon Them: Neopets Users Play On
description: A devoted corps of users has kept this sparkly but outdated digital world, where magical pets have been reared since 1999, afloat. Recently, droves of pandemic-era nostalgia seekers have joined them.

title: China Could Have 1,000 Nuclear Warheads by 2030, Pentagon Says
description: WASHINGTON  China is continuing to strengthen its strategic nuclear arsenal and could have 1,000 nuclear warheads by 2030, according to a new Defense Department report released Wednesday.

title: The W.H.O. grants Covaxin, a Covid vaccine developed in India, emergency authorization.
description: The World Health Organization on Wednesday granted emergency authorization to Covaxin, the first coronavirus vaccine developed in India and to get the designation, providing a major boost for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who has stressed his intention of making the countrys pandemic prevention effort self-reliant.

title: U.S. Blacklists Israeli Firm NSO Group Over Spyware
description: In a remarkable breach with Israel over one of its most successful technology companies, the Biden administration on Wednesday blacklisted the NSO Group, saying the company knowingly supplied spyware that has been used by foreign governments to maliciously target the phones of dissidents, human rights activists, journalists and others.

title: Satellite monitoring of emissions from countries and companies changes everything, Al Gore says.
description: One of the challenges in holding companies and countries accountable for their roles in global warming is how greenhouse gas emission data has been self-reported, former Vice President Al Gore said Wednesday on the sidelines of the COP26 climate summit in Glasgow.

title: European Steel Plan Shows Bidens Bid to Merge Climate and Trade Policy
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden has promised to use trade policy as a tool to mitigate climate change. This weekend, the administration provided its first look at how it plans to mesh those policy goals, saying the United States and the European Union would try to curb carbon emissions as part of a trade deal covering steel and aluminum.

title: Lawyers for Rust Armorer Say Gun Was Briefly Unattended Before Shooting
description: The lawyers for the armorer on the film Rust  who has been under scrutiny since Alec Baldwin fatally shot the movies cinematographer with a gun that was not supposed to contain live ammunition  said in interviews on Wednesday that the gun had been left unattended for hours, but later corrected themselves to say it had only been several minutes.

title: Tech Cant Fix the Problem of Cars
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. Here is a collection of past columns.

title: Aida Rodriguez Wants You to Laugh at the Pain
description: AUSTIN, Texas  I didnt know I was half Dominican until I got older, the comedian Aida Rodriguez said from the stage at the Stateside Theater. They broke it to me like it was bad news.

title: Tony Downs, Economist Who Studied Why People Vote, Dies at 90
description: Anthony Downs majored in political theory along with international relations at Carleton College in Northfield, Minn., but by the time he graduated in 1952 the most enduring lesson he had learned about democracy had come from his fellow students rather than his professors.

title: Who Can Make mRNA Vaccines?
description: Many health advocates say a key solution is to make the shots in the regions that still dont have them. I wanted to know whether there were companies that could do it.

title: Review: Dr. Brain, Your New South Korean TV Crush
description: Dr. Brain has not received the launch that you might expect for a mini-series made by a significant South Korean filmmaker, one thats an important building block in Apple TV+s attempt to upgrade its international content.
