title: Kristina Wong, Sweatshop Overlord Review: Our Sewing Superhero
description: Before the lights go down at New York Theater Workshop, Kristina Wong gets up from her Hello Kitty sewing machine, where shes been making a face mask, to deliver some trigger warnings about the solo performance shes about to give.

title: Wells Guide for Getting Through the Holidays
description: Lets start with the good news. We have the tools we need to lower the risk of Covid when traveling or spending time together indoors. They are:

title: Review: The Visitor Lags Behind the Times
description: What comes to mind when you think about immigration, ICE and deportation? Im willing to bet more than a few George Washingtons that its not musical. Perhaps it is doable to respect the politics around these issues and the immigrants trying to build a life in the United States in this format, but its tough. Which is why the new musical The Visitor feels so obtuse and helplessly dated.

title: The Moose Came Marching In, and Stole the Hearts of Canadians
description: She was a young moose, not even 2 years old, still getting used to her surroundings, when she took a wrong turn on Thursday and crashed through the window of an elementary school classroom in Saskatoon, in Canadas central prairie.

title: The Best Movies and TV Shows New to Netflix, Amazon and Stan in Australia in November
description: Every month, streaming services in Australia add a new batch of movies and TV shows to its library. Here are our picks for November.

title: Citing the Pain of a Demanding Job, Buster Posey Retires at 34
description: Moments after Buster Posey, the star catcher who guided the San Francisco Giants through the teams greatest era with three World Series titles, surprisingly announced his retirement on Thursday, one of his former bosses wanted to be sure.

title: T-Bird Alternative
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  One thing you can say about Joseph Greenbaum is that he covers a lot of territory. This is only his second appearance in The New York Times, but its also the second example Ive seen of a puzzle he has made that leaps nimbly from answer to colorful answer. He rarely makes utilitarian concessions or resorts to crosswordese.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC  Todays passage is from a 2018 book by Melissa Dahl called Cringeworthy: A Theory of Awkwardness, which explores putting your foot in your mouth as a fundamental human experience. The passage concerns memories, both fond and embarrassing, forged at particular moments in ones life.

title: Federal Government Cuts Ties With Troubled Vaccine Maker
description: WASHINGTON  The federal government has canceled its contract with a troubled Covid-19 vaccine manufacturer that ruined millions of doses and had to halt production for months after regulators raised serious quality concerns.

title: The Curious Tale of Mr. Kale
description: I met Mr. Kale on the checkout line at Whole Foods in TriBeCa more than two years ago. It was in the cards  sort of.

title: Steve Sheinkins Explosive Sequel to Bomb
description: FALLOUTSpies, Superbombs, and the Ultimate Cold War ShowdownBy Steve Sheinkin

title: What Does War Feel Like to a Child?
description: HOW WAR CHANGED RONDOBy Romana Romanyshyn and Andriy LesivTranslated by Oksana Lushchevska

title: Quotation of the Day: Delayed 50th Marathon Is Milestone of the Citys Resilience
description: Being able to run the marathon and see all these other people who are also very cognizant that New York is still alive and well  I feel like thats going to be really powerful.

title: Corrections: Nov. 5, 2021
description: An article on Thursday about the Republican strategy to turn education into a potent wedge issue misstated Representative Kevin McCarthys title. He is the House minority leader, not its majority leader.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: The Italian port city of Trieste last month became the epicenter of protests against the governments new health pass. It is now home to a Covid outbreak linked directly to those protests that threatens to burden intensive care units, with an unvaccinated minority endangering public health.

title: Israel Moves to Silence the Stalwarts of Palestinian Civil Society
description: On Oct. 19, the Israeli Ministry of Defense singled out six of the most prominent Palestinian human rights and civil society organizations, using secret, and thus far insufficient, evidence to accuse them of being terrorist organizations with links to a militant group. Just days later, Israel approved the construction of more than 3,000 new settlement units in the occupied West Bank and announced plans to double the Jewish-Israeli population in the Jordan Valley by 2026.

title: Laughs No More? Australians Are Reassessing a Beloved Cartoonist.
description: Among my familys most prized possessions is a small framed drawing of two faeries holding hands, flying through the night sky. It is an original by the Australian cartoonist Michael Leunig. He gave it to my mother after it accompanied an article she wrote in The Age newspaper in the early 1980s, about my 5-year-old claim that I was the Queen of the Faeries. Until recently, this was a simple treasure: a drawing of me and my mother imagined by one of Australias most beloved artists. My feelings about it recently have become a bit more complicated.

title: Jimmy Kimmel: Aaron Is a Karen
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word of the Day: laissez-faire
Spelling Bee Forum
description: FRIDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: A Nuclear-Powered Shower? Russia Tests a Climate Innovation.
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Love Hard Review: Seeking Connection, Not Perfection
description: Love Hard, directed by Hernn Jimnez, centers on Natalie (Nina Dobrev), a Los Angeles journalist who chronicles her unlucky dating encounters for a digital publication. When she matches with her dream guy on the East Coast, Tag (Darren Barnet), she decides on a whim to surprise him for the holidays.

title: Under the Sea
description: Use your imagination to write the opening of a short story or poem inspired by this photo  or, tell us about a memory from your own life that this image makes you think of.

title: Lesson of the Day: A Close Look at My Day of the Dead Altar
description: This lesson is a part of our new Accessible Activities feature, which aims to welcome a wider variety of learners to our site and to The Times. Learn more and tell us what you think here.

title: New York Becomes Marathon City Once Again
description: Its Friday. Well look at the New York City Marathon, which will celebrate its 50th running this weekend with an expected 30,000 people on the starting line. Well also look at the continuing fallout from Election Day in New York and New Jersey.

title: Letters to the Editor on the 125th Anniversary Issue
description: To the Editor:

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
description: Selections from the current Weekend section, including a review of Spencer, Pablo Larrans new film about Princess Diana.

title: Theres a New 750-Mile Bicycle Route in New York. Take a Look.
description: We rode every inch of it, from Manhattan to Buffalo to the Canadian border. This is what it was like.

title: Memoirs of Womanhood by Emily Ratajkowski, Toufah Jallow and N. West Moss
description: MY BODY EssaysBy Emily Ratajkowski 237 pp. Metropolitan Books. $26.

title: New in Paperback: First Principles and The Searcher
description: COLLECTED STORIES, by Shirley Hazzard. Edited by Brigitta Olubas. Foreword by Zo Heller. (Picador, 368 pp., $18.) Gathered into a single important and elegant volume, as the Times critic Dwight Garner called it, the National Book Award-winning Australian American writers short stories from the 1960s (before she turned to novels) show a mature talent, dispensing intelligence and irony as if each were fresh herbs in a reticule she kept tied to the belt of her dress.

title: Do You Think It Is Time to Get Rid of Daylight Saving Time?
description: Daylight Saving ends on Sunday, Nov. 7. Its the time of year when we turn our clocks back one hour.

title: With a Baby on the Way, It Was Time to Embrace My Disability
description: Scrolling past dozens of baby carriers online, I couldnt find one that would allow me to strap an infant to my chest using only one hand. In a few months, my wife, Lisa, would give birth to our first child, and I was searching for the perfect carrier to ease my anxiety as an expectant father with cerebral palsy.

title: When Art and Music Collide
description: Adam Samuel Eaker was looking forward to an evening of music the night he met Brandon Patrick George in March 2019. Falling for the musician, though, was not meant to be part of the program.

title: The Crush That Turned Into Something Much More
description: Ernest Owens spotted Barry Johnson at a Black fraternity party in 2013, during Mr. Johnsons first week of orientation for new students at the University of Pennsylvania. Mr. Owens, then beginning his senior year, was quick to introduce himself.

title: Making Time to Connect on a Wednesday
description: Getting out of work early enough for a midweek date was almost impossible for Whitney Montgomery when she met Lennie Breland on the dating app Black People Meet in October 2013. So when Mr. Breland asked her for a first date on a Wednesday, she suggested a different day. But he was pretty insistent about Wednesday.

title: An Adventure in the Conventional
description: On their first date, at a New York restaurant in late February 2020, Jessica Rosenblum told Steve Young that he looked like a lot more fun in his photo, which was provided by an acquaintance who had set them up. He laughed, delighted by her cutting sense of humor.

title: The New York Times News Quiz, November 5, 2021
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: Their Love for Fun Inspired a Love for Each Other
description: Douglas Atkins and Charles Huck say their love for each other comes from finding the fun in everything.

title: It Was Like My Pinterest Board Come to Life
description: Only a few months after Ashley Mungiguerra and Zachary Chan began dating, an ocean would force them to live apart.

title: Former House Aides Try Making a Home of Their Own
description: When Julia Tishman gave Adam Elias her business card at a September 2017 networking event that doubled as a mutual friends birthday, she at first was unsure what to make of his follow-up email.

title: An Illustrated History of Bad Art Friends
Vibing on Art and Artists Books
description: Gil Moshe Gentile got it just right in June 2013 when he asked Hannah Marie Mandel to meet him at Jack Goldstein X 10,000, a conceptual art exhibit at the Jewish Museum in Manhattan.

title: Finding Love on the Overnight Shift
description: Averi Harper and Kenneth Robinson, who met on a San Francisco train in September 2015, knew they might be destined for a future together when they realized their schedules had something in common: neither worked on Mondays or Tuesdays.

title: What Happens if the Supreme Court Strikes Down New Yorks Gun Law?
description: New York State has one of the most restrictive gun laws in the country, sharply limiting peoples ability to carry weapons outside their homes.

title: Energy Department Aims to Slash Cost of Removing Carbon From the Air
description: GLASGOW  The U.S. Department of Energy on Friday unveiled its biggest effort yet to drastically reduce the cost of technologies that suck carbon dioxide out of the atmosphere, in a recognition that current strategies to lower greenhouse gases may not be enough to avert the worst effects of climate change.

title: To Build the Metaverse, Meta First Wants to Build Stores
description: SAN FRANCISCO  One of Mark Zuckerbergs first steps toward building the metaverse may be physical instead of virtual.

title: Marian Anderson: A Voice of Authenticity and Justice
description: The night before Marian Andersons 1939 concert on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial, she called Sol Hurok, her manager, to ask if she really had to go through with it.

title: How Frequent Flier Programs Are Changing in a Changed World
description: The pandemic made an oxymoron of the term frequent flier, as the number of airline passengers plummeted in the early days of the lockdown. Leisure travel has recovered somewhat, but the more lucrative business travel market is still way off, with recovery not expected until 2023 and perhaps not even then.

title: How the New York City Marathons Race Director Spends His Sundays
description: This year represents the 50th running anniversary of the New York City Marathon.

title: Dining Sheds Saved N.Y.C. Could They Destroy It?
description: Ellen Koenigsberg has owned a vintage clothing store on Ludlow Street for 20 years, a feat so remarkable it puts you in mind of the runner who maintains a lightning pace well into middle age, past serial injuries. Occupying the ground floor of a small tenement building, the store, Ellen, is about the size of a master bath in a fancy apartment. The vibe is unflashy  Oxfords, silk blouses with bows, dresses with labels from department stores that long predate eBay.

title: Michael Rubins Big Shot
description: Last month, after a three-day stretch in New York, Michael Rubin, was anxious to get back to Philadelphia to attend the home opener of the 76ers, the N.B.A. team of which he is an owner.

title: Kristen Stewarts Princess Diaries
description: Kristen Stewart has sometimes been accused of just playing variations on herself, as if that isnt half the reason were drawn to movie stars. In Twilight (2008), she brought a specific and sullen appeal to a heroine conceived as a blank slate for female readers; later, in Personal Shopper (2017), when Stewart traded her polo shirts for a rich clients shimmering dress, you could see both the star and the character regarding her new look in the mirror: Is this me? Could I make it me?

title: Two Octogenarians Commit to Living Apart Together
description: Harry Mirra made it clear from the start that he didnt want to marry Ginny Valonis. Back then, though, she was too in love to care.

title: Another Landmark Lost, This Time on Astor Row in Harlem
description: Many New Yorkers assume that a historic building, once the city designates it a landmark or includes it in a historic district, is protected from demolition. But that idealized notion of preservation has been smashed in recent weeks, as if by a wrecking ball, from Harlem to the meatpacking district.

title: First Black Woman in Bundestag Wants to Change Image of Germanness
description: BERLIN  The day after a racist extremist opened fire in two hookah bars in Germany, targeting people he thought looked foreign, Awet Tesfaiesus was shocked by the reaction she encountered in her workplace to the attacks that had just killed nine people.

title: Disco Queens for Halloween
description: Glam disco was the theme at the 25th Hulaween party, held on Oct. 30 at Cipriani South Street to benefit the New York Restoration Project, the nonprofit started by Bette Midler to protect green spaces. The American Ballet Theater honored Jenna Segal at its fall gala on Oct. 26; the performance was followed by a dinner. And the Studio Museum in Harlem held a black-tie benefit at the Glass House on Oct. 25 with plenty of dancing.

title: Will World-Class Architecture Bring Civic Pride Back to Memphis?
description: MEMPHIS  The assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in 1968, at the Lorraine Motel in downtown Memphis, drained all the life out of the surrounding urban center. Overnight, people and money fled to the eastern part of the county, far from the Mississippi River that defined the Bluff City.

title: 26.2 at 50
description: The New York City Marathon is one of the worlds largest road races and most democratic. Olympic medalists and world champions run the same 26.2 miles as weekend warriors. There have been 1,283,005 total finishers over 49 runnings, and thousands of photographs captured by scores of photographers for The New York Times.

title: Landmarks Arent Always Forever
description: On a triangular site at Greenwich Avenue, Seventh Avenue and West 12th Street, a grand movie palace was built in 1921, then sold and rebranded as Loews Sheridan Theatre in 1926. Attendance waned by the 1960s and it was demolished by its new owner, St. Vincents Hospital, in the summer of 1969.

title: In India, fears grow that gatherings for Diwali could prompt another virus spike.
description: When a devastating second wave of coronavirus infections hit India in the spring, hospitals were overwhelmed with sick patients and crematories struggled to bury the dead as the bodies piled up.

title: Wages are rising, but can they keep up with inflation?
description: American workers are taking home bigger paychecks as employers pay up to attract and retain employees. But those same people are shelling out more for furniture, food and many other goods and services these days.

title: Job Gains Offer a Brighter Picture of the U.S. Economy
description: The American economy is showing renewed signs of life, with employers hiring workers in greater numbers than they have in months.

title: Young Activists Want Action as Protesters Rally at COP26
description: GLASGOW  Thousands of climate activists from across the world have descended this week on the Scottish city of Glasgow, demanding that nations gathering for a global climate conference produce real, meaningful change.

title: The Artifacts Revealed by Climate Change and the Growing Ranks of American Billionaires: The Week in Narrated Articles
description: This weekend, listen to a collection of narrated articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

title: The Trial of Kyle Rittenhouse
description: This episode contains strong language and scenes of violence.

title: Japan will shorten quarantine for business travelers to 3 days.
description: Japanese officials said on Friday that they would reduce the length of quarantine for vaccinated business travelers from 10 days to three, reflecting the incredible turnaround in the countrys control over the coronavirus.

title: Turning Back the Clock
description: After a busy week of news  elections, Supreme Court arguments, the World Series and, alas, a never-ending pandemic  todays newsletter is going to try something different. My colleagues and I will tell you about six stories that we cant stop thinking about and that you may have missed this week.

title: Pfizer Says Its Antiviral Pill Is Highly Effective in Treating Covid
description: Pfizer announced on Friday that its pill to treat Covid-19 had been found in a key clinical trial to be highly effective at preventing severe illness among at-risk people who received the drug soon after they exhibited symptoms, making it the second antiviral pill to demonstrate efficacy against Covid.

title: What to Know About Eternals
description: Eternals, the latest addition to the Marvel Cinematic Universe, is a two-and-a-half-hour epic that introduces nearly a dozen new characters, hops back and forth through time over thousands of years, and begins with an opening text crawl that reveals a previously unknown origin of the human species. Even the most ardent MCU fan may be perplexed.

title: Breaking Down the Biden Vaccine Mandate
description: The Biden administration yesterday set Jan. 4 as the deadline for large companies to mandate coronavirus vaccinations or start weekly testing for their workers. The rule is expected to cover 84 million workers, roughly 31 million of whom are unvaccinated.

title: Tomb of the Unknowns Welcomes the Public for First Time in 73 Years
description: In 1921, a sergeant walked into a small, dark chapel in Chlons-sur-Marne in eastern France, not far from where French and English troops had pushed back against advancing Germans a few years before.

title: Dont Throw Away That Ancient Pink Toilet. Someone Out There Wants It.
description: Many people might look at a vintage lilac-and-green bathroom and see a space begging to be gutted. But those people are not Emilie Carver, a Cleveland lawyer who hopped on a plane last May and flew to Boston to retrieve 600 tiles from a bathroom that was being renovated.

title: Remaking Diana: Six Faces of a Princess to Stream Online
description: LONDON  Nearly 25 years after her death, Diana, Princess of Wales, remains a fixture in British culture and on screens both sides of the pond.

title: Rights Groups Urge Singapore Not to Execute Man With Mental Disability
description: Human rights groups are urging Singapore to halt an execution next week of a Malaysian man convicted of smuggling heroin into the city-state, arguing that he should be exempt under international law because he has an intellectual disability.

title: The Highest Vaccination Rate in California
description: The pocket of California that has emerged as a leader in Covid-19 vaccinations may come as a surprise.

title: Justice for my daughter: Parents issue a plea on air pollution.
description: GLASGOW  A delegation of mothers from Brazil, Britain, India, Nigeria, Poland and South Africa, including one whose daughter last year became the first person in Britain to have air pollution officially listed as her cause of death, arrived at the COP26 climate summit this week with a message to leaders: End the financing of fossil fuels.

title: Its Sign-Up Time for Federal Health Insurance
description: The annual open enrollment for Affordable Care Act health insurance plans is underway, and consumers not only have more time to sign up, they are also likely to see more plan options and lower premiums for next year.

title: Vienna will start to vaccinate young children without E.U. approval.
description: The city of Vienna will help vaccinate children as young as 5 against Covid, without official approval from the E.U., officials announced on Thursday.

title: The Untold Story of Sushi in America
description: How a controversial religion from Korea quietly built an empire of raw fish.

title: Snail Mail Turns a Bleeding Heart Into a Spectacular Album
description: Lindsey Jordan is far from the first person to have her heart broken, but Valentine, her remarkable second album as Snail Mail, is alive with such crackling and revelatory emotion that for about 32 minutes it allows you to suspend disbelief and imagine  well, what if she is?

title: Here are the charges that the defendants face.
description: The indictment handed up by the grand jury in Glynn County lists nine criminal counts against each of the three defendants in the killing of Ahmaud Arbery. For each count, they are charged individually and as parties concerned in the commission of a crime.

title: Last Night in Soho | Anatomy of a Scene
description: The director Edgar Wright narrates a sequence from his film featuring Anya Taylor-Joy and Thomasin McKenzie.

title: Watch the 1960s Come Alive in Last Night in Soho
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series on Fridays. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

title: The judge rules on several pretrial motions in favor of the prosecution.
description: Judge Timothy R. Walmsley, who is presiding over the Ahmaud Arbery murder trial, ruled on a number of legal motions ahead of opening statements, including allowing into evidence video images from the body camera of a responding police officer who hovered over Mr. Arbery after he was shot.

title: 11 states sue the Biden administration over its vaccination mandate for large companies.
description: The attorneys general in 11 states filed a lawsuit on Friday in an effort to prevent the Biden administration from requiring large companies to mandate coronavirus vaccinations, the latest sign of growing pushback against the federal governments biggest effort yet to enlist private businesses in combating the virus.

title: The Jobs Numbers Take the Stag Out of the Stagflation Scare
description: The story of the American labor market is less murky than it seemed just a few weeks ago. The new jobs numbers Friday present a straightforward, sunny view: Despite it all  the virus variants, the reopening struggles  Americans are going back to work at a rapid clip.

title: A Body Donated to Science Was Dissected for a Paying Audience
description: The blurred video showed a cadaver on a table in a hotel ballroom. A man stood over the body, addressing an audience that had paid to watch the dissection of a corpse. Some people snapped on gloves and hovered, peering and touching.

title: We serve a God who is not asleep: Clergy members urge unity for Ahmaud Arberys family.
description: A group of clergy members gathered outside the Glynn County Superior Court in Brunswick, Ga., on Friday morning, urging the community to remain peaceful and united despite their unhappiness that a nearly all-white jury had been seated in the trial of the white men accused of killing Ahmaud Arbery, a Black man.

title: Crypto Is Cool. Now Get on the Yacht.
description: The masters of the metaverse  thousands of CryptoPunks and Bored Apes, artists and hackers, starry-eyed idealists and profit-hungry speculators  descended on Manhattan this past week, looking for a glimpse of the future.

title: How to Track Runners in the New York City Marathon
description: If youre cheering for runners in the New York City Marathon this weekend, you can track them in real time on the New York City Marathon app, the official race app. All runners will be tracked via a chip in their marathon bibs, and will show up on the apps marathon map as blue icons so you can follow their progress.

title: Labor force participation is static, a conundrum for the Fed.
description: Millions of employees remain on the job markets sidelines and are only slowly trickling back  posing a serious challenge for the Federal Reserve as its policymakers try to assess how far the United States economy remains from their full employment goal.

title: Remains in Colorado Are Believed to Be West German Hiker Missing Since 1983
description: Human remains found in Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado are believed to be those of a hiker who disappeared nearly 40 years ago during a ski trip, officials at the park said on Thursday.

title: Near-Daily Covid Tests, Sleeping in Classrooms: Life in Covid-Zero China
description: The southwestern Chinese city of Ruili is small, remote and largely unknown internationally. It is also, when it comes to the coronavirus, perhaps the most tightly regulated place on earth.

title: Google Temps Fought Loss of Pandemic Bonus. And Won.
description: Ned McNally, a temp worker at Googles data center in Council Bluffs, Iowa, received notice in August that he would get a $200 weekly bonus until the end of the year for working a full week. It was a nod to the labor shortages ravaging businesses during the pandemic.

title: Ex-Macron Aide Convicted of Assault and Posing as a Police Officer
description: PARIS  A former security aide to President Emmanuel Macron of France was found guilty on Friday of assaulting protesters and posing as a police officer at a labor demonstration in 2018, in a case that caused the administrations first major scandal and led to intense criticism of Mr. Macrons governing style.

title: Ronnie Wilson, Founder of the Gap Band, Dies at 73
description: Ronnie Wilson, the founder of the Gap Band, which rode a funky party sound to success on the R&B charts in the late 1970s and throughout the 80s, died on Tuesday. He was 73.

title: When Bad News About the Climate Is Good for Green Stocks
description: Its not yet clear how effective the United Nations conference underway in Glasgow will be in mitigating the most pernicious effects of global warming. But one outcome is already evident: The number of news articles about climate change is surging.

title: Those Loud and Polluting Leaf Blowers
description: To the Editor:

title: Our reporters are breaking down the jobs numbers.
description: The New York Timess economics reporters, including Ben Casselman, Neil Irwin, Jeanna Smialek and Talmon Smith, are pulling out the most interesting and important parts of Fridays jobs report.

title: Post Malone and the Weeknds Emo Synth-Pop, and 12 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Five Action Movies to Stream Now
description: For action fans seeking out new movies on streaming, there are plenty of car chases, explosions and fist fights to sift through. We help by providing some streaming highlights.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. Thanksgiving is coming and maybe that doesnt mean much to you  youll head to your stepmothers as usual, or go out to dinner at a favorite restaurant, or put together the same menu youve been cooking for years, for decades. The holidays rote.

title: Why We Have to Wave the Bloody Shirt of Jan. 6
description: Policy is rational. Politics is not. It takes a story to move voters, an emotional connection that tells them something about themselves and the world in which they live or, alternately, the world in which they would like to live.

title: Wonking Out: Is the Great Resignation a Great Rethink?
description: Life is full of surprises. But there are surprises, and then there are surprises.

title: What Ive Learned From Running Marathons
description: Training for a marathon two years ago, I ran so fast, I couldnt believe the clock. It felt like I was lying.

title: The fatal encounter at the center of the Arbery murder trial was captured on cellphone video.
description: The final minutes of Ahmaud Arberys life were captured in a cellphone video taken by one of three men now accused of killing him last year while he was on a jog in a suburban Brunswick, Ga., neighborhood.

title: I Dont Want to Die for It: School Board Members Face Rising Threats
description: It was only days after Sami Al-Abdrabbuh was re-elected to the school board in Corvallis, Ore., that the text messages arrived.

title: Former U.S.C. Official Pleads Guilty in College Admissions Scandal
description: A former University of Southern California athletic administrator pleaded guilty to being part of a sweeping scheme to get students admitted to prestigious universities as fake athletic recruits, in exchange for bribes.

title: Heres what to watch for in the House on Friday.
description: Democratic leaders in the House, aiming to break through an intraparty stalemate, are trying to hold key votes on President Bidens agenda on Friday.

title: The defense cites a citizens arrest law that has been largely repealed.
description: Robert Rubin, a lawyer for Travis McMichael, became the first defense lawyer for any of the three men accused of murdering Ahmaud Arbery to argue that his client was trying to make a citizens arrest permitted under state law.

title: Tell Us Your Abortion Story
description: Earlier this fall, during a House Oversight Committee hearing on the multipronged threat to American reproductive rights, several members of Congress shared their stories of having had abortions. The testimonies, from Representatives Cori Bush of Missouri, Pramila Jayapal of Washington and Barbara Lee of California, were all deeply moving in their own way. But one moment from that day stood out to me the most. Today I share for the first time publicly a very difficult personal story, hoping that it will help destigmatize accessing abortion care, said Ms. Lee. Im sharing my story even though I truly believe it is personal, and really nobodys business.

title: The Best of Late Night This Week
description: The late-night hosts had plenty to talk about this week, including the U.N. climate summit, President Bidens visit with the pope and Democrats stinging election results.

title: Persistent shortages are stunting German economic growth.
description: Persistent shortages are dragging down the German economy, Europes largest, as companies struggle to fill orders because the necessary parts or raw materials are not arriving from abroad.

title: Kamaru Usman Wants U.F.C. Glory but to Still Live Normally
description: Kamaru Usman, one of the fiercest men on the planet, is content with the level of fame he has achieved in this bloody sport of mixed martial arts.

title: What Do You Want to Know About Kids and Vaccines?
description: The Times is hosting a live audio conversation on Twitter about the coronavirus vaccine and children at 5 p.m. ET on Monday, Nov. 8. To tune in, follow @nytimes and look for a notification at the top of the Twitter app at that time. Click on this link to set up a reminder for the chat. We also plan to share a recording of the conversation.

title: The N.Y.C. Marathon by the Numbers
description: Here's a look at some numbers behind the 50th running of the New York City Marathon.

title: The Fastest Man Ever to Run the New York City Marathon Has Arrived
description: Kenenisa Bekele, arguably the greatest distance runner ever, is not really supposed to be here. In New York. Running another marathon, just six weeks after the last one. Believing he is on the cusp of proving to the world that he is the fastest marathoner alive.

title: Should I Try to Save a Child From Her Adoptive Moms Bad Race Politics?
description: I live in Alabama where it has become quite common for white families to adopt Black children. I feel like many of them believe that this action absolves them of any accusation of racism. Personally (Im Black) I disagree and believe they have an obligation to actively engage in dismantling racist systems and practices on behalf of their child, rather than merely assimilating the child into their families and social circles, which inevitably reflect these same racist systems and inequitable outcomes. The issue is that one mom whom I know through my community activities has pushed for friendships between her children  one of her girls in particular  and my 9-year-old daughter. But from what Ive seen on social media she is a Trump supporter, has anti-immigrant views and has an all lives matter approach to police violence. I would normally not leave my daughter in the care of adults with these values or become mom friends with them. But do I have an obligation to get closer to the family for the childs sake?

title: Get Your Kill Room Ready. Dexter Is Back.
description: Dexter ended in 2013, with its protagonist self-exiled to the frozen North and most major characters dead. But you cant keep a high-functioning psychopath down. Dexter: New Blood, which premieres on Showtime on Nov. 7, finds Michael C. Halls Dexter Morgan working at a fish and game shop under an assumed name. His side hustles include bladesmithing, goat farming and maybe some vengeance.

title: Singing the Praises of R.B.G. Style
description: The legacy of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has inspired all sorts of cultural paeons since her death in September 2020. They have included an exhibition of the Justices mementos at the New-York Historical Society, an upcoming childrens picture book, and an off-Broadway play written by Dianne Nora. But the latest tribute, a new work from the Washington National Opera, may be the most apropos yet.

title: The activist Vanessa Nakate offers an optimistic vision: We wont have to fight for resources.
description: Vanessa Nakate, a 24-year-old Ugandan activist, used her address to a crowd of protesters in Glasgow on Friday to emphasize the immediate impacts of climate change facing her country and continent, and to draw a picture of a fairer future, arguing that the world could emerge from the climate crisis.

title: Three Big Questions Heading Into Free Agency
description: With the completion of the World Series, baseball moved immediately into free agency  sort of. The leagues collective bargaining agreement is set to expire on Dec. 1, and as a result, very little movement is expected as teams and players alike wait to find out how everything is going to shake out. The possibility exists that the league could enact a lockout on Dec. 2, which would halt all activities until a deal is reached.

title: N.Y.C. Rats: Theyre in the Park, on Your Block and Even at Your Table
description: Brittany Brown and her friends were finishing an outdoor dinner in Chelsea recently when, from the corner of her eye, she thought she saw something move near the edge of their table.

title: Greta Thunberg assails world leaders for profiting from this destructive system.
description: Greta Thunberg, the 18-year-old Swedish climate activist whose school strike inspired young people the world over to take action on climate change, criticized world leaders on Friday for allowing the exploitation of people and nature.

title: People Tied to Project Veritas Scrutinized in Theft of Diary From Bidens Daughter
description: The Justice Department searched two locations associated with the conservative group Project Veritas as part of an investigation into how a diary stolen from President Bidens daughter, Ashley, came to be publicly disclosed a week and a half before the 2020 presidential election, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: This Eagle Is Very, Very Lost
description: Geographically speaking, it would be almost impossible for this bird to get any more lost.

title: Saucy and Cheesy
description: Grab a blanket: We are careening toward the end of daylight saving time, which means its time to get cozy, people, at least those of you who live places where the weather gets cold. Im talking soups, casseroles, braises and everything roasted. The farro and cauliflower Parmesan below is a good place to start.

title: Review: Michael Tilson Thomas, a Podium Hero, Returns
description: In early August, the conductor Michael Tilson Thomas announced that, following surgery to remove a brain tumor, he was withdrawing from his upcoming performances to receive treatment. I look forward, he said, to seeing everyone again in November.

title: Hunter Biden: Emotionally Honest, Generically Smooth
description: Hunter Biden is an emerging artist from Wilmington, Del. He is now, like no shortage of emerging artists, based in Los Angeles, but unlike them he is making his debut in New York at ample scale, with a solo exhibition at the Georges Bergs Gallery in SoHo. The show is titled The Journey Home, and it is not small: more than two dozen paintings, works on paper and overpainted photographs, installed across two floors, melodramatically spotlit. Circumstances require that the show is currently open only by appointment. When I saw it this past weekend, I was greeted by a security guard charged to protect the staff from death threats.

title: At Hunter Bidens Art Show, Line, Color and Questions
description: Weeks before Hunter Bidens art show  The Journey Home  opened at a New York gallery, marking the splashy debut of a newcomer with a famous name to the commercial art world, the White House insisted it had safeguards to ensure that no one who buys a painting will be able to use the acquisition to influence his fathers administration.

title: Congress Is Investigating McKinsey Over Its Role in the Opioid Crisis
description: In a new assault on the global consulting giant McKinsey & Company, Congress on Friday started an investigation into the firms role in the opioid crisis, sending a letter demanding records related to its business practices, conflicts of interest and management standards.

title: Smithsonian Moves Toward Returning Benin Bronzes
description: The head of the Smithsonian Institutions National Museum of African Art said Friday that museum officials have removed its Benin Bronzes from display and plan to begin the process of potentially repatriating the priceless West African artifacts that were looted by the British Army more than a century ago.

title: Huma Abedin Talks About Both/And
description: In her new memoir, Both/And: A Life in Many Worlds, Huma Abedin writes about her Muslim faith, her years working alongside Hillary Clinton and, of course, her relationship with her estranged husband, the former Democratic Representative Anthony Weiner. On this weeks podcast, Abedin says that writing the book was the most therapeutic thing I could have possibly done, and that writing about her marriage and its time in the tabloids gave her perspective.

title: In her opening statement, the lead prosecutor says Ahmaud Arbery was under attack.
description: The lead prosecutor in the trial of the three white men accused of murdering Ahmaud Arbery said in her opening statement on Friday that Mr. Arbery was plainly under attack by the defendants when they chased him in trucks through their neighborhood  a chase that ended with one of the defendants, Travis McMichael, fatally shooting Mr. Arbery with his pump-action shotgun.

title: John Kerry lauds progress at the climate summit but warns, Job not done.
description: As the United Nations climate summit neared its halfway mark, the Biden administration on Friday tried to strike a balance between lauding the new promises that countries have made this week to curb emissions and warning that they still need to do far more to avert the worst impacts of global warming.

title: As Turkey Chafes at Erdogan, He Gets Spikier Abroad
description: ISTANBUL  The global climate summit in Glasgow was supposed to be a big moment for President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey. He was expected to use the chance to show off a new embrace of climate issues, and there are few things he likes more than mingling on the international stage beside other world leaders.

title: University of Florida Reverses Course to Allow Professors to Testify Against State
description: Acceding to a storm of protest, the University of Florida abandoned efforts on Friday to keep three political science professors from testifying in a voting-rights lawsuit against the administration of Gov. Ron DeSantis.

title: When the Solution Is the Problem
description: Not once, in two decades, had David Beckham heard the moment. He had witnessed it at the time, of course. More than that, in fact: He had summoned it and created it and lived it. He had, presumably, watched the moment more than once in the intervening years, too. But it was not until a couple weeks ago that he sat down and listened to it.

title: Zazie Beetz and Regina King on Their Big Battle in The Harder They Fall
description: Trudys mine, hisses Stagecoach Mary Fields (played by Zazie Beetz), her eyes blazing.

title: At Colin Powells Funeral, Washington Unites to Pay Tribute
description: The funeral for Colin L. Powell, former secretary of state, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and national security adviser, brought out a Washington that barely exists anymore: Republicans and Democrats, including President Biden and two of his predecessors, uniformed military and diplomats, and people on all sides of the Iraq war.

title: Canelo lvarez Hopes to Unify the Belts at 168 Pounds
description: LAS VEGAS  Sal lvarez and Caleb Plant punctuated their late-September news conference in Beverly Hills the way prizefighters often do  by squaring off for a stare-down, nose to nose, each promising to beat the other down when they finally met for the undisputed super-middleweight title. That bout is scheduled for Saturday night at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas.

title: In a World That Exploits Women, Emily Ratajkowski Exploits Herself. Is That Progress?
description: The figure of the modeling agent must be up there with the personal injury lawyer and the tobacco lobbyist as far as stock villain professions go. Has an honorable and kindly modeling agent ever been committed to print, film, television or stage? Are those very words doomed to suggest a leering cartoon rubbing his hands together and making ah-ooga noises as an underpaid model toils to funnel money into his cartoon bank account?

title: Love Letter: A Missed Connection at Whole Foods
description: You never know if a stroll down the produce aisle could lead to a love connection.

title: What to Expect at Work When Youre Expecting
description: Send questions about the office, money, careers and work-life balance to workfriend@nytimes.com. Include your name and location, or a request to remain anonymous. Letters may be edited.

title: The Weekender
description: The grandeur of Soviet-era metros. Also in this edition: Benedict Cumberbatch as an alpha-male cowboy, and the devoted users of Neopets.

title: Julie Green, Artist Who Memorialized Inmates Last Suppers, Dies at 60
description: Six tacos, six glazed doughnuts and a Cherry Coke: That was the last meal of a man executed in Oklahoma in July 1999. Rendered in cobalt blue glaze on a white china plate the next year, it was the first in Julie Greens decades-long art project, The Last Supper, which documented the final meals of death row prisoners around the country.

title: Eric Adams Has a New Job. Many of His Constituents Dont.
description: Eric Adams, New York Citys mayor-elect, will have a lot to do when he takes office on Jan. 1, but no task will be more important than helping New Yorkers of modest means get back to work.

title: Kyrsten Sinema and the Politics of a Sleeveless Silhouette
description: Last week, I argued that it was useful to think about the clothes Kyrsten Sinema wears, because her presentation is part of her political power. I also invited readers to think along with me. Many of you wrote me to say that the very idea of talking about what a woman is wearing gives you, for lack of a better term, the heebie-jeebies. Some of you worry that this line of inquiry devalues Sinemas credentials and office; others worry that talking about presentation is tacitly sexist because it opens the door to critiquing women for something that their male counterparts can take for granted.

title: Cuomo Sex-Crime Charge May Be Defective, D.A. Says
description: The sex-crime case against former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo was thrown into doubt on Friday after the Albany County, N.Y., district attorney delivered an extraordinary public denunciation of the local sheriff, saying the criminal complaint the sheriff filed last week was potentially defective.

title: Defense lawyers portray the fatal shooting of Ahmaud Arbery as self-defense.
description: In an opening statement on Friday, the lawyer for Travis McMichael, the man who shot and killed Ahmaud Arbery, painted his client as a man who felt a duty to protect his neighborhood, and who had reason to believe that Mr. Arbery had committed a burglary  giving him the right, under Georgia law, to carry out a citizens arrest.

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Welcome. Its that time again, the end of daylight saving. Set your clocks back before you go to sleep on Saturday. Where I live, itll be darker earlier for the next several months. The beginning of the frigid season: seven weeks until Christmas, four-and-a-half months until spring. Get comfortable. Get cozy.

title: U.N. Rights Panel Pressures Sudan Over Coup
description: GENEVA  The United Nations top human rights body decided on Friday to appoint an independent expert to monitor and report on abuses in Sudan since the military takeover less than two weeks ago, escalating international pressure on leaders of Africas third-largest country to restore civilian rule.

title: Heres why jury selection took so long.
description: Jury selection in the trial of the three men accused of killing Ahmaud Arbery took two and a half weeks, an extraordinarily long process made difficult by the high-profile nature of the case.

title: I Love Fashion, but It Hurts My Skin.
description: People with disabilities of every kind have long been fashions biggest blind spot  and, as far as I am concerned, missed opportunity. Though the industry has been getting notably better about acknowledging and trying to address many of its own failings, including a history of racism, sizeism and ageism, it still falls short when it comes to disabilities. Even if last season there were a few models in wheelchairs on select runways.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: On Monday the U.S. will lift a ban on international tourists, allowing them to enter the country for the first time in a year and a half. Proof of vaccination and a negative Covid test required.

title: Aaron Rodgers Lashes Out About N.F.L.s Vaccine Requirements
description: Aaron Rodgers on Friday spoke publicly for the first time since news broke that he was not vaccinated against the coronavirus and had tested positive, lashing out at the news media and saying he was a victim of a woke mob and cancel culture.

title: There was blood all over: A police officer describes the scene of Ahmaud Arberys death.
description: When William Duggan, a Glynn County police officer, arrived on the scene of Ahmaud Arberys shooting, what he observed was gruesome.

title: William Conway, Who Reimagined Americas Zoos, Is Dead at 91
description: William G. Conway, an animal conservationist who redefined (but failed to rename) the Bronx Zoo, and who helped recast Americas urban wildlife parks into crowd-pleasing natural habitats designed to generate support for endangered species worldwide, died on Oct. 21 in New Rochelle, N.Y. He was 91.

title: In Fate of Oil Field, Climate Activists and Energy Executives See Future
description: LONDON  A once-unremarkable patch of ocean floor in deep waters northwest of Scotlands Shetland Islands has become a crucial test case for the British government, environmental groups and the oil industry.

title: Tucked Inside a Gilded Age Landmark  a Tropical Bar?
description: How do you follow up a trick like Gage & Tollner? At that Brooklyn chophouse, three partners brought a famous-but-closed restaurant out of dormancy and then pulled it through a yearlong Covid delay to become one of the critical and popular dining successes of 2021.

title: Boeing directors reach a settlement in a shareholder lawsuit over the 737 Max crashes.
description: A group of current and former Boeing directors has agreed to settle a shareholder lawsuit over a pair of fatal crashes that led to the global grounding of the companys 737 Max jetliner for nearly two years.

title: How Hospitals Fuel Climate Change
description: The health care industry is a large source of greenhouse gases.

title: Manitoba Names a New Premier, but a Rival Asks a Court to Quash the Action
description: Manitoba seems to have a surplus of premiers at the moment. On Tuesday, Heather Stefanson was sworn in as the provinces 24th premier.

title: Eight Groups Join Tigray Rebels Vowing to Oust Ethiopias Leader
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  For a year now, fighters from Ethiopias northern region of Tigray have faced off against Ethiopias army largely alone, repulsing their attacks, capturing towns and, this week, advancing on the capital, Addis Ababa.

title: Infrastructure, Cuomo, N.Y.C. Marathon: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Aaron Feuerstein, Mill Owner Who Refused to Leave, Dies at 95
description: Aaron Feuerstein, a Massachusetts industrialist who became a national hero in 1995 when he refused to lay off workers at his textile plant after a catastrophic fire, then spent hundreds of millions of dollars to rebuild it, died on Thursday at a hospital in Boston. He was 95.

title: JoAnna Cameron, an Early Female Superhero on TV, Is Dead at 73
description: JoAnna Cameron, who in the 1970s portrayed Isis, the first female character on television with superpowers, and appeared in more national network television commercials than anyone else, died on Oct. 15 in Oahu, Hawaii. She was 73.

title: Ed Mullins, Ex-Police Union Chief, Retires as Discipline Is Announced
description: The combative former president of a powerful New York City police union retired on Friday, the same day officials announced that he had been found guilty of two disciplinary charges and fined about $32,000 for violating rules governing the use of social media.

title: Trapped in a Pandemic Funk: Millions of Americans Cant Shake a Gloomy Outlook
description: A year ago, Michael Macey, a barber who lives in the suburbs outside Atlanta, was thrilled to help propel President Biden to victory, hopeful that Democrats would move swiftly to tackle policing laws and other big issues. But then he watched his hopes for sweeping changes wither in Washington.

title: State Dept. Report on Missing Gifts Finds Poor Oversight
description: The State Departments inspector general has found in a new report that tens of thousands of dollars in gifts purchased with government funds during the Trump administration to give to foreign leaders and others given to senior officials are unaccounted for.

title: Some Sept. 11 Trial Secrets May Not Be Secrets Anymore
description: GUANTNAMO BAY, Cuba  Prosecutors volunteered on Friday to review hundreds, perhaps thousands, of pages of classified C.I.A. documents in the Sept. 11 case to determine if some material provided to defense lawyers was too heavily redacted.

title: In Trial Opening, Two Starkly Different Views of Ahmaud Arberys Death
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga.  The trial of the three white men accused of murdering Ahmaud Arbery opened on Friday with the prosecution arguing that Mr. Arbery, a 25-year-old Black man, had come under attack, while defense attorneys said that their clients were justified in suspecting Mr. Arbery of burglary, chasing him in their trucks and trying to detain him until the police arrived.

title: Marlia Mendona, Brazilian Pop Singer, Dies in Plane Crash at 26
description: Marlia Mendona, a popular Brazilian pop singer who was known as the queen of suffering for her soulful, angst-filled ballads, was killed on Friday in a small plane crash in the southeastern state of Minas Gerais in Brazil. She was 26.

title: 2,000 Pages and Pronto! Budget Scorekeepers Are Under Pressure
description: When Democratic House moderates raised their latest objection to voting on the partys social spending and climate bill on Friday, they said they first needed a score from the Congressional Budget Office.

title: House Passes $1 Trillion Infrastructure Bill, Putting Social Policy Bill on Hold
description: [Follow our live coverage of President Biden signing the infrastructure bill.]

title: Keeping Hope Alive in Glasgow
description: Hello from Glasgow. Were dedicating this newsletter to COP26, the United Nations conference happening here this week and next, which we covered on the show on Wednesday.

title: Trump Justice Dept. Official Defies Request by Jan. 6 Panel
description: WASHINGTON  Jeffrey Clark, a former Justice Department official involved in former President Donald J. Trumps frenzied efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election, refused to cooperate on Friday with the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack, leading to a sharp rebuke from the committees chairman.

title: Much Obliged!
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  This is one of those Saturday grids that I like to kvell over with everyone. Its the first Times collaboration between two constructors, Brooke Husic and Will Nediger, both of whom just get better and better. The majority of entries lit a spark in me, be it of recognition or discovery, or the one when you get the joke after what feels like eons. So satisfying, and its good to know from their notes that there are more co-constructions out in the puzzleverse.

title: Quotation of the Day: Unmoved by Climate Promises, Activists Hit Glasgows Streets
description: We cant play politics with this kind of issue. Climate change  it surpasses every other issue we have.

title: Corrections: Nov. 6, 2021
description: An article on Friday about an increase in rates on some government savings bonds misstated the URL for the website Treasury Direct. It is TreasuryDirect.gov, not TreasuryDirect.com.

title: How Every House Member Voted on the Infrastructure Bill
description: The $1 trillion package passed with the support of nearly all Democrats and 13 Republicans.

title: Officer Michael Seaverss Statement

description: SATURDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Eric Garners Mother Wanted Answers for His Death. She Isnt Satisfied.
description: The death of Eric Garner has reverberated with unanswered questions and fresh developments over the seven years since a New York police officer placed him in a banned chokehold.

title: Democrats Choosing Less Risky Path on Drug Prices
description: In early budget negotiations, it looked as if the Democrats were finally going to take on Big Pharma over spiraling drug prices. Then last week, drug pricing fell out of the bill altogether and it looked as if the drug companies had won again. Now there is a compromise that looks modest but could have real bite.

title: Young Women Are Leading Climate Protests. Guess Who Runs Global Talks?
description: GLASGOW  The week began with more than 130 presidents and prime ministers posing for a group photo in a century-old Baroque museum crafted from red sandstone. Fewer than 10 were women. Their median age, as their host at the climate summit, British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, reminded them, was over 60.

title: Behind the Scenes: Police Traffic Stops
description: I drove to Alabama and met one of my colleagues, Donovan Thomas. Heres what happened.

title: Padgett Powell Goes Snake Chasing
description: INDIGO Arm Wrestling, Snake Saving, and Some Things in Between By Padgett Powell

title: McCartney, With and Without Lennon
description: THE LYRICS 1956 to the Present By Paul McCartney Edited and with an introduction by Paul Muldoon

title: Is It Just Us or Does Everyone Have a Cold Right Now?
description: A nasty cold hit New York City and much of the country this summer.

title: PinkPantheress Has 1 Million Fans on TikTok
description: Name: PinkPantheress

title: Are You Anxious, Avoidant or Secure?
description: Most articles dont, for good reason, start with My therapist said.

title: An 8-Year-Old Explains the Metaverse
description: Like a lot of people, I have been scrambling to get a grasp of the metaverse since Mark Zuckerberg made his move to colonize it by rebranding Facebook as Meta last week.

title: Star System With Right-Angled Planets Surprises Astronomers
description: Star systems come in all shapes and sizes. Some have lots of planets, some have larger planets and others have no planets at all. But a particularly unusual system about 150 light-years from our own has scientists scratching their heads.

title: Can Progress on Diversity Be Union-Made?
description: Staring at the wall of glass clawing its way up the unfinished facade of the Winthrop Center in downtown Boston  53 floors of commercial and residential space soaring 690 feet  Travis Watson isnt interested in the grandeur of the thing. He wants to know whos working on it.

title: In a Region in Strife, Indias Moral High Ground Erodes
description: NEW DELHI  The mob rampaged for days, burning homes, breaking into temples and clashing with police, leaving several dead.

title: How Police Justify Killing Drivers: The Vehicle Was a Weapon
description: PHENIX CITY, Ala.  On a Sunday in May 2017, a patrol car sat outside the citys oldest public housing project, waiting for anyone acting suspiciously. The two police officers heard Cedric Mifflin before they saw him, blasting music from a silver Mercury Grand Marquis. Then they tried to pull him over: He wasnt wearing a seatbelt.

title: This Is Where the States Want Billions in Infrastructure Funding Spent
description: [Follow our live coverage of President Biden signing the infrastructure bill.]

title: If You Sell Oaxaca in a Bottle, What Happens to Oaxaca?
description: Nobody dare order a margarita with any of these, or I will be really upset.

title: On Spains Camino de Santiago, Even scar the Donkey Is a Pilgrim
description: SANTIAGO DE COMPOSTELA, Spain  Of all those journeying along the Camino de Santiago, a fabled route that attracts thousands of pilgrims each year, few are quite like scar.

title: A Turtle, a Pool and the Fight to Save Puerto Ricos Beaches
description: RINCN, P.R.  The turtle, presumably, had no way of knowing it would become a symbol of protest when it got stuck for hours in a construction site on a beach in western Puerto Rico, unable to return to the sea.

title: Activists hope protests will draw large crowds as leaders haggle in Glasgow.
description: Protest organizers hoped to draw large crowds to the streets of Glasgow on Saturday to demand urgent action against a climate crisis that is already flooding cities, wiping towns off the map, destroying forests, and fueling storms, heat waves and droughts around the world.

title: How Slowing Down Helped Marathoner Molly Seidel Speed Up
description: Molly Seidel and Jon Green hashed out their grand plan over several cups of coffee.

title: An Environmental Hero or Outlaw? Can It Be Both?
description: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offers a better understanding of an important issue in the news. If you dont already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

title: For Carli Lloyd, Creative Tributes Abound as Retirement Approaches
description: DELRAN, N.J.  Chants of Car-li Loyd! Car-li Loyd! Car-li Loyd! filled Delran Community Park on Oct. 14, led primarily by the children from Delran F.C., a South Jersey youth soccer club that was Carli Lloyds first team.

title: Tanker Truck Explodes in Sierra Leone, Killing at Least 98
description: At least 98 people were killed when a tanker truck exploded on Friday night after a crash in the capital of Sierra Leone.

title: After a Rough Year, New York Road Runners Searches for a Leader and Mission
description: Not very long ago, there was a pretty strong case to be made that New York Road Runners, the organization that owns and stages the New York City Marathon, was the de facto leader of running in the United States.

title: Lights Out: 5 New Dark-Sky Places for Top-Shelf Stargazing
description: Vast expanses of glittering stars. Pristine views of the night sky. And no glare to muddy the Milky Way.

title: Spanish Police Seek Missing Plane Passengers After Emergency Landing
description: MADRID  The Spanish police were searching on Saturday for a dozen passengers on a flight from Morocco to Turkey who fled into the Spanish island of Mallorca after their plane made an emergency landing at the airport there.

title: Infrastructure Bill Makes First Major U.S. Investment in Climate Resilience
description: WASHINGTON  The $1 trillion infrastructure bill now headed to President Bidens desk includes the largest amount of money ever spent by the United States to prepare the nation to withstand the devastating impacts of climate change.

title: Berkshire Hathaways Profit Fell in the Third Quarter
description: Berkshire Hathaway, the conglomerate run by the billionaire investor Warren E. Buffett, on Saturday reported a sharp decrease in earnings in the third quarter, reflecting the turbulent financial markets as well as a slowdown in the U.S. economic recovery with a spike in Covid-19 cases. Profits fell by two-thirds to $10 billion, down from $30 billion in the same three months of 2020, when the economy was still in the process of reopening from pandemic shutdowns.

title: How Do I Get My Landlord to Compensate Me?
description: Q: For the past 15 years, I have lived in a rent-stabilized apartment in Manhattan. In early July, my oven broke and I texted the super. A few weeks later, after nothing was fixed, I contacted the managing agent requesting the repair and a rent reduction. It wasnt until October that a functional oven was finally delivered, and I paid my rent with a note explaining that I was deducting $200 to cover the cost of a toaster oven, which I bought as a temporary solution. I got back a certified letter asking me to pay the $200, plus $155 in legal fees. Can I fight this?

title: A fire in Covid intensive care ward kills 11 people in India.
description: NEW DELHI  Eleven people died after a fire broke out in a coronavirus intensive care unit in the western state of Maharashtra, the latest in a series of fatal disasters in Covid-19 wards in India.

title: Costa Rica moves to require Covid shots for children.
description: Costa Rican officials said on Friday that they would require Covid-19 vaccinations for people under 18 to safeguard the best interests of children, becoming one of the first countries to implement such a mandate.

title: Facing a spike in infections, Austria sharpens the rules of its Covid pass.
description: Austria is tightening the rules of a national vaccine pass program starting Monday as it attempts to stem a coronavirus surge that has brought cases to levels unseen in almost a year.

title: High Schoolers Barred From Hockey Games After Crudely Taunting a Goalie
description: The entire student body of a Pennsylvania junior-senior high school has been barred from attending classmates hockey games after some students chanted sexually explicit vulgarities at a visiting teams goalie  the teams only female player.

title: Wokeness Derails the Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  In Shakespeare, when characters want to fulfill their desires, they escape to whats been called the Green World.

title: COP26 Protesters Back an Array of Causes, Connected by Climate Change
description: GLASGOW  Defying biting wind and steady rain, tens of thousands of protesters took to the streets of Glasgow on Saturday in noisy and colorful protests, calling on global leaders to take action drastic enough to match the scale of a climate crisis already wreaking havoc on parts of the globe.

title: Body Shaming Dressed Up as a Fitness Goal Is Still Body Shaming
description: The University of Oregon is known for its track and field program. The womens team has won two national titles since Robert Johnson took the helm of the program in 2012, and the universitys athletic programs enjoy significant financial support from Nike (whose co-founder Phil Knight is an alumnus). Hayward Field, the home of the Oregon Ducks track, hosted the Olympic Trials in 2021 and will be the location of the World Athletics Championships in 2022.

title: This Is What Africa Needs Right Now
description: How do you tell people that they must leave their community or drown? This was the gut-wrenching decision I faced five years ago, as president of Liberia, when thousands of families in the largest township of the capital, Monrovia, saw their homes swept out to sea.

title: Big Kid Vaccines Are Here!
description: When I woke up Wednesday morning, my mom text threads were already on fire with the news that CVS and Walgreens had opened up Covid vaccine appointments for kids 5 and up. I felt a profound sense of relief as I nabbed slots for my 5- and 8-year-olds, and I wasnt the only one. J. David Goodman, the New York Times Houston bureau chief, was on hand at Texas Childrens Hospital to see some of the first shots doled out to elementary schoolers in the United States. This is the best day ever! one child said.

title: At Least 8 People Killed at Astroworld Music Festival
description: Several people died and dozens of others were injured at a Travis Scott concert in Houston, after a large crowd began pushing toward the front of the stage. Video showed crowds amassing earlier in the day, as about 50,000 people attended the festival.

title: The Way We Work Now (or Dont)
description: To the Editor:

title: Foreman Says Military Jury Was Disgusted by C.I.A. Torture
description: GUANTNAMO BAY, Cuba  A Navy captain who as head of a jury in a war-crimes court wrote a damning letter calling the C.I.A.s torture of a terrorist a stain on the moral fiber of America said his views are typical of senior members of the U.S. military.

title: Americans Are Flush With Cash and Jobs. They Also Think the Economy Is Awful.
description: Americans are, by many measures, in a better financial position than they have been in many years. They also believe the economy is in terrible shape.

title: Georgia Grand Jury Looms in Trump Inquiry
description: As the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol riot fights to extract testimony and documents from Donald J. Trumps White House, an Atlanta district attorney is moving toward convening a special grand jury in her criminal investigation of election interference by the former president and his allies, according to a person with direct knowledge of the deliberations.

title: F.B.I. Searches James OKeefes Home in Ashley Biden Diary Theft Inquiry
description: Federal authorities on Saturday searched the home of James OKeefe, the founder of the conservative group Project Veritas, according to witnesses and people briefed on the matter, a day after Mr. OKeefe acknowledged that the group was under investigation by the Justice Department in connection with a diary reported to have been stolen from Ashley Biden, President Bidens daughter.

description: [Follow our live coverage of President Biden signing the infrastructure bill.]

title: Democrats Thought They Bottomed Out in Rural, White America. It Wasnt the Bottom.
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va.  The increasingly liberal politics of Virginia had been a sore spot for residents of this conservative town of 499 people nestled in the Allegheny Mountains. But this past week, as Republicans stormed to marquee victories powered in part by turnout in rural areas like Bath County, local voters cheered.

title: On the Scene: Climate Protests
description: The protests related to COP26, the United Nations climate summit, peaked on Friday and Saturday, drawing tens of thousands of people to Glasgows streets.

title: A Daily Cloud of Suffering: A Crackdown in China Is Felt Abroad
description: Mustafa Aksu was already sinking into depression when he learned of the successive deaths of his brother, uncle and two cousins back home.

title: Protesters in Glasgow Demand Climate Action
description: Protesters took to the streets of Glasgow near the COP26 conference to urge world leaders to take immediate action to combat the climate crisis. More than 100,000 marched in the city, organizers said.

title: Biden Celebrates Infrastructure Win, Even if Harder Victory Is Ahead
description: President Biden celebrated the passage of the $1 trillion infrastructure bill on Saturday, declaring  just days after an electoral drubbing for his party  that he had made good on two key promises of his campaign: reviving the economy and getting the nation vaccinated.

title: How I Became Extremely Open-Minded
description: When you have a chronic illness and struggle to get better, you try to maintain a certain equilibrium by distinguishing yourself from all those other sick people, the ones who are trying truly crazy things while you are proceeding sensibly and moderately along the path to health.

title: A court temporarily blocks Bidens vaccine mandate.

title: No Way Out: A Sudden Life-and-Death Struggle at a Houston Concert
description: HOUSTON  Panic and then desperation spread through the crowd of 50,000 mostly young people just as the popular hometown rapper they had come to see, Travis Scott, took the stage Friday night. It came like a wave, an unstoppable movement of bodies that could not be held back.

title: Tanker Truck Explosion Kills at Least 98 People in Sierra Leone
description: Many of the victims were motorcyclists and taxi drivers who were trying to collect fuel leaking from the truck at the time of the explosion, according to an official. The truck started leaking after colliding with another vehicle.

description: Finally! After months of excruciating negotiations, President Biden gets to take a victory lap in celebration of his own Big Freaking Deal.

title: Fears of Wider Instability in Iraq After Attack on Prime Ministers Home
description: Iraqs prime minister survived a drone strike on his home early Sunday, Iraqi officials said, raising fears of wider instability after disputed results in Iraqs parliamentary elections.

title: Justin Gaethje won a wild decision that was a surprise for even getting to the judges.
description: The tangible excitement before, during and after the fight lived up to the product inside the cage. Justin Gaethje defeated Michael Chandler via unanimous decision in a lightweight bout to start the main card of U.F.C. 268, essentially earning a title shot for his next fight.

title: Pedigree wins out as Rey Vargas overcomes Leonardo Baezs diligence.
description: The featherweights Rey Vargas and Leonardo Baez paced around the ring during prefight introductions decked out in identical Mexican flag serapes. For social media-savvy fight fans, the scene brought to mind the Spiderman-pointing-at-Spiderman meme.

description: Its not sustainable for our party to continue to tank in small-town America. Weve got a branding problem as Democrats in way too many parts of our country.

title: Corrections: Nov. 7, 2021
description: Because of an editing error, an article last Sunday about the effect of supply-chain issues on the availability of Halloween costumes referred incorrectly to the history of the Salem witch trials. People suspected of witchcraft there were typically hanged, not burned or drowned.

title: Rose Namajunas keeps the 115-pound championship with a split decision over Zhang Weili.
description: Rose Namajunas defended her strawweight championship against Zhang Weili via split decision in a competitive fight, a rematch of their last fight that ended in a knockout.

title: Canelo lvarez delivered on his promise for a knockout victory.
description: LAS VEGAS  In the moments after Sal lvarezs 11th-round knockout win over Caleb Plant, the sellout crowd at the MGM Grand Garden Arena rejoiced. The vast majority of the 16,586 spectators supported lvarez, now the undisputed boxing world champion at 168 pounds.

title: Kamaru Usman is still the 170-pound U.F.C. champion.
description: Kamaru Usman defended his welterweight championship, defeating his rival Colby Covington by unanimous decision.

title: Saturday Night Live Introduces a New Donald Trump
description: The last time Cecily Strong played the Fox News host Jeanine Pirro on Saturday Night Live, it seemed like she might be saying goodbye to her longtime TV home. (She did, after all, end the segment by singing My Way and dousing herself in a giant box of wine.)
