title: N.J. Senate President Blames Red Wave as He Concedes to Republican Underdog
description: Stephen M. Sweeney, the second most powerful lawmaker in New Jersey, admitted defeat on Wednesday, eight days after voters elected a Republican truck driver who ran on a shoestring budget in one of the biggest political upsets in state history.

title: China and U.S., at Odds on Many Issues, Agree on a Surprise Climate Deal
description: GLASGOW  Chinas top climate change envoy, Xie Zhenhua, apologized as he entered late for a weekend meeting at the United Nations climate summit.

title: Elon Musk sells $5 billion in Tesla shares, partly to cover taxes on stock options.
description: Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, disclosed on Wednesday that he had sold about $5 billion worth of Tesla shares, in part to cover his tax obligations after exercising options on a large tranche of stock.

title: Unlike Before, Poland Gets Support From Europe on Tough Borders
description: Follow our live coverage of the migrant crisis at the Belarus-Poland border.

title: Biden Got His Infrastructure Bill. Now He Has to Sell It to Voters.
description: Joe Biden is selling. But is anyone buying?

title: Andrew Cuomo Under Oath: Proud, Prickly and Often Unable to Recall
description: He offered denials in flurries. He protested, quibbled, digressed or simply could not recall. He taunted his interrogators and reacted furiously to their questions.

title: It Came Off Creepy: 6 Key Moments from the Cuomo Transcripts
description: Transcripts released on Wednesday by the office of the New York State attorney general detail interviews with then-Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and 10 people who accused him of sexual harassment.

title: Home virus tests recalled over false positives reach 2 million kits.
description: The Australian company Ellume has expanded a recall of its at-home coronavirus test because of concerns about a higher-than-acceptable rate of false positives, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Tuesday.

title: The N.I.H. says it isnt giving up in its patent fight with Moderna.
description: The National Institutes of Health is prepared to aggressively defend its assertion that its scientists helped invent a crucial component of the Moderna coronavirus vaccine  including taking legal action if government lawyers deem it necessary, the agencys director said on Wednesday.

title: A laggy parachute on Monday led to questions for NASA.
description: Another crew of four astronauts, Crew-2, splashed down safely in the Gulf of Mexico inside a different Crew Dragon capsule on Monday. A set of four large parachutes were released about four minutes before they landed. Those chutes are designed to fully unfurl almost instantly once the capsule comes within a mile from landing. But one took roughly a minute to inflate, heaping most of the burden of slowing the capsule on the other three chutes.

title: Deck the Halls With Infrastructure
description: OK, people, holiday season is upon us. Lots of socializing to do. Youve got to come up with some current events conversations. So all thoughts turn to  the infrastructure bill!

title: I Defended Myself, Kyle Rittenhouse Tells Jurors in His Homicide Trial
description: KENOSHA, Wis.  Kyle Rittenhouse sobbed and gulped for air on the witness stand as he was asked to describe the moments before he shot three men in the aftermath of demonstrations in Kenosha, Wis. One of them had aggressively chased him into a parking lot, Mr. Rittenhouse testified. The man had lunged at him, he said.

title: Review: Whats Past Is Prologue in While You Were Partying
description: You wonder whats real and whats made up, whats meant to be funny and whats meant to be tragic during While You Were Partying, especially during a scene involving an accident. A character named Brian whips himself into a frenzy, goaded by his mother, and something unexpected happens. Or looks like it does.

title: More than 600 human beings have now been to space.
description: Three rookie astronauts aboard SpaceXs Crew-3 mission for NASA just launched to space for the first time. Theyve tipped the number of people to have gone to space to over 600, according to a tally maintained by NASA.

title: A judge says Texas ban on mask mandates violates the rights of students with disabilities.
description: A federal judge ruled on Wednesday that Gov. Greg Abbotts ban on mask mandates in Texas schools violates the rights of students with disabilities, clearing the path for districts in the state to issue their own rules for face coverings, a decision that could affect more than five million students.

title: California Businessman Is Sentenced to 30 Years in $1 Billion Ponzi Scheme
description: An owner of a California solar company was sentenced this week to 30 years in prison for orchestrating a $1 billion Ponzi scheme and using the money to make extravagant purchases, including luxury estates, more than 100 cars and a minor league baseball team, federal prosecutors said.

title: The War on Wokeness
description: Language is extremely powerful.

title: Review: Trevor Is a Musical That Dare Not Speak Its Theme
description: There is no lack of cheese, God knows, in musicals. Worthiness is also plentiful  and sometimes more off-putting.

title: Provider of Directions
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Until GPS systems were installed on smartphones, I used the old gray matter to figure out how to get around, aided by the occasional paper map. It served me well; every trip was an adventure and an opportunity to cut new neural pathways.

title: Corrections: Nov. 11, 2021
description: Because of an editing error, an article on Wednesday about Pfizers request to the Food and Drug Administration to authorize its coronavirus vaccination booster shots for those 18 and older misstated the month that the Israeli vaccination campaign began. It was December 2020, not July 2021.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: With thousands of people camped in the cold at the Poland-Belarus border, Western officials have accused Aleksandr Lukashenko, Belaruss repressive ruler, of using asylum seekers as human weapons and trying to manufacture a migrant crisis in Europe in retaliation for sanctions against his country, creating a new flash point in East-West relations.

title: N.F.L. Week 10 Predictions: Our Picks Against the Spread
description: Heres our NFL Week 11 picks against the spread and predictions

title: Eyeing his future, Xi Jinping rewrites the past.
Word of the Day: fealty
Red Notice Review: When the Stars Dont Shine
description: At some point between Dwayne Johnsons early years as a pro-wrestler and his rise to becoming one of the highest-paid actors in the biz today, something about him fizzled out. The action star rose because of his cocky charm and the ease with which he imparted a leonine intensity, shifting to softy mode at the drop of a hat. When Hollywood began relying increasingly on green screens, Johnson stood out, larger-than-life, against muddy digital backdrops of crumbling cities and candy-colored jungles. Yet I find myself missing the days when his eyebrows did all the work.

title: Stephen Colbert Is Tickled by a Judges Takedown of Trump
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: THURSDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: What to Do With a Multimillion-Dollar Megamansion? They Have Some Ideas.
description: Most people spend their 20s living with roommates. A few cobble together enough to buy a starter home. Petra Ecclestone isnt like most people. In 2011, when she was 22, the London-born Formula One racing heiress bought one of the largest houses in the United States  Spelling Manor in Los Angeles  for $85 million, more than almost anyone had ever paid for a house in California at the time.

title: Thinking Hard About Their Hair
description: Many mornings, in Los Angeles, Darrell Joness girlfriend helps him curl his hair. Running a flat iron over small sections that have been sprayed with heat protectant, she creates small ringlets, pinning them to his head to set. For a brief moment, he looks like hes gearing up to be the envy of the 1930s. After the tendrils cool, Mr. Jones, 21, sets them with hair spray and runs his fingers through his locks.

title: Quotation of the Day: Alexander Had a Great Hairdo, Too
description: Ive been told that I look like a sheepdog thats been electrocuted.

title: What Cuomo and His Accusers Told Investigators
description: Its Thursday. Well look at takeaways from testimony by Andrew Cuomo and the women who accused him of sexual harassment when he was governor. We will also look at Hunter Bidens gallery show, which opens to the public today.

title: What We Know So Far About Waning Vaccine Effectiveness
description: Vaccines still offer strong protection against severe Covid-19, but many studies show their protection against infection decreases over time. How much that decline matters is up for debate.

title: Weekly Health Quiz: Pain, Covid and Intense Exercise
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: On the Best Seller List, Rachel Held Evanss Legacy Endures
description: IN MEMORIAM In 2019, not long before Rachel Held Evans died from a brief, sudden illness, she summoned her husband to her office to take a look at her laptop. The first 20 percent of her new book was gone, lost to the binary grave of technology, writes Daniel Jonce Evans in a foreword to Wholehearted Faith, his wifes posthumously published essay collection.

title: Claire Tomalins Favorite Fictional Heroine? It Must Be Natasha in War and Peace
description: Joined of course by Emma, Elizabeth Bennet, Anne Elliot, Marianne  well, thats enough., says the renowned British biographer Claire Tomalin, whose latest book is The Young H.G. Wells. We all enjoy heroines who dont always behave themselves.

title: Poem: From the Pocket of His Lip
description: On his song Jump In, Wale rhymes: They say cappin I say wellin, I aint bout to switch it up. Both words are synonyms for lie. And Im reminded of home, how as a youngin in Prince Georges County, Md., wellin could be malicious, but was as often a way to invent a world better than the one we live in. Aireas From the Pocket of His Lip takes me back to those days, and how startling it is that even on the saddest days, with the saddest memories, we do more than curse with our pink confessions. Maybe our lies do come from a strange man with an oboe, who reminds us of our flaws, and the flaws of those we love, and how they, too, might play beautifully. Selected by Reginald Dwayne Betts

title: The Metaverse: Expectations vs. Reality
description: Mark Zuckerberg might be trying to stake his claim on the metaverse, but hes far from the first person to envision a more virtual world. Take it from Jaron Lanier.

title: When a Track Suit Embodies a Nation
description: The dystopic, fantastical show Squid Game  a bloody, nine-episode thriller by South Korean director-writer Hwang Dong-hyuk that has been lauded for its searing critique of capitalist society  continues to be a worldwide sensation. Approximately 142 million people have streamed the series since its debut in September, according to Netflix, and its elaborate Chekhovian guns have set off fan theories about every imaginable element.

title: They Took Their Brooklyn Budget to New Jersey for More Value. Which Home Would You Choose?
description: When working from home together became too tight, a couple went looking for an extra bedroom and a bigger kitchen. But they had to cross the Hudson to find it.

title: Whats in Your Queue?
description: Note: Our Student Review Contest is open until Dec. 15. This writing prompt may help you generate ideas for what you might review if youre interested in participating.

title: Heres How Mexico Can Clean Up Its Dirty Energy Industry
description: As delegates from around the world finish up their business in Glasgow at the United Nations climate conference, Mexico has not increased its emissions-mitigation goal, as countries pledged under the 2015 Paris Agreement.

title: If We Can Report on the Problem, We Can Report on the Solution
description: After 11 years and roughly 600 columns, this is our last.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Menu Talk
description: Andrew writes: When we dine out, my wife likes to consider the menu, ask questions of the server and trade suggestions with our companions. I believe you should know what you want within minutes. Whos right?

title: Lesson of the Day: From BTS to Squid Game: How South Korea Became a Cultural Juggernaut
description: Featured Article: From BTS to Squid Game: How South Korea Became a Cultural Juggernaut by Choe Sang-Hun

title: Found in the Crowd
description: Use your imagination to write the opening of a short story or poem inspired by this illustration  or, tell us about a memory from your own life that this image makes you think of.

title: The Shadow of Ronald Reagan Is Costing Us Dearly
description: With Build Back Better, President Biden has attempted to revive a New Deal ethic that entwines human and physical infrastructure. No one likes taxes, but building a nation where Americans know that their families are safe and cared for is popular across party lines. It shouldnt have been a hard sell.

title: A Little Push for Artists in Challenging Times
description: Lourdes Correa-Carlos inspiration comes from her surroundings.

title: Seeing the World Through a Grain of Rice
description: Before there was bread or pasta, much less meat or fish, there was rice. Growing up in Hawaii, Texas and Maryland, I ate rice three times a day: with fish for breakfast; with Spam and nori for lunch; with hamburger or more fish or tofu for dinner. In my childhood, Thanksgiving turkey was served not with mashed potatoes but rice; steak not with frites but rice; scrambled eggs not with toast but rice. (It wasnt until I went to college on the East Coast that I finally experienced classic American dishes accompanied by their traditional starches.) And it was always the same kind: white, short-grain Japanese rice, polished and glossy, pleasantly clumpy and quick to yield between the teeth, clinging to the chopstick, sticking to the spoon. In adulthood, when rice became a kind of decadence, sacrificed in adherence to a supposedly healthier, definitely less satisfying low-carb diet, the mere scent of it made me wistful  how much easier life seemed before rice became so complicated.

title: Americas Judges Are Putting My Life on the Line
description: Workers are flexing collective power in major strikes, workplace actions and organizing drives, as they are forced to fight battles that labor won decades earlier: over workplace safety, an eight-hour day, vacation, sick leave, a living wage, health care and retirement security. But even as workers build power and wield it, we are thwarted by laws and judges who reliably side with corporations over workers.

title: Stocks Soar in India, Luring Investors at Home and Abroad
description: Until the pandemic, Indias stock market was like another world that Dilip Kumar never had a reason to visit. But like so many other people around the world who were stuck at home, he began to see it as the place to be.

title: The Thrilling Dare of Scorched Rice
description: IT TAKES NERVE to scorch rice, to get a proper crust at the bottom of the pot, that layer of grains cooked past their time, bronzed and crisped but stopped just shy of burning; to go almost too far. You cant see whats happening. All thats visible if you lift the lid is the soft, yielding rice on top, fluffy and preening. But dont lift the lid, and dont stir. Maybe you tuck a towel around the rim for a tighter seal to catch drips of condensation; maybe you flick the flame up high, lean in to hear the last rustle of water boiling off, then shut down the burner and let the pot be, sitting there ticking in the fading heat. You have to rely on your sense of smell to recognize when the gorgeous scent of roasting is near its peak  when it hits that note of popcorn just bursting to life, kernels turning themselves inside out, or of hot chestnuts from street carts in winter, tossed in woks with tiny black stones and shucked of their sleeves  to save it before it ends in bitterness. Your reward: rices dark side, its alter ego, grains gone hard and sealed together, chewy and crunchy and sublime.

title: How Likely Is a Democratic Comeback Next Year?
description: The election results from last week reconfirmed a basic reality about American politics: For either party, holding the White House comes with significant power, but in off-year elections, it is often a burden.

title: The Core Legal Strategy Against Opioid Companies May Be Faltering
description: In 2014, as overdoses and deaths from prescription opioids were catapulting, gutting the budgets of local governments that were struggling to contain the damage, lawyers began working up a novel legal strategy to hold the pharmaceutical industry responsible.

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
description: Born in Mexico, the artist Felipe Galindo (professionally known as Feggo) moved to New York in 1983. At that time there wasnt a strong Mexican presence in the city, so, using his imagination, he created the community he desired: In his ongoing project Manhatitlan, which comprises drawings, animated shorts and a book, he incorporates imagery from his homeland into Manhattan landscapes.

title: Know How the Beatles Ended? Peter Jackson May Change Your Mind.
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: In Senegal, a Return to Homegrown Rice
description: NEAR MIDNIGHT, AT the top of a lighthouse in Dakar, the westernmost point of the African continent, I sat before a grilled whole fish as long as my forearm and accompanied by a dome of rice. Thiof, a white grouper, is such common Senegalese restaurant fare that the Wolof word itself is slang  a handsome man is also a thiof, a good catch. Id eaten beachside thiof south of Dakar in the vacation area of Saly, and cliffside thiof at breezy restaurants in Les Almadies, the Dakar neighborhood known for its nightlife. This thiof, though rubbed with spices like the others  I tasted ginger, garlic, cardamom, maybe turmeric  was served with a tiny cup of warm tamarind glaze. If there were vegetables on the plate, I have banished them from my memory; only the sauce, fish and rice were in conversation. The skin of the thiof was crisp and juicy, the sauce tangy and rich. The rice was not as long as basmati, nor as short as sticky rice, but a size in between, round through the middle with little adhesion and a firm but pliant texture. If food encapsulates pleasure, innovation and community all at once, then tasting the Platonic ideal of a simple dish can bring a place and its people into focus, even if you encounter that ideal in an unlikely setting  a lighthouse restaurant known for its brunch.

title: Living In ... Manhasset, N.Y.
description: Some seek a return to the familiar, two train stops away from New York City, in the tree-lined streets of a classic Long Island hamlet.

title: Manhasset, N.Y.: Hometown Aura and a Short Commute Lure Residents
description: Couples and families with young children from Manhattan and Queens have been flocking to Manhasset since the start of the pandemic, competing for million-dollar-plus homes in this casually elegant hamlet on the wealthy North Shore of Long Island, in western Nassau County. Among the recent buyers were some who grew up in the affable, well-to-do enclave and returned to raise their own families.

title: For Many Members of the Arab American Diaspora, Mansaf Offers a Taste of Home
description: WE WERE ARAB at home, mostly, and American in public. On weekends, Arabic music and the scents of cumin and sumac spilled through the windows in our otherwise sedate neighborhood in Syracuse, N.Y. Dads dinner parties were outsize, like his cooking, everything studded with garlic and bedded in great piles of rice: mujadara, maqluba, stuffed grape leaves and the most important Jordanian dish, mansaf, named for the big platter upon which its served. Ours covered the center of the dining room table. My youngest sister could have gone sledding with it. The bigger the mansaf, the more generous the host.

title: Tracing Mexicos Complicated Relationship With Rice
description: I ARRIVED IN Oaxaca on a rainy afternoon in May. We flew over pleated hills that formed a girdle around the Oaxaca valley, one of the most fertile variegated soils in the world. The earth was stamped with cloud shadows that gave an impression both of movement and fixity  a rich, dark earth with an inner seam that showed red and metallic in places. The shadow of the plane, like a fighter escort, followed us as we descended, then was subsumed by the rain-drenched tarmac. The sky was full of light. Leaving the small white airport, we passed a palisade of organ pipe cactuses. There was blue-leaved agave in the traffic islands and, lining the streets, the trees of my childhood in Delhi  flamboyant, laburnum, jacaranda  were in flower. A nondescript modern town of brightly shuttered shops, auto repair and signs that read aluminio y vidrio gave way to a fully intact Spanish colonial town from the 16th century. Downtown: local people, my driver said, observing the change, centro histrico for foreign people.

title: Nearly a third of Ugandas students may never return to school.
description: As much of the world moves closer to fully opening schools, at least one nation has stuck to keeping them fully or partly closed: Uganda.

title: F.W. de Klerk, South Africa President Who Ended Apartheid, Dies at 85
description: F.W. de Klerk, who as president of South Africa dismantled the apartheid system that he and his ancestors had helped put in place, died at his home near Cape Town on Thursday. He was 85.

title: Vocabulary in Context: Men's Fashion
description: Test your vocabulary and reading comprehension with this quiz based on the Times article "The Young Mens Style Council of TikTok."

title: A New Mercedes SL Stresses Horsepower and Verve
description: Under the long hood is a sophisticated and potent engine. The small cabin is just right for two adults. The tapering trunk is roomy enough to carry golf clubs, or the accouterments for a long weekend in Monaco or Montecito. A convertible top completes the package.

title: Public Health Officials Under Siege
description: This episode contains strong language.

title: Why Modern Medicine Struggles With Treating Chronic Pain
description: The mysterious illnesses in the Murray family started with Polly, the mother. During her pregnancies, she suffered fevers, headaches, intense joint pain and a red streak across her face.

title: The Celtics Are Starting to Get Their Act Together
description: BOSTON  The Celtics have spent recent years as a team of almost. Almost good enough to contend for an N.B.A. championship. Almost mature enough to reach their potential. Almost complete enough to play at a high level on a consistent basis.

title: Europe had over half of the worlds Covid deaths early this month, the W.H.O. says.
description: Coronavirus deaths in Europe rose 10 percent in the first week of this month and made up over half of the 48,000 coronavirus deaths reported globally in that time, even as new cases and deaths dropped or remained stable in the rest of the world, according to World Health Organization figures released this week.

title: Time is running out: Pope Francis calls for prayer as the summit nears its end.
description: Pope Francis urged Scotlands Catholics on Thursday to pray for a fruitful outcome as negotiators at the United Nations climate talks in Glasgow try to reach an agreement by weeks end.

title: Belfast Review: A Boys Life
description: Romanticism reigns in Belfast, Kenneth Branaghs cinematic memoir of his childhood in a turbulent Northern Ireland. From the lustrous, mainly black-and-white photography to the cozy camaraderie of its working-class setting, the movie softens edges and hearts alike. The family at its center might have health issues, money worries and an outdoor toilet, but this is no Ken Loach-style deprivation: In these streets, grit and glamour stroll hand-in-hand.

title: Home Sweet Home Alone Review: A Winter With Plenty of Falls
description: Burglars roasting on an open fire. Adults taking a pool ball to the nose. So go the Christmas caterwauls of Dan Mazers Home Sweet Home Alone, a painful spiritual sequel to the 1990 hit that made a meme of the child star Macaulay Culkin. Culkins Kevin McCallister does not appear, though his older brother Buzz (Devin Ratray) cameos to mention that the scamp has matured into a security alarm impresario.

title: Mayor Pete Review: Politics Is Local
description: We already knew Pete Buttigieg was good on camera. For Mayor Pete, the documentarian Jesse Moss followed Buttigieg  the current transportation secretary and former mayor of South Bend, Ind.  during his campaign for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination. But the resulting portrait rarely captures him in what looks like an unselfconscious moment.

title: 7 Prisoners Review: Survival at Any Cost
description: Deep into 7 Prisoners, the protagonist stares up at the labyrinthine electrical cables of the transformers that power the city of So Paulo. He is Mateus (Christian Malheiros), a human trafficking victim from the Brazilian countryside. He works in a filthy junkyard for long hours without pay, stripping cables for the copper that helps these very towers run. A wave of wounded anguish percolates under Mateuss eyes, as his boss, Mr. Luca (Rodrigo Santoro) says, Your work powers the whole city. The camera shifts to electric train lines next to slums and the glittering skyline of the city lit up at night. Mateuss exploitation is so profound, an entire metropolis vibrates with complicity.

title: Uppercase Print Review: Between the Lines
description: Uppercase Print opens with a fragment of a quote from the philosopher Michel Foucault: the resonance I feel when I happen to encounter these small lives reduced to ashes in the few sentences that struck them down. The film, a rousing, form-bending new feature by the Romanian auteur Radu Jude, rails at the tyrannical potential of language  particularly when backed by government power  to suffocate peoples freedoms.

title: 3212 Un-Redacted Review: Trying to Solve a Missions Mysteries
description: For anyone confused about the circumstances in which four American soldiers were killed in an ambush in Niger in 2017, the documentary 3212 Un-Redacted clearly lays out the geography and complicated timeline. It also suggests that confusion is understandable: The movie argues that the Pentagons official investigation, which placed the bulk of the blame on junior-level officers, unfairly characterized the events and went out of its way to protect high-ranking officials.

title: Paper & Glue Review: A Sequel of Sorts to Faces Places
Julia Review: She Changed Your Life and Your Utensil Drawer
description: According to this movie, if you own a garlic press, you probably have Julia Child to thank for it. The opening scenes of Julia, a lively documentary directed by Julie Cohen and Betsy West, paint a dire picture of suburban American home cooking in the post-World War II era: frozen entrees and Jell-O molds and Spam, Spam, Spam, Spam  an ethos that put convenience ahead of delectability.

title: They Say Nothing Stays the Same Review: Crossing a Modern River
description: Directed by the actor Joe Odagiri, They Say Nothing Stays the Same is a postcard-pretty film about a boatman in Meiji-era Japan. For years, Toichi (Akira Emoto) has ferried people back and forth on a river amid unspoiled beauty. A large part of the films appeal comes from that natural splendor and the lives Toichi glimpses while making one trip after another.

title: Love Is Love Is Love Review: Aging Too Gracefully
description: One of the great comforts in life is the assurance that misery can be interesting. Contentment doesnt necessarily provide onlookers (or audiences) with the pleasure of great gossip, drama or insight, and the characters in the idle drama Love Is Love Is Love, directed by Eleanor Coppola, mostly seem like content, happy people.

title: Border tensions are of utmost concern to all sober-thinking people, Russia says.
description: As the border crisis along the European Unions eastern flank has intensified, President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko of Belarus has once again turned to his most reliable patron and supporter: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia. The two have met in person at least five times this year, and Moscow has been steadfast despite a storm of criticism from Western leaders.

title: Alibaba reports slower sales growth for its Singles Day shopping event.
description: The Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba said $84.5 billion in merchandise was sold on its platforms during the Singles Day shopping festival that ended on Thursday, an 8.5 percent increase over last year and an indication that Beijings campaign to tighten regulation of internet companies has not dimmed consumers enthusiasm for buying stuff online.

title: Britains economic recovery has slowed as supply disruptions persist.
description: The British economys recovery slowed through the summer, delaying its return to its prepandemic size as supply shortages hampered businesses and exports declined.

title: What We Learned From Tim Cook, Antony Blinken, Mary Barra and More
description: Andrews reflections as host of this weeks DealBook summit, the 10th edition of the event as we celebrate DealBooks 20th anniversary:

title: Outside Climate Summit, Trash in Glasgow Piles High
description: GLASGOW  In Gaelic, Glasgow translates to dear green place, a nod to the parks, gardens and flourishing green spaces throughout the city. But according to Chris Mitchell, who was a garbage collector there for more than two decades, the only thing flourishing in Glasgow these days is a mountain of waste.

title: As Poland celebrates its Independence Day, far-right groups stage rallies across the country.
description: WARSAW  Tens of thousands of nationalist marchers took to the streets of the capital on Thursday to commemorate Polands independence, warning that the country was under assault by Middle Eastern migrants trying to cross its eastern border with Belarus.

title: Familys Disappearance Reflects Toll of Californias Deadly Heat
description: On a sunny morning in mid-August, a couple hiked into the Sierra National Forest with their baby daughter and disappeared.

title: I Support My Parents Financially. Can I Have a Say in Their Spending?
description: My husband and I send monthly checks to my parents to help support them. They live rent-free in an apartment we bought them. We feel fortunate to be able to help. Now, my mother has decided she would like to move for the length of an upcoming construction project in their building. She is worried about loud noise and dust. I dont want to question their spending, but this seems impulsive. The building fees and taxes we pay indirectly will go to waste if they move temporarily. Presumably, they will use their leftover allowance to pay rent on the second place. I am concerned about my mothers temper (toward my father and others) if we nix this plan. And my husband may feel unappreciated if they take our generosity for granted. How can I persuade my parents not to be spendthrifts on our dime?

title: The T List: Five Things We Recommend This Week
description: Welcome to the T List, a newsletter from the editors of T Magazine. Each week, we share things were eating, wearing, listening to or coveting now. Sign up here to find us in your inbox every Wednesday. And you can always reach us at tlist@nytimes.com.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are five-bedroom homes in Pound Ridge, N.Y., and Bedminster, N.J.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in Murray Hill Ditmas Park and Riverdale.

title: Homes for Sale in Manhattan, Brooklyn and the Bronx
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: Zadie Smiths First Play Brings Chaucer to Her Beloved Northwest London
description: LONDON  Zadie Smith grew up around the corner from the Kiln Theater, which sits on the bustling Kilburn High Road in Northwest London. She took drama classes at the theater as a child and remembers when a fire caused significant damage to the building more than 30 years ago.

title: A House Near a National Park Can Be a Bargain
description: Owning a home in or around a pristine natural area that will remain untouched by development is no fantasy if you buy near a national park. And it doesnt always carry a premium price, either. A recent study by Outforia, an online resource offering news, information and research about nature and outdoors activities, compared the values of homes near U.S. national parks to find the greatest premiums and discounts compared with the averages in those states.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone at 20: The Film That Started It All
description: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone ruined Daniel Radcliffes expectations for what is normal on a film set.

title: The Anatomy of New Hugs
description: Welcome. The holidays approach, and with them, the excitement tinged with concern weve come to associate with get-togethers in the pandemic. This year, vaccinations affect the calculations. Were titrating our levels of anticipation and anxiety as we work out what a Thanksgiving gathering looks like in 2021. Indoors or out? Masked or not? Buffet or family-style? How many guests? How close will we sit? What will we talk about? What wont we talk about?

title: On the ground: Hiding and hurting in the forests of Poland.
description: It was pitch black before dawn on Thursday, and only the howling winter wind pierced the silence in the primeval forest near Polands border with Belarus. Guided to this location by a pin on a Google map, a group of humanitarian workers was supposed to meet migrants in desperate need of assistance.

title: Night Raiders Review: A Future That Resembles the Past
description: Night Raiders imagines a dystopian world where Indigenous people have been displaced from their land and ghettoized in reserves, while their children are forcibly enrolled in residential schools that brainwash them into forgetting their language and culture. That these are aspects of the actual history of Indigenous communities in North America, and not merely futuristic fictions, is the ingenious and damning conceit of Danis Goulets debut feature.

title: Christopher Walken Destroys Banksy Painting on BBC Comedy Show
description: With a few swipes of a paint roller, the actor Christopher Walken wiped away a real Banksy painting from the side of a building in England on an episode of BBCs The Outlaws that aired Wednesday night.

title: Review: In Yellowjackets, Its Reunion Time for the Crash of 96
description: Ever since Oceanic Flight 815 crashed in 2004, creating another Lost has been TVs great doomed quest. Usually, the failures misunderstand what made Lost exceptional in the first place.

title: Teaching Math, the California Way
description: To the Editor:

title: Jonathan Reynolds, Playwright and Food Columnist, Dies at 79
description: Jonathan Reynolds, who in a wide-ranging career wrote successful plays, helped write a famously bad movie, turned out lively articles on how to cook the perfect turkey and all manner of other food-related subjects, and combined his love of food and his way with words in an unusual stage show, died on Oct. 27 in Englewood, N.J. He was 79.

title: Whats Going On in This Graph? | Supply Chain Delays
description: These flowchart graphs show one example of the supply chain delays that are causing so many products to be unavailable to consumers when they want them. The example is for rear derailleurs, a small but critical part of Catrike recumbent trikes. These three-wheeled vehicles have been in great demand since the beginning of the pandemic.

title: Bariatric Surgery May Lower Risk for Severe Liver Disease, New Study Finds
description: One in four American adults has fatty liver disease caused by obesity, not drinking, and there is no medical treatment for it. Doctors say the only way to keep it in check is to lose weight and eat a healthier diet.

title: Dream of Buying a Home Gets Harder for Single Mothers
description: Karlet Hewitt decided to make major lifestyle changes after experiencing the shocks of the pandemic: the income hit, the confinement, the view of the padlocked park through her third-floor apartment window. In February, Ms. Hewitt  a single mother to a 9-year-old boy  left Mount Vernon, N.Y., and headed south.

title: Aaron Rodgers and Mehmet Oz Dont Know Absolutely Everything
description: Theres no entitlement like celebrity entitlement.

title: Barbara Kruger: Infinitely Copied, Still Unmatched
description: CHICAGO  At the entrance of Thinking of You. I Mean Me. I Mean You. the striking, flag-planting new Barbara Kruger retrospective (and elaboration) at the Art Institute of Chicago, youre greeted with one of the artists videos, installed like a blockade. Its of an image being assembled like a jigsaw puzzle, clacking loudly with each new added piece. You stand before it, as if staring into a Las Vegas slot machine  a tractor beam of tsk-tsk propaganda. When complete, the message is delivered with a thump: I shop therefore I am.

title: Why the Internet Is Turning Into QVC
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. Here is a collection of past columns.

title: Calls for Climate Reparations Reach Boiling Point in Glasgow Talks
description: GLASGOW - For as long as there have been international climate talks, Saleemul Huq, a botanist from Bangladesh, has quietly counseled diplomats and activists on the prickliest question: What is owed to countries least responsible for the problem of global warming but most harmed by its effects  and by whom?

title: Austria is likely to order a lockdown for unvaccinated people, its chancellor warns.
description: New lockdown restrictions for unvaccinated people in Austria are likely because new coronavirus cases in the country are rising rapidly, Chancellor Alexander Schallenberg said on Thursday.

title: Lady Gaga and Ridley Scott on House of Gucci: When Beauty Turns Ugly
description: LONDON  The day after House of Gucci had its splashy London premiere, Lady Gaga met me in a hotel room near Trafalgar Square, offering a little bit of a disclaimer.

title: Passing Review: Black Skin, White Masks
description: Irene Redfield, the restless heart of Rebecca Halls piercing drama Passing, has a beautiful dream of a life. She also has a handsome husband whos a doctor, a pair of well-behaved children, an elegant townhouse and a maid to help keep the domestic churn in check. She has good friends and meaningful charity work. Her figure is trim and graceful; her lovely face serene and unlined. Everything is as it should be, or so Irene believes. She doesnt know that her idyll is as fragile as a soap bubble, and that this glistening, quivering fantasy she has created needs just one touch to vanish.

title: Always Jane Is Part of a New Generation of Trans Documentaries
description: In the first part of the documentary series Always Jane, Jane Noury, a high school student in suburban New Jersey, hangs out with friends, contemplates college  maybe the School of Visual Arts?  and works at the local Panera. She dreams of being a director. Near the end of Part 1, Jane also learns that she will have to miss commencement; it falls on the same day as her gender confirmation surgery.

title: Veterans Have Become Unlikely Lobbyists in Push to Legalize Psychedelic Drugs
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Steven Mark Klein, Fashion Archivist and Gadfly, Dies at 70
description: Elise By Olsen had made a name for herself at 15 as one of the worlds youngest magazine editors, having already produced runs of two print periodicals about culture and fashion from her bedroom in Oslo. One day in 2015 she received a challenging email: Who are you?

title: Whats in Our Queue? Diane Arbus and More
description: I'm a photo editor on the Culture desk. Here are five things I've been watching, reading and listening to.

title: Mix and Match the Perfect Sidesgiving
description: Im usually in charge of the cooking on Thanksgiving, and while I look forward to it all year, I consider the turkey an obligation, nothing more. \_()_/ All I really want to cook, and all I really want to eat, are the sides  the actual, low-key superstars of the table.

title: Fashions Oscars Return, After a Year That Reshaped the Industry
description: Fashion is not clothes  or, at least, it is not merely clothes. Such was the implicit message of Wednesday nights CFDA awards, also known as fashions Oscars.

title: Sudans Top General Entrenches Military Coup, Frustrating Western Efforts
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Sudans army chief appointed himself as the head of a new ruling body on Thursday, entrenching a recent military coup and dealing a major blow to Western-led efforts to steer Sudan back to a democratic path.

title: What Students Are Saying About Gen Zs Values, Thrift-Shopping, and Beloved Family Members
description: Welcome to another roundup of student comments on our recent writing prompts.

title: Biden Marks First Veterans Day in Two Decades Without Troops in Active Combat
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden paid homage on Thursday to veterans, calling them the solid steel spine of the United States and the soul of America as he marked the first Veterans Day in two decades without troops engaged in an active war overseas.

title: Review: Dancing Bodies That Contain Multitudes
description: Can choreographers  or anyone, really  ever make something entirely new? Entirely their own? With her series I Am Also, the dancer and choreographer Molly Poerstel reminds us that every artist is a constellation of influences, a messy composite of other people and past experiences. In dance, that entanglement is especially intimate, deeply rooted in the body. As Poerstel writes of her latest work, I Am Also  Monte, referring to the many choreographers with whom she has danced: Their work exists within my body, therefore, this work is an extension of their minds and bodies.

title: Palestinian Diplomats Targeted by Israeli Spyware, Official Says
description: JERUSALEM  A senior Palestinian official said Thursday that the phones of three high-ranking Palestinian diplomats had been hacked by military-grade spyware made by the private Israeli firm NSO Group.

title: P.S.G. Player Released; No Charges Filed in Teammates Attack
description: A Paris St.-Germain womens soccer player was released from police custody without charges on Thursday, one day after she was arrested as part of the investigation into a violent attack on one of her teammates by masked men wielding a metal bar.

title: Substitute Teachers Never Got Much Respect, but Now They Are in Demand
description: When Amber McCoy called in sick this fall, there was not a substitute teacher who could step into her fourth-grade class in Huntington, W.Va.

title: Cusp Review: Teenage Girls, Stuck With Shrugging Off Harm
description: Directed by Isabel Bethencourt and Parker Hill, the verit-style documentary Cusp follows three Texan teenage girls on summer vacation. The group of friends, Brittney, Aaloni, and Autumn, ages 15 to 16, live a seemingly carefree existence. But as we partake in the girls shenanigans  house parties, back seat gossiping, bedroom intimacies  their recurring testimonies about sexual trauma and consent stand out.

title: Salon Fair, Still Focused on Decor, Now Back at the Armory
description: After a year off because of the pandemic, Salon Art + Design is back at the Park Avenue Armory with a display of fine art and designer furniture shown in themed booths alongside splashy decorative arts and ancient sculpture.

title: How to Protect Your Kids Hearing
description: Taking precautions now can mean protecting their hearing into adulthood.

title: Cam Newton Signs Deal to Return to Carolina Panthers
description: The Carolina Panthers agreed to terms with quarterback Cam Newton on Thursday, the team announced, reuniting the franchise with its career leading passer and one of its most popular players less than two years after it released him.

title: What Do We See When We Look at the Sky? Review: But I Digress
description: What Do We See When We Look at the Sky? Its a good title and better question and, much like the movie attached to it, the answer easily spirals off in different directions. We look at the sky itself, of course, the dark and light clouds. We look at rainbows and lightning, smog and smoke, tall trees and taller buildings, soaring birds and buzzing insects, though in practice we dont often truly look at the world, which means we dont see it or its everyday wonders, terrors and adventures  which is to this movies point.

title: Do You Hide Your True Self While Dating?
description: Last September, when Remy Barnwell, 26, started dating Ben Podnar, who is white, she was hesitant to wear her hair in its natural state. As a Black woman, she was uncertain of how he would respond to her tightly coiled strands.

title: A Missing Piece of the Moon May Be Following Earth Around the Sun
description: Space is vast and lonely. It is perfectly understandable, then, that a little rock would decide to tag along with Earth and the moon on their yearly circumnavigation of the sun.

title: Saudi Court Blocks Execution of Man Convicted of Crime Committed at 14
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Saudi Arabias highest court has overturned the conviction of a Saudi man who was sentenced to death after a lower court found him guilty of robbing a jewelry store and killing a police officer when he was 14 years old, rights groups tracking the case said on Thursday.

title: What Climate Change Looks Like From Space
description: The impact is etched on land and ice across the planet.

title: The White House Says Its Plans Will Slow Inflation. The Big Question Is: When?
description: Rocketing inflation has become a headache for U.S. consumers, and President Biden has a go-to prescription. He says a key way to help relieve increasing prices is to pass a $1.85 trillion collection of spending programs and tax cuts that is currently languishing in the Senate.

title: Can We Talk About Critical Race Theory?
description: The national debate over critical race theory  if one can even call it a debate  has been filled with half-truths, unfulfilled definitions, and a whole lot of obfuscation and obstruction. It feels, at times, as if weve walked into an unfinished simulation where certain objects carry a vague resemblance to real things, but if you actually want to navigate the space, youre going to have to take a lot of untrustworthy peoples word for whats what.

title: Edward L. Sadowsky, a Lion of the New York City Council, Dies at 92
description: Edward L. Sadowsky, a six-term member of the New York City Council who helped redeem that body's reputation before a 1989 government overhaul granted it broader powers, died on Thursday in Beachwood, Ohio. He was 92.

title: 11 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: This weeks recommended books include a couple of biographies of the civil rights leader Fannie Lou Hamer, along with memoirs by the celebrated movie director James Ivory and the Kenyan activist Nice Lengete. Theres also a new biography of Robert E. Lee, an insiders account of Trump-era Washington and an essay collection about antisemitism and the hazards of Jewish memory. In fiction, Jocelyn Nicole Johnsons debut collection joins new novels by the heavyweights Louise Erdrich, Elizabeth Strout and Amor Towles.

title: Vanessa Nakate, speaking for a leery youth movement, offers a challenge: Prove us wrong.
description: GLASGOW  Vanessa Nakate, a climate activist from Uganda, told the United Nations climate summit on Thursday that she and her peers did not believe the pledges that ministers, corporations and banks made this week to move aggressively on climate change.

title: Film Club: When Pinball Was Illegal
description: Scares over youth culture are not new. From comic books to video games, heavy metal to rap music, adults have long worried about the harmful effects of popular culture on children. But did you know that pinball was once banned for fears of turning kids into  wait for it   stark raving mad gambling addicts? Yes, pinball, the arcade game with the metal ball, flippers, bumpers and lots of flashing lights and dinging sounds.

title: Germanys Fourth Covid Wave: A Pandemic of the Unvaccinated
description: BERLIN  The University Hospital of Giessen, one of Germanys foremost clinics for pulmonary disease, is at capacity. The number of Covid-19 patients has tripled in recent weeks. Nearly half of them are on ventilators.

title: 4 Games to Watch This Weekend
description: Catch our picks in the N.W.S.L. playoffs, college football and basketball, and the N.F.L.

title: The Bolsonaro-Trump Connection Threatening Brazils Elections
description: BRASLIA  The conference hall was packed, with a crowd of more than 1,000 cheering attacks on the press, the liberals and the politically correct. There was Donald Trump Jr. warning that the Chinese could meddle in the election, a Tennessee congressman who voted against certifying the 2020 vote, and the president complaining about voter fraud.

title: Five Poets Who Find Music in the Personal, the Political or in Music Itself
description: HOWDIE-SKELPBy Paul Muldoon179 pp. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $27.

title: Quandra Prettyman, Champion of Black Womens Literature, Dies at 88
description: Quandra Prettyman, who developed some of the countrys first courses in Black womens literature as the first full-time Black faculty member at Barnard College, died on Oct. 21 at her home in Manhattan. She was 88.

title: Juilliard Stages an Orpheus Rarity From Operas Early Days
description: What became known as opera originated in Florence, Italy, during late-16th-century equivalents of college dorm bull sessions.

title: On Delhis Toxic River, Prayers to a Sun Struggling to Shine Through Smog
description: NEW DELHI  As the worshipers descended the slope to the riverbank, dressed in their festival best and carrying offerings, a voice on the loudspeaker repeated: The water is deep, dont let go of your childs hand, dont let them in the water.

title: You Know the Saying: You Are the Product
description: When is free not free?

title: Zuo Fang, Chinese Journalist Who Challenged the Powerful, Dies at 86
description: Zuo Fang, a journalist who helped start Chinas most influential reform-era newspaper and edited it with the conviction that the press should inform, enlighten and entertain rather than parrot Communist Party propaganda, died on Nov. 3 in Guangzhou, China. He was 86.

title: Far-Right Groups Stage Rallies on Polands Independence Day
description: The focus was on the migrant standoff at the countrys eastern border with Belarus.

title: For a 96-Year-Old Veteran, the Parade Came to Him
description: Jack Le Vine did not march in the big Veterans Day parade up Fifth Avenue in Manhattan on Thursday, or attend the small service at the Brooklyn War Memorial.

title: Court Issues Brief Hold on Release of Trump Files in Jan. 6 Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  A federal appeals court issued a short-term injunction on Thursday blocking the National Archives from turning over to Congress documents from the Trump White House related to the Jan. 6 Capitol riot, a day before the House committee investigating the attack was set to receive the first batch.

title: The Supreme Court Tactic That Aims to Kill Affirmative Action
description: The plaintiffs who filed lawsuits accusing Harvard and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill of racial discrimination in their admissions policies are asking the Supreme Court to hear both cases together, potentially increasing the chances that the justices will issue a sweeping ruling that strikes down affirmative action across higher education.

title: Odell Beckham Jr. Agrees to Deal With Los Angeles Rams
description: The afternoon started with plenty of jokes.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Leaders of Chinas Communist Party on Thursday approved a rewriting of the partys 100-year history, which placed Xi Jinping among the countrys giants. The move paved the way for Xis continued political dominance.

title: In Illinois, Dueling Infrastructure Votes Reflect Shifting G.O.P. Terrain
description: WASHINGTON  For months, Representative Darin LaHood appeared to be a sure Republican vote for President Bidens major infrastructure bill that had passed the Senate with bipartisan support and was awaiting House consideration.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: The Shrink Next DoorWhen to watch: Arrives Friday, on Apple TV+.

title: Amid Fear of a Work Stoppage, Baseball Is Stuck in Neutral
description: CARLSBAD, Calif.  Expected to still be rebuilding, this years Seattle Mariners offered a glimpse of their potential future. They won 90 games, the teams highest total since 2003. Their hopes of reaching the postseason for the first time since 2001  the longest playoff drought among teams from the four major North American mens professional sports leagues  were alive until the final day of the regular season.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: As millions of eligible Americans consider getting a booster shot, many are wondering what the data tells us about the effectiveness of the vaccines, and how much their protection might be waning.

title: Treasure Hunter Who Got Lost in Yellowstone Must Repay Cost of Rescue
description: In August 2018, Mark Lantiss mother dropped him off at a trailhead at Yellowstone National Park to search for the buried treasure of an eccentric millionaire. But after going off trail and getting lost in the Wyoming backcountry, Mr. Lantis ended up in need of a helicopter airlift.

title: Migrant Crisis, Glasgow, Veterans Day: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Pedro Feliciano, Durable Relief Pitcher for the Mets, Dies at 45
description: Pedro Feliciano, a relief pitcher who was the workhorse of the Mets bullpen for five years  including three straight seasons in which he led the major leagues in appearances, earning him the nickname Perpetual Pedro  died on Monday at his home in Puerto Rico. He was 45.

title: Project Veritas and the Line Between Journalism and Political Spying
description: WASHINGTON  Hours after F.B.I. agents searched the homes of two former Project Veritas operatives last week, James OKeefe, the leader of the conservative group, took to YouTube to defend its work as the stuff of responsible, ethical journalism.

title: Americans Are in a Funk About the Economy. How Long Will It Last?
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: Chicken & Biscuits Will Close Early Following Covid Pause
description: After having to cancel more than a weeks worth of shows after members of its company tested positive for the coronavirus, the producers of the new Broadway play Chicken & Biscuits announced Thursday that it would end its run on Nov. 28, citing the significant financial impact of the show cancellations.

title: Who Is Aleksandr G. Lukashenko? Heres What You Need to Know.
description: He has touted ice hockey, vodka, saunas and tractor-driving as remedies for Covid. He sent a fighter jet to intercept a European airliner carrying a prominent dissident. He has made his generals salute his teenage son.

title: Problems at D.C. Jail Were Ignored Until Jan. 6 Defendants Came Along
description: For several months, a few dozen men being held without bail in connection with the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol have loudly and repeatedly complained about conditions at the District of Columbia jail.

title: The clash over the Belarus-Poland border crisis spills into the U.N. Security Council.
description: The escalating standoff over the migrants bivouacked in Belarus and blocked from entering Poland and Lithuania spilled into the United Nations Security Council on Thursday, as the councils Western members accused Belarus of concocting the crisis and Russia dismissed their move as cynical politics.

title: On the Menu at the Climate Talks
description: A look at some menu offerings in Glasgow, host of the global climate summit the past two weeks.

title: Political Campaigns Can Still Target You on Facebook
description: Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: SpaceX Delivers NASAs Crew-3 Astronauts to Space Station
description: Four astronauts boarded the International Space Station on Thursday after a daylong trip inside a spacecraft built by Elon Musks space company, SpaceX. The quartet pushed to more than 600 the number of people to have flown to space, a further milestone in 2021, the busiest year for human spaceflight in over a decade.

title: The Little Country That Could Wonders if It Still Can
description: Luis Surez arrived first. And in the ordinary run of things, for a city like Salto  a sleepy place tucked into a distant corner of a tiny country  that would have been its claim to fame: producing one of the finest strikers of a generation. Except that, precisely three weeks later, a second arrived.

title: In Trial of Men Accused of Arbery Murder, Jurors Consider Security Videos
description: ATLANTA  The graphic footage of the killing of Ahmaud Arbery is not the only crucial video evidence in the trial of the three men accused of murdering him.

title: The Awesome Importance of Imagination
description: Plato and Aristotle disagreed about the imagination. As the philosopher Stephen Asma and the actor Paul Giamatti pointed out in an essay in March, Plato gave the impression that imagination is a somewhat airy-fairy luxury good. It deals with illusions and make-believe and distracts us from reality and our capacity to coolly reason about it. Aristotle countered that imagination is one of the foundations of all knowledge.

title: History Says Dont Panic About Inflation
description: Back in July the White Houses Council of Economic Advisers posted a thoughtful article to its blog titled, Historical Parallels to Todays Inflationary Episode. The article looked at six surges in inflation since World War II and argued persuasively that current events dont look anything like the 1970s. Instead, the closest parallel to 2021s inflation is the first of these surges, the price spike from 1946 to 1948.

title: John Artis, Convicted With Rubin (Hurricane) Carter, Dies at 75
description: John Artis, the co-defendant of the prizefighter Rubin (Hurricane) Carter, whose triple murder convictions became an international cause clbre before they were overturned  a reversal that became an indictment of the criminal justice system itself  died on Sunday at his home in Hampton, Va. He was 75.

title: It Took 10 Days. But Murphys Republican Rival Has Conceded.
description: RARITAN, N.J.  Jack Ciattarelli, a Republican who ran a spirited campaign to unseat New Jerseys Democratic governor, conceded defeat on Friday, acknowledging 10 days after polls closed that he had no path to victory.

title: Black Officer Who Was Given K.K.K. Sign by Chief Files Civil Rights Complaint
description: A Black police officer in Ohio whose chief left a sheet of paper with the words Ku Klux Klan on his raincoat this summer, a jarring discovery captured in a surveillance video obtained by the officers lawyers, filed a discrimination complaint on Thursday with the states Civil Rights Commission.

title: Review: In Nollywood Dreams, a Star and an Industry Are Born
description: Producing more than 1,000 movies a year each, Bollywood, Indias Hindi film industry, and Nollywood, the Nigerian version, have long outpaced the California dream-makers who think they rule the world in Hollywood.

title: In Scrutinized Kyle Rittenhouse Trial, Its the Judge Commanding Attention
description: It is not every day that jurors in a criminal trial applaud a witness, but that was how the final day of testimony in the homicide trial of Kyle Rittenhouse began on Thursday. Noting that it was Veterans Day, the judge urged people in the courtroom to clap for military veterans moments after he discovered that the only veteran in the room appeared to be the next witness for the defense, an expert on use of force.

title: Migrants in Peril, and Raw Emotions, in a Volatile European Border Standoff
description: WARSAW  Thousands of migrants, unwilling weapons in a geopolitical struggle, in peril in a freezing border zone. Far-right nationalists marching on the streets of Warsaw, calling for harsh action against asylum seekers. Belligerent national leaders facing off across a razor-wire border.

title: Does Dogsomnia Keep You Up at Night?
description: Every night around 2 a.m., my sleeping partner wakes me up because shes thirsty and needs a bathroom break. Fortunately for her, she has no trouble going back to sleep. I know this because after this nightly ritual, Im often wide-awake, listening to her gentle snores.

title: First Pass Friday: Covering for a Cold One
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Welcome to another edition of First Pass Friday, an occasional feature where you can follow along as I try to break into the first themeless puzzle of the week.

title: Variety: Out of Order
description: OUT OF ORDER  Ive always loved anagrams and have solved hundreds of them in various types of cryptic puzzles, so I puttered into todays grid by Alex Eaton-Salners as if it would be a walk in a familiar park. Not so! I had to start it a couple of times and found the whole experience humbling.

title: On Paris Stages, Black Directors Forge a New Course
description: PARIS  On a recent Sunday evening, Paris played host to a theater troupe that had come a long way. The Grand Thtre Itinrant de Guyane traveled from French Guiana, nestled north of Brazil on the Atlantic coast of South America, with its latest production: Bernarda Alba From Yana, staged by the companys director, Odile Pedro Leal.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: The border standoff between Poland and Belarus escalated on Thursday, with both countries issuing threats as thousands of migrants remained stranded in the freezing cold wondering where they could go next. We have the latest updates.

title: Migrants Stuck at Belaruss Border Amid Its Standoff With the E.U.
description: Western leaders have accused Belaruss president of manufacturing a migrant crisis along the E.U.s eastern border. Several people have already died of exposure. Aid workers worry the death toll will increase as winter sets in.

title: The Manny Diaries
description: I was 24, relatively new to New York City, working a day job I hated, waiting tables at night, and writing plays in my bedroom during any spare moment. But money was getting tight, and so were my jeans, as I ended most of my serving shifts by scarfing down high-calorie pub food. With few options left, I decided to fall back on the one job I knew would be a sure thing: babysitting.

title: Who Has The Most Historical Responsibility for Climate Change?
description: The worlds wealthiest nations are disproportionately responsible for global warming. A sticking point at this years climate summit: Should they pay for the damage?

title: Quotation of the Day: Fourth Covid Wave Grips Germany in a Pandemic of the Unvaccinated
description: I dont know how we can win this race against time with the fourth wave. I fear weve already lost.

title: Corrections: Nov. 12, 2021
description: An article on Thursday about the making of a 3-D reconstruction of the Dixie fires thunderclouds misattributed comments about the process of animating the data. It was Noah Pisner, not Nick Bartzokas, who described the process.

title: Ethiopia Is Spiraling, and Theres One Mans Mistake Behind It
description: Thousands of people killed, more than two million internally displaced and nearly a million facing famine. The conflict in Ethiopia, begun a year ago when Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed launched a military assault on the Tigray region, is spiraling out of control.

title: Myanmar Court Sentences American Journalist to 11 Years
description: Danny Fenster, an American journalist who has been imprisoned in Myanmar since May, was found guilty of three charges on Friday and given an 11-year prison term, the toughest possible sentence, his lawyer said.

title: Migration and Experimentation: What Led to Australias Coffee Culture
description: A couple of years ago, when I was planning a trip to the United States, a few friends joked that I had to beware of their terrible coffee.

title: Word of the Day: savoir faire
Prison Wont Be a Riot for the QAnon Shaman, Jimmy Kimmel Says
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Veterans Day
description: On Thursday, the United States celebrated the first Veterans Day in two decades without troops engaged in an active war overseas. And the Tomb of the Unknowns in Arlington, Va., commemorated its centennial, allowing the public access to the site for the first time in decades.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: FRIDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Ocasio-Cortez Isnt Wavering. Are New Yorkers on Her Side?
description: As the No. 6 subway train creaked toward an elevated Bronx station on Tuesday, one of Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortezs constituents stood across the street, struggling to understand his congresswomans opposition to the most sweeping public works legislation in generations.

title: Lesson of the Day: 2021 Has Been a Bad Year for Manatees
description: This lesson is a part of our new Accessible Activities feature, which aims to welcome a wider variety of learners to our site and to The Times. Learn more and tell us what you think here.

title: In Ocasio-Cortezs District, Disagreements About the Democrats Direction
description: Good morning. Its Friday. Well look at Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and the direction of the Democratic Party. Well also meet the Norway spruce that is on the way to Rockefeller Center.

title: James Baldwins Review, Babe Ruth and Other Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
description: Selections from the current Weekend section, including a review of Passing.

title: New in Paperback: The Office of Historical Corrections and Alright, Alright, Alright
description: THE LIARS DICTIONARY, by Eley Williams. (Anchor, 288 pp., $16.) You wouldnt expect a comic novel about a dictionary to be a thriller too, but this one is, our reviewer, Patricia T. OConner, wrote, adding that The Liars Dictionary is also a mystery, love story (two of them) and cliffhanging melodrama.

title: A Singer Lends Her Voice to a Conversation About Autism
description: I DREAM HE TALKS TO MEA Memoir of Learning How to ListenBy Allison Moorer

title: The New York Times News Quiz, November 12, 2021
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: Their Romance Blossomed from a Love of Plants
description: Dr. Sarah Santucci and Kevin Zhang have always shared a love of plants.

title: The Secret to a Better Internet? Post Less, Chat More.
description: As we debate the negative effects of social media, consider the earliest and arguably most prevalent way that we use the internet to connect with other people: the chat.

title: He Wanted the Relationship More Than the Job
description: When Andrew Katz decided to accept a job in Washington in the summer of 2015, Marysa Greenawalt, his girlfriend of eight months, was concerned about being in a long-distance relationship. But not for herself.

title: Where Is Your Favorite Place to Read?
description: Are you a person who is able to read anywhere: loud and busy places as well as quiet libraries or parks? Or are you more particular about where you snuggle up with a book?

title: He Had Many Questions Before Popping the Big One
description: Audrey Han and Dong Frank Han met in the summer of 2012 when they sat next to each other at an investment banking internship run by Morgan Stanley in New York.

title: Madison Saw Something in the Constitution We Should Open Our Eyes To
description: Not content to simply count on the traditional midterm swing against the presidents party, Republicans are set to gerrymander their way to a House majority next year.

title: What Its Like Covering the Most Anticipated Climate Conference in Years
description: The United Nations climate change conference known as COP26 officially comes to an end on Friday, as nearly 200 nations try to finalize an agreement to tackle global warming. World leaders, climate experts and activists gathered in Glasgow to galvanize countries into preventing the average global temperature from rising more than 1.5 degrees Celsius above preindustrial levels. COP26 is the 10th climate conference Lisa Friedman, a reporter on our Climate desk, has covered. It is the first for Lyndsey Layton, the desks deputy editor.

title: Why Democrats May Have a Long Wait if They Lose Their Grip on Washington
description: Usually, its the party out of power that frets about whether it will ever win again. This time, its the party in control of government thats staring into the political wilderness.

title: She Wrote About the Family Babysitter
description: Name: Flora Collins

title: The Kiss to End All Kisses
description: Elisabeth Rhm and Peter Glatzer met in 2015 at the Los Angeles home of their mutual friend, the producer Robbie Brenner. If it wasnt an immediate love connection, there was certainly a strong like.

title: You Are the Object of a Secret Extraction Operation
description: Facebook is not just any corporation. It reached trillion-dollar status in a single decade by applying the logic of what I call surveillance capitalism  an economic system built on the secret extraction and manipulation of human data  to its vision of connecting the entire world. Facebook and other leading surveillance capitalist corporations now control information flows and communication infrastructures across the world.

title: The One Was Actually Number 30
description: A methodical approach to dating, an open-mindedness about baseball and a mutual appreciation for a wager. These were a few of the elements that led Petra Schaefer and Bruce Hunsaker to fall in love.

title: 275 Minutes on Hold: Why Airline Customer Service Still Cant Keep Up
description: After Southwest Airlines canceled his familys flight on Oct. 9, Tyler Reece Maness realized that his best option was to drive 18 hours from Oklahoma City to Orlando, Fla. Thats the only way his 7-year-old daughter would make it to Boo Bash, Disney Worlds $159-a-person Halloween event, the following night.

title: The Mainstream Media Has a Republican Party Problem
description: Making it harder to vote, and harder to understand what the party is really about  these are two parts of the same project for the Republican Party, Jay Rosen writes. The conflict with honest journalism is structural. To be its dwindling self, the G.O.P. has to also be at war with the press, unless of course the press folds under pressure.

title: Will the Britney Spears Conservatorship End Today?
description: Britney Spears has made no secret of late how she feels about the court-approved conservatorship that oversees her life: She wants it gone. In a complete turnaround, the pop singers father  long the official steward of the legal arrangement, often over her objections in public and private  has come to agree.

title: They (Kind of) Have His Father to Thank for a First Date
description: For his first date with Elizabeth Comer, Dr. Denrick Kimathi Cooper Jr. had to ask his dad for a favor.

title: Now TV Wants Nielsen to Measure Up
description: TV executives have been complaining about Nielsen for years, saying their shows have more viewers than they get credit for. They have also claimed that Nielsen, the 98-year-old research firm whose name is practically synonymous with TV ratings, uses antiquated technology that hasnt kept up with viewers who have moved away from cable and network TV.

title: Joe Manchin, This Is What We Cant Afford
description: At the beginning of the year, Democrats knew they had a rare opportunity to make transformational change. With control of the White House and Congress, they stuffed ambitious programs meant to address decades of inaction on child care, paid leave, poverty, housing, the climate  and to cover holes in our health care system  into a single package.

title: The Stakes Are Sky-High for a Ring Coming to the Met Opera
description: LONDON  When the curtain rises on English National Operas first installment of a new Ring cycle on Nov. 19, Richard Jones, its director, will be hoping that the third times a charm.

title: Will Zephyr Teachout Finally Have Her Moment?
description: In the three years since she last ran for office, Zephyr Teachout has taught, written a book (Break Em Up: Recovering Our Freedom from Big Ag, Big Tech, and Big Money), stumped for progressive female candidates, advised Congress and prosecutors across the country on antitrust issues, given birth for the first time at the age of 47, and watched her adversary Andrew Cuomo expelled from the kingdom.

title: How the Editor of Bon Apptit Spends Her Sundays
description: For the November issue of Bon Apptit, Dawn Davis, the culinary magazines editor in chief, wrote about her preference for Thanksgiving sides over turkey, mentioning recipes like chorizo and Calabrian chile stuffing and garlic-miso butter mashed potatoes.

title: On Rikers Island, a Doctor Who Tends to the Oldest and Sickest
description: Five years ago, Dr. Rachael Bedard was finishing a fellowship in geriatrics and palliative care at a hospital in Manhattan when she began to wonder if there were elderly detainees in need of care just across the East River, at Rikers Island.

title: For Arab Americans, Its Not Thanksgiving Without Hashweh
description: Rasha AlMahroos thinks of her Thanksgiving table and chuckles: A big turkey sits in the center, and right next to it, as if hiding under its wing, a very small chicken.

title: What Bosses Really Think About the Future of the Office
description: People think about the office differently now  including the C.E.O.s who for so long kept a watchful eye on which workers were at their desks.

title: What Does It Take to Build a Disaster-Proof House?
description: When a massive wildfire swept through Paradise, Calif., three years ago this week, it killed 85 people and destroyed more than 13,000 homes. The wood chalet-style cabin where Mike and Jennifer Petersen lived  built by Ms. Petersens grandparents in the 1960s  was one of those homes.

title: Saving the Forgotten Connecticut Farm That Helped Spark M.L.K.s Dream
description: In the 1940s, a group of Morehouse College students came up from Atlanta to work on tobacco farms in Connecticuts Farmington Valley as part of a tuition assistance program.

title: More Teams Are Contenders This Womens College Basketball Season
description: As the college basketball season began in earnest this week, the front-runners in the womens game  Stanford, Maryland, South Carolina and Connecticut  have, like usual, imposed their will on weak nonconference opponents. But as the season gets deeper into its schedule, those powerhouses can expect more competition in their pursuit of an N.C.A.A. championship.

title: Hong Kong Broadcasters Swift Turn From Maverick Voice to Official Mouthpiece
description: HONG KONG  Not long after Patrick Li took over as the government-appointed director of Hong Kongs public broadcaster, a digital lock pad appeared outside his office entrance.

title: Yemenis in Brooklyn Reclaim High-End Coffee
description: Hakim Sulaimani remembers exactly where he was when he first heard that his homeland, the poorest country in the Middle East, had invented one of the most popular drinks in the world.

title: The 2021 New York Times/New York Public Library Best Illustrated Childrens Books Winners at Work
description: Each year, we work with the New York Public Library to administer the honor now called The New York Times/New York Public Library Best Illustrated Childrens Books Award. Heres a look at each of the winning artists at work.

title: A Nike Executive Told of Once Killing a Man. Heres What He Left Out.
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Hong Kongs M+ Museum Is Finally Open. Its Already in Danger.
description: HONG KONG  M+, Hong Kongs sprawling new contemporary art museum, ran into problems from the start. Billed as Asias premier visual institution, it was four years behind schedule and an undisclosed amount over budget. Several top executives departed during the decade-long development period. At one point, an 80-foot-wide sinkhole formed on the construction site.

title: He Stalks Delirious, Unfinished New York as It Rises
description: The British artist Nick Relph likes to wander New York under cover of night, loitering in the vicinity of the citys ubiquitous construction fences, doing a thing that seems at first glance  especially if you are a police officer  immediately identifiable.

title: Billie Eilish, Steven Spielberg and Miley Cyrus at LACMA Gala
description: The Los Angeles County Museum of Art drew a whos who of Hollywood stars and artists to its 10th annual Art+Film Gala on Nov. 6; the Gucci-sponsored event honored Amy Sherald, Kehinde Wiley and Steven Spielberg. The literary world gathered at the New York Public Librarys annual gala on Nov. 8.; this years Library Lions were Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, Tina Brown, Jonathan Lethem and Darren Walker. And the Art Dealers Association of America held a preview benefit for the Henry Street Settlement at the Park Avenue Armory on Nov. 3.

title: Black Farmworkers Say They Lost Jobs to Foreigners Who Were Paid More
description: INDIANOLA, Miss.
